loans.name: Peluce

texts.en: Peluce is a 23-year-old lady who is married with one child. She lives in her own permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. Her dream is to have a God-fearing family and also have sustainable income for the family. Peluce has been dealing in agriculture farming for six years and has seen noteworthy changes in her investments. For example, she has been able to buy land and enlarge her house amidst the challenge of fluctuating prices and weather changes. Peluce needs the loan to buy chicks for her poultry farm in order to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy chicks for her poultry farm business.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao N., 36, is married and lives with her husband in the province of Takeo. She and her husband sell fruit at the local market and are able to make about $3 of profit a day. This couple has six children; three are in school and one is working in construction. Mao N. plans to take out a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport fruit and sell around the village. So, after taking out this loan, she will sell fruit at the market and her husband will ride the moto and sell around the village.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Tumbayar

texts.en: Tumbayar S. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Hovd province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest two daughters are unemployed and her youngest three children attend the local school. Tumbayar and her husband operate a cafe in a rented space at the local market in their town. Their cafe specializes in making a variety of traditional Mongolian meals using livestock intestines and is a popular dining establishment in their community. She started her cafe in 2005 and has gained significant experience over the years. Tumbayar is a modest and kind-hearted woman. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase her working capital for the cafe.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Zaydullo

texts.en:
Zaydullo D. was born and raised in the Republic of Tajikistan. He grew up in a large family and, from early childhood, he helped his parents in the field where his family cultivated vegetables. After serving in the army, Zaydullo returned home and began to work as a cinema operator.  He was 30 years old when he married, and he became the father of five children.  
In 1995, Zaydullo moved with his family to Kyrgyzstan. Using the money he had earned, he bought a house and started to work at the local state farm.  In order to find additional means of subsistence for his large family, Zaydullo decided to engage in cattle breeding and cultivating vegetables on the plot of land.  Using his starting capital of 3,000 KGS, he managed to raise his floating capital and earn 4,000 KGS monthly. Today, his farm has three bull-calves and still needs to be developed. For this purpose, Zaydullo plans to use this loan of 50,000 KGS to increase the number of cattle on his farm. Eventually,  Zaydullo plans to provide higher education for his children and build a house for his family. Being a very purposeful and positive person, Zaydullo works hard to support his family and provide them with a prosperous future.
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.
Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Rose Jemeli

texts.en:
Rose Jemeli L., 39, is married to Julius L., a hotel manager in Nairobi, Kenya. Rose lives in Kipchamo, in the outskirts of Eldoret, with her six children. She is a dairy farmer and also sells cereal around her home area. She has been in this business for eleven years and earns a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Rose's fourth loan with KADET Ltd. With it, she wants to buy another cow, as well as more cereal for resale. She plans to use the money generated to raise her family's living standard.

In the future, Rose hopes to improve her dairy farming business by making sure the cows are well taken care of and to educate all of her children to university level.

loans.use: To buy a cow and cereal for resale.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat resides in Multan which is located in Punjab province of Pakistan and famous for its shrines and hot weather. She lives there in a two room brick house in the area of Yaqoob town with her family. She came here 15 years ago.

A talented lady, Nusrat operates an embroidery business from her home where she completes the orders of embroidery of her neighborhood clients and earns an income for her family. She is very good in her skills and crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes which attract more customers. 

Her husband is a private entrepreneur who runs a cigarette and pan (betel leaf) shop in the market and serves his customers. Nusrat and her husband work very hard to fulfill the basic needs of the family.

Nusrat has 5 sons. Her eldest son works in a small restaurant while younger one makes furniture and others stay at home. Nusrat couldn’t provide education to her sons due to poor financial conditions but she is thankful to God that her elder children are doing work to financially support the family. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will put more brands of cigarettes and pan (betel leaf) in his shop for selling.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raising hand is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes and pan (betel leaf) to sell.

loans.name: Mayra Del Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Mayra del Rosario E. G. ella es trabajadora activa del Colegio Público “EL Salto” de San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Docente tiene  Dieciséis  años  de trabajar para esta institución como docente de la educación primaria, es casada actualmente  tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  once créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mayra del Rosario E. G. works as a teacher at El Salto School in San Rafael del Sur.  She has been working as an elementary school teacher in this school for sixteen years.  She is married and has two school-age children.

Mayra has had eleven loans from CEPRODEL and has used each one to buy building supplies such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc. in order to extend and improve her home.  Ceprodel's loans have been very useful to her since they have enabled her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy building supplies: sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Yamilett Del Socorro

texts.es: Yamilett Del Socorro tiene 22 años, su actividad económica es la venta de comida. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar desde muy joven. Cuando inicio fue por los conocimientos de su Mama así fue que ella logro aprender lo necesario y adquirir experiencia para fortalecer su trabajo, pues ella siempre sea preocupado por su familia como son sus 2 hijos que les proporciona el alimento diario y además mejorar su condición de vida. El financiamiento que actualmente solicita es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, frutas y verduras. Su deseo es poder proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Yamilett Del Socorro is 22 years old; her economic activity is food sales.  She’s been in this business for over 5 years; she has enjoyed working since she was very young.  When she started out it was thanks to her mother’s knowledge; this was how she gradually acquired the necessary skills and experience to be better at her work.  She has always cared for her family, which are two children, providing their daily food and improving their living conditions.  The loan she’s asking for on this occasion is to buy rice, beans, fruit and vegetables.  Her wish is to be able to do some home improvements.

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: María Elisa

texts.es: La Sra. María M. es trabajadora activa  del colegio los Gutiérrez norte es maestra de primaria tiene seis años de labora para esta institución está acompañada con su pareja, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, zinc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ha  mejorado su condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Maria Martinez is an active employee of the school Gutierrez Norte and she has been working as a primary school teacher for the past six years. She is married and she has two school-aged children. She has had three past loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and each one has been used to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, rocks, gravel, zinc, with the goal of expanding and improving her house. The loans granted through Ceprodel have been a great help because she has been able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sand, rocks, gravel, and zinc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy modern tools and hire students in his shop to help him in his work

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a single woman with two school-going children. They live in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past seven years, she has operated a beverage-selling business. She sells retail to passersby and the neighbouring community. 

Zeinab faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  With the Kshs 25,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase beverages for sale.

loans.use: To purchase beverages for resale.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
El Sr. Pascual es propietario de una despensa en Santa María Misiones y cuenta con clientela formada en el barrio, es conocido por su buena atención, y por contar con todas las necesidades básicas para el uso del hogar, es casado, y trabaja conjuntamente con su familia en su negocio, ha trabajado desde hace años en la misma actividad.
El optó por el crédito con la Fundación Paraguaya para adquirir más mercaderías para su negocio a fin de proporcionar a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos.
El cliente de Kiva manifiesta su satisfacción por trabajar con la Fundación por el apoyo al desarrollo y crecimiento para su actividad.
Espera poder contar con la ayuda de los inversionistas para la compra de mercaderías para despensa como panificados, fideos, bebidas, etc.
texts.en:
Pascual is the owner of a store in Santa María Misiones and he has regualr customers in the neighborhood. He is known for his good service and for having the basic neccesities for the home. He is married and works with his family in the business. He has worked for years in the same activity.  

He decided to get the loan from Fundación Paraguaya to acquire more merchandise for his business in order to provide his customers with a variety of products. This Kiva client shows his satisfaction for the support with the development and growth of his activity. 

He hopes to be able to count on the help of the investors to buy merchandise for the store, such as baked goods,

loans.use: to buy merchandise fo a store, such as baked goods, pasta, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 33, married, and a father of one. He and his family live in Gitaru in Kikuyu which is in the outskirts of Nairobi. This is where he has been running his two business; tailoring and an agency for Equity Bank. 

He operates the agency business while his wife takes care of the tailoring business. He has been in this business for a period of five years now, and earns a good income. With this loan, he plans to buy float for the Equity agency business. 

He has never borrowed from other financial institutions and this is his third loan with KADET. He has paid off his previous loans well and on time. He plans to establish a big chain of business in the next five years and also be in a position to invest more in his child's education.

loans.use: to buy float for Equity Banking business.

loans.name: John Kiiru

texts.en:
John has been practicing farming in Naivasha town for the last four years.  He is 46 years-old, married to Jane Wambui and they have four children.  

John was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by one of our field officers.  This will be his first loan.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 50 years old and married. He has seven adult-aged children. Romeo is a farmer working in the Philippines. He earns PHP 10,000 per month. 

Romeo is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow. Romeo has been growing rice for almost 28 years.

In the future, Romeo hopes that his farming business will become more progressive and support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: For the past 20 years, Ama has been selling smoked fish in Elmina. She is a widow and has four children. She is solely responsible for the feeding, clothing, and education of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more curtains of fresh fish to smoke for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children and to reinvest in her business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy more curtains of fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Jorge Mario

texts.es: La cría de cerdos para la venta es un negocio de tradición familiar, pues Jorge Mario de origen campesino del municipio de Titiribí en Antioquia aprendió desde pequeño al lado de su padre las actividades propias del campo. Su negocio es la fuente de sustento de este emprendedor su esposa y sus dos hijos. Jorge actualmente necesita de un préstamo para pagar los cerdos que hace poco adquirió y para comprar concentrado que le permita engordarlos más rápidamente y generar ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Raising pigs to sell is the family’s traditional occupation because Jorge Mario is a farmer from Titiribí in Antioquia.  He learned farming chores alongside his father while still a little boy.  His business is his source of support for this entrepreneur, his wife and their two children.  

Jorge currently needs a loan to pay for some pigs he acquired recently and to buy feed that will make it possible for him to fatten them up more quickly and generate income to improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for acquired pigs and to buy feed.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married and a mother of four school-age dependents. She is 42 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Evangeline is involved in the manufacturing business. She makes and sells furniture to earn a living. Evangeline supports her family with this activity, which she has been doing for five years. She earns a total of PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase materials for furniture making. 

Evangeline has been member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Evangeline hopes to expand her business and change her way of living.

loans.use: To purchase materials for furniture making.

loans.name: Jesefa Del Rosario

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Rocafuerte. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Josefa, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos los mismos que  ya son mayores de edad pero  dos de ellos aun viven con ella, Su esposo hace algún tiempo sufre de una enfermedad y no trabaja. Uno de sus hijos estudia medicina.

Produce y vende dulces de distintos sabores y formas, además también se dedica a la venta de sabanas y sobrecamas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 14h0 en la fabricación y venta de dulces y por las tardes recorre con sus sabanas las mismas que las va a comprar directamente de la fabrica. Nos cuenta que lleva varios años que se dedica a este negocio y que gracias a Dios le ha dado para sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más materia prima para preparar los dulces como azúcar, chocolate, frutas, etc. también va a comprar  Sabanas, y sobrecamas.  Este es el quinto ciclo en el  Banco comunal y le agrada el Banco por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por las facilidades para los créditos.
 
Sus sueños es ver que su hijo  terminen sus estudios y  que sea un gran medico.
texts.en:
The members of the Rocafuerte communal bank get together in the Rocafuerte settlement every two weeks.  This area is known for its delicious sweets prepared by the local people and are known throughout the country.  

Here we meet 53 year old Josefa.  She is married and has four adult children, but two of them still live with her.  Her husband has been sick for some time and is not able to work.  One of their children is a medical student.

She makes and sells sweets of different flavors and types.  She also sells sheets and bedspreads door to door.  She works every day from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm making and selling sweets and in the evenings she sells the sheets that she buys directly from the factory.  She tells us that she has been doing this for several years and thanks to God she has been able to get her children ahead in life.

She will use this loan to buy more supplies, such as sugar, chocolate, fruit, etc. to prepare her sweets.  She will also buy sheets and bedspreads.  This will be her communal bank’s fifth cycle and she is grateful for the additional benefits that the institution provides through the ease of obtaining loans.

Her dream is to see her son graduate from medical school and become a great doctor.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires and repair the seats

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es: Cristian, tiene la edad 28 de  años, está casado y vive con su esposa y  un hijo. El pretende con el crédito realizar el mantenimiento de su plantación de café. El cuenta con una plantación de café y pretende invertir en abonos, mano de obra y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha. El quiere implantar un buen cafetal para vender un café de calidad. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de producción café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Cristian is 28 years old, is married and lives with his wife and son. He would like to use the loan for the upkeep of his coffee plantation. He owns a coffee plantation and would use the loan to pay for labour costs and to buy fertilizers and fungicides to improve his harvest. He wants to establish a good coffee plantation in order to sell a quality product. He wants to maximise his profits for the benefit of him and his family and to expand his coffee production business. This is his first loan with FUNDECOSUR. He has never taken a loan from any state bank. However, FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with the very good terms and conditions and at a very low rate of interest.

loans.use: to improve his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a farmer who owns and tills land in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is 50 years old and is a married woman with 8 children. Jocelyn’s husband is also a farmer. They grow rice crops on their land and sell their harvest at the market.

Jocelyn has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. She hopes that her family will have a better quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Filipenses 4:13 Group

texts.en: Iris leads this loan group, which is called Filipenses 4:13 (Philippians). The group is maD. up of 10 women who run their own businesses in the town of Puerto Plata, a tourist center in the north of the country. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children and their father. She earns a living by running a beauty salon, and is excited to be taking out her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid two previous loans and using them to expand her business. She started her business eight years ago after spending one year working for a friend while becoming a beautician. She plans to use her portion of this loan to buy beauty products and another hair dryer. She will use the profits she earns to buy her children school supplies and invest in her business. Her main challenge is paying rent, and she dreams one day of buying her own home. She enjoys working for her family and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Sintus

texts.en:
Sintus is a 35-year-old man and married to Febi, a 30-year-old lady. They have three kids: Juionto, 9, Seleste, 7, both still at primary school and Tuti, 5, not at school yet. 

Sintus makes a living by being a farmer. His farmland is located about 3 km from his residence. He plants lettuce and cabbage on the farm. The income generated from his own farm is insufficient to fully cover his family needs. Therefore, he also assists other farmers in cultivating their farms and gets paid from the profit. 

Sintus is planning to hire a rice field to cultivate but he doesn’t have money to do so. He then met TLM’s field officer who informed him of TLM’s lending program. He is interested in joining the individual lending program and is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 5,000,000. He wants to hire the rice field to be cultivated for 5 years. He really hopes that TLM will approve his loan application, so he will be able to improve his family's life.

loans.use: to hire a rice field to cultivate.

loans.name: Leida Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor de 25 años, es una trabajadora que tiene muchas aspiraciones de crecimiento en su negocio.

Ella brinda servicios de internet en la cuál realiza trabajos como: investigaciones, escaneo, etc.

Su negocio empezó hace 8 meses, ahora ella cuenta con dos computadoras  para realizar más tareas en internet, su horario de atención es de lunes a  domingo de 9am hasta las 7pm.

Ella solicita este préstamo para invertir más en su negocio e incrementar su área de trabajo.

El sueño de ella es mejorar su negocio e implementar más accesorios de trabajo de internet.
texts.en:
Leonor, 25, is a worker who wants her business to grow.

She offers internet service such as research, scanning, etc.  She started her business eight months ago.  Now she has two computers to do more internet work.  Her work schedule is from Monday through Sunday from 9 a.m. until 7 p.m.

She is requesting this loan to invest more in her business and increase her area of work.

Her dream is to improve her business and implement more accessibility to internet work.

loans.use: to buy a monitor, a printer, and keyboards.

loans.name: Lafoai

texts.en:
Lafoai is 55 years of age and married with five children. She has owned and operated a business selling soft drinks in the local community for 4 years. Lafoai needs a loan of WST $2500 to to purchase a refrigerator for storage of drinks. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 WST or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Lafoai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Lafoai's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for storage of drinks

loans.name: Rafo

texts.ru: Рафо более 11 лет занимается изготовлением национальных курпачи и матрасов, а также шитьем узоров на наволочках. Когда её муж открыл цех по выпуску напитков, она ему помогала. Затем она самостоятельно открыло свой цех по шитьем матрасов, и она приняла на работу сестру и дочку. Они втроем по заказу шьют. Жители которые хотят сыграть свадьбу заказывает им курпачу. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки ваты и тканей для шитьем курпачи и национальных матрасов.
texts.en: Rafo has worked for more than eleven years making kurpachas (traditional velvet rugs) and mattresses, and embroidering pillow cases. She also helped her husband when he opened a beverage factory. After that, she opened her own workshop to sew mattresses, hiring her daughter and her sister. The three of them do custom work for clients. Customers who are planning weddings go to them to place orders for kurpachas. Rafo would like a loan of 3,000 TJS to purchase cotton and fabric to sew kurpachas and mattresses.

loans.use: to purchase cotton and fabrics

loans.name: Peace And Unity Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Peace and Unity” group. They are small-business women based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Marie. Marie is age 34; she was born in Magburaka, where she currently resides together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a teacher and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Marie has been a businesswoman for more than 10 years now. She sells clothes, jeans, shoes, dishes, etc. With her share of this loan, Marie will expand her business by buying the abovementioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, jeans, shoes, dishes, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Hamad

texts.en: Hamad is a 43 year old married man with six sons and one daughter. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Hamad wants to purchase some necessary home appliances such as a stove and refrigerator, but the amount of money he has isn't enough so he needs to take a loan amount of $1,500 from FATEN. When Hamad gets the loan, he will be able to purchase the appliances the family needs. This will change his family's life positively and provide them with better and easier living conditions. Hamad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase new home appliances.

loans.name: Venicio

texts.es: El señor Venicio nació en Valle grande,   hace 29 años que vive y trabaja agricultura, en villa florida distante a 20 km de el torno, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra: maíz, maní y camote, todo lo que el produce lo vende en el mismo lugar donde vive y trabaja ya que el vende sus productos directamente del productor al consumidor , el señor Venicio ya viene trabajando 6 secuencias con la institución, esta es su única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia, solicita el crédito para el arado Manual de la tierra compra de semillas para la siembre de maíz , fumigado y cosecha de maní el por lo cual se siente muy agradecidó por el apoyo que la institución le brinda para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señor Venicio was born in the Valle Grande. He has been living and working as a farmer for 29 years in Villa Florida, 20 kms from el Torno. He is a farmer and plants: corn, peanuts and sweet potatoes all of which he sells where he lives and works as he sells his products directly from producer to consumer. Señor Venicio has already had 6 loan cycles with the institution. This is his sole source of support for his family. He is asking for the loan to hand plough the land, buy corn seeds for planting, crop-spray and harvest the peanut crop. He is very grateful for the support that the institution is giving him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, spray and harvest the peanut crop.

loans.name: Azizkan

texts.ru: Азизкан 51 год, замужем.  Азизкан работает учителем в местной школе, муж – лесник местного лесного хозяйства. После распада Советского Союза, в поисках дополнительного источника финансирования для своей семьи, Азизкан начала свой бизнес в разведении скота. Использовав стартовую сумму в 500 советских рублей, Азизкан смогла развить хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день 4 коровы, 10 овец и одну лошадь, приносящее около 15,000 сом ( KGS) от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Азизкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. В ближайшем будущем, Азизкан планирует вложить доходы в увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Azizkan is 51 years old and married. Azizkan works as a teacher in the local school. Her husband is a forest ranger. After the collapse of the Soviet Union,  Azizkan started her cattle breeding business in order to make more money for her family. With her start-up capital of 500 Soviet rubles, Azizkan started her farm, which now has four cows, ten sheep, and one horse, producing about 15,000 som from the sale of milk and dairy products. In order to further develop her business, Azizkan contacted Bai - Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som to purchase additional livestock. In the near future, Azizkan plans to invest any revenue to increase her number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Ms Hoa is taking out this student loan for her son, An, who is attending the Informatics Technology University. His area is computer programming. When he was a child, An was keen on computers and working with them. Currently, he is studying hard to have good knowledge.

He hopes that he will have a good job and work for a computer company in two years. During his study, his parents create favorable conditions for him to study. Currently, he wants to have a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnamese dong to pay for tuition fees and for buying supplies.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and for buying supplies.

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en:
Intisar, 38 years old, is a married woman with no children. She is an employee at one of the governmental entities. 

Beside her job, Intisar opened a small shop selling stationery items and cosmetics products. She has applied for a loan to increase the quantity of cosmetics at her shop and enhance the internal decoration.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of cosmetics at her shop and enhance the internal decoration.

loans.name: Maryuris Esther

texts.es: Maryuris de 37 años es una madre soltera de dos jóvenes de 19 y 16 años de edad, ellas residen en una humilde vivienda ubicada en un barrio del municipio de Soledad.  En el año 2011 emprendió su negocio con la venta de mercancías varias por encargos y aunque su principal desafió fue el escaso capital de trabajo, logró establecer en su vivienda negocios alternos para incrementar sus ingresos entre ellos venta de cervezas, comidas rápidas y elaboración de decoraciones para cualquier eventualidad. Ella realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar un nuevo carro de comidas rápidas y surtirse con nuevas colecciones de prendas de vestir para responder a los encargos de su clientela. Maryuris es una emprendedora mujer que ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijas a pesar de no contar con un cónyuge que la apoye, ella es un ejemplo de mujer cabeza de hogar que con valentía y amor lo entrega todo por sus hijas.

loans.use: comprar un nuevo carro de comidas rápidas y surtirse con nuevas colecciones de prendas de vestir para responder a los encargos de su clientela

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.en:
Sixteen years ago Rosaura decided to start selling cosmetics and shoes by catalogue given their difficult economic situation. Her husband\'s income as a driver was modest. They have 4 children that need an education. Through this business the family\'s welfare has been established and an education for their children has been secured. Strength, enthusiasm, and perseverence are the qualities that define Rosaura and, with the support of her family, she has been able to achieve her goals.

She requires a loan of $250 to purchase more items for resale, to increase her sales. You have the power to help her and her family. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 16 años Rosaura decidió comenzara vender cosméticos y zapatos por catalogo, debido a las dificultades que enfrentaban por el poco sueldo que su esposo, quien es chofer, percibía. Pues tienen 4 hijos quienes requieren de educación. Esta actividad ha ayudado mucho al bienestar de la familia y asegura la educación de sus hijos. Fortaleza, entusiasmo y perseverancia son cualidades que definen a Rosaura y ella con el apoyo de su familia ha logrado lo que se ha propuesto.

Ella esta requiriendo de un préstamo de $250 DLLS para poder comprar más mercancía y de esta forma incrementar sus ventas. Tu tienes la posibilidad de ayudarla, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia sells peanuts, garlic and tamarind. She began her business with savings that she was able to take from a harvest of potatoes that she had on her land. In the beginning, she only sold peanuts. Now she continues to sell that product along with beans, lentils, garbanzo beans, and a variety of dried grains. She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise at wholesale prices in order to be more competitive in the market and to increase profits. Delia hopes to purchase another stand in the market to sell vegetables. She has faith that this with this additional product her business will grow and she will have economic stability. Delia is 30 years old, and she is sure that this loan will give her security and will allow her to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Delia vende maní, ajo, tamarindo. Empezó su negocio con un ahorro que obtuvo con un sombrío de papas que tenia en su tierra. Al principio solo vendía maní. Ahora vende este producto junto con fréjol, lenteja y garbanzos y una variedad de granos secos.. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar mercadería a precios de mayoristas para así ser mas competitivos en el mercado y poder tener mejores ganancias. Delia aspira comprarse otro puesto en el mercado para vender legumbres. Ella tiene la fe que con este nuevo producto su negocio crecerá y tendrá estabilidad económica. Delia esta casado tiene tres hijos dos de ellos estudian. Tiene 30 años, esta segura que este préstamo le dará seguridad y le permitirá ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise at wholesale prices

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Maria is thirty-two years old and has six children.  Due to family circumstances, she never finished her schooling and was for some time unemployed.  When she heard about SPBD, she joined because she felt like this would be a way for her to begin to earn a living and provide for her children.  She used her first and second loans to launch and expand her flea market stall.  She buys merchandise from large companies in the big town and resells to the villagers at the local market, ensuring that even the villagers have access to these products.  Mostly, she sells shoes, perfumes, sunglasses and hair accessories.  Maria is a good businesswoman and has grown her business successfully.  She feels that she can increase her profits further if she can expand her product line yet again.  A loan to Maria will help her do that.  Given Maria’s own experience, she is passionate about ensuring her six children complete their education.

loans.use: Merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Sadet

texts.en: Sadet is 50 years old, and the mother of two children. They live in Khachmaz town, where she provides shops with clothes. Every day, Sadet goes to shops and provides them with the clothes they need. She uses the money earned to cover her family’s expenses. She would like a loan of $600 to purchase more clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
G. Harriet is 42 years old. She is married and has four biological children and five dependants. One of her children has finished college and is working while the rest are in secondary school.

She operates a stationery shop in Kawuku trading centre on Kampala- Entebbe road. She started this business way back in 1992 after working for her auntie in the same business for more than six years. Besides selling scholastic materials, she rears pigs and chicken. She received her first loan of US$30 in 1998. Ever since then, she has been accessing loans from Feed The Children Uganda till October 2006 when it changed to operate as PEARL Microfinance Ltd.

G. has taken out loans ranging from US$110- 400 and has paid back all these loans promptly. She gets work for typing from Nkumba University students who reside in the neighbourhood.

loans.use: To buy a new computer to be able to handle the increased work load from her printing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying showcare and hangers

loans.name: Sisi

texts.en: Sisi is a nineteen year-old lady from the village of Sagafili Mulifanua. She is running a small business and she sells bags of popcorn at the village primary school. The school is open five days of the week and therefore she sells five days only. Sisi prefers to sell her stuff at the school compound which she thinks is a better market than anywhere else. Sisi finished school last year and then she stayed home to look after her parents. She wanted something to do and when she heard about the SPBD loan program, she thought that this would be a good help for her and the family. She is waiting for her first loan and this money will be used to buy bags, a gas oven and ingredients for the pop corn business. She is an active member and she is making a good start already.

loans.use: To buy an oven, gas, pots and ingredients for her popcorn business

loans.name: Thi Nhan

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nhàn lives in Nghiêm Xá village of Chờ towship, Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh province. She runs a food stand where she serves rice dishes. Beside that she uses leftover from her food stand as feed for her stock of 20 pigs. Normally, she keeps pigs for 3 months then sells them for nice profit. She would like to borrow money to upgrade the food stand and be able to serve more variety of dishes. Everyday income can be used for repayments. Before, she took out loan from a bank and had to pay in lump sum. Now, at Binh Minh, she just needs to pay small installments that she prefers.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nhàn trú tại thôn Nghiêm Xá, Thị trấn Chờ, huyện Yên Phong, tỉnh Bắc Ninh từ nhiều năm nay. Nghề chính của chị là bán hàng cơm cũng đã được 10 năm. Bên cạnh đó, vợ chồng chị còn tận dụng thức ăn thừa để nuôi 20 con lợn, sau 3 tháng bán đi, chị thu được khoản lãi đáng kể. Vay vốn đợt này, chị mong muốn có tiền để hỗ trợ cho công việc kinh doanh của mình như nâng cấp cửa hàng, đa dạng hoá món ăn... Bán hàng hàng ngày chị có thể tiết kiệm để trả dần. Trước kia, chị đã tham gia vay vốn ở Ngân hàng nhưng bây giờ chị thích tham gia vay vốn trả dần hơn. Vì theo chị, nó giúp chị tiết kiệm tốt hơn và chị có điều kiện để nuôi các cháu ăn học

loans.use: Upgrade a food stand

loans.name: Vahida

texts.en:
Vahida is a 50-year-old woman who lives in a village called Šišići near the town of Živinice. She is married and her husband is retired and has a very small monthly pension. This is her second loan through MCO WWI, this time in the amount of US$ 1,125.

Vahida and her son have opened a coffee bar and they want to use this loan to renovate it. In this way she will ensure a workplace and a regular income source for her son and their household.

loans.use: Renovation of their coffee bar

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Ms. Felipa is a simple woman, a single mother with four daughters, abandoned by her husband. Her daughters help her with the gathering of fabric remnants, which she uses for the manufacture of mattresses to make a living for the family. She lives in a remote area of the extremely cold city of El Alto, where the family occupies a single room. She has a good credit history to date and makes her payments timely.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Felipa es una persona muy sencilla; es madre soltera con 4 hijas, ya que su esposo se fue D. la casa. Sus hijas le ayudan en la recolección D. telas en retazo, que usa para la elaboración D. colchones. Estos ingresos le permiten subsistir. Ella vive en una zona muy alejada D. la ciudad D. El Alto, en donD. el clima es muy frío; ocupa una habitación con toda su familia. Tiene un historial crediticio muy bueno a la fecha, y no presenta problemas D. pago.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric remnants.

loans.name: Sam Ath

texts.en: Mrs. Sam Ath C. is a wedding chef in the Prey Tachap Village of the Kampong Speu Province. She is 36 years old, and she is the mother of five children. Three of her children attend school, while the other two children are still too young to work and/or study. Her husband, Rin Kheav, pictured on the right of the photo, is a poultry breeder in the village. Mrs. Sam Ath C. spends her family's limited income on her children’s education and other family expenses. She already received one loan from AMK to purchase groceries to sell, and she proudly claims that her repayments were always made on time. Last June, her husband contracted a serious disease, hemiplegia, which caused him to be hospitalized and ultimately cost the family approximately $1,000. Fortunately, he is currently in good health, and he is able to work once again. Presently, Mrs. Sam Ath Chch is seeking a loan to build a chicken stall in the back yard.

loans.use: To construct a chicken stall in the family's back yard.

loans.name: Parween

texts.en: Parween lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a widow of five years and the sole breadwinner for her two sons and two daughters. She is an experienced tailor who currently works in her home, but her clients have asked her to open a tailoring shop. Thus, she seeks an individual loan to purchase the necessary startup materials and start working in her own shop, thereby providing her with more opportunities and securing her family's future. She would like to thank Kiva lenders for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials for her shop

loans.name: Dot

texts.en:
Mr. Dot T., 31, and his wife, Mrs. Chantha Youm, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2003 and have three sons. Mrs. Chantha stays at home to take care of the children

Dot has been a motor trailer taxi (Tok Tok) driver in Phnom Penh for over a year, and he also sells cows with his father. His trailer is broken and he needs some money to buy a new one. Dot is requesting a loan to purchase a trailer to replace the old one, so that he can continue driving a motor trailer taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for a motor trailer taxi (Tok Tok).

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina I. is single and lives in Melitopol, where she owns a vending kiosk. For the past four years she has sold bijouterie (jewelry, trinkets, etc.), wigs, and other small things for women. She has had wonderful business experiences so far and would now like to open a new vending facility in the train station market. Currently she has a gross monthly income of about $1200 which she uses to support her parents.

Having already invested $3600 in her business, Marina would like to continue to develop her enterprise. To accomplish this goal, Marina is requesting a loan of $550, to be repaid in two months. This loan would allow her to open the new kiosk and have a more stable income to support herself and her parents.

Marina has received financial assistance in the past from Nadiya Ukraine and has repaid all previous loans on time.

loans.use: To open a new vending facility at a train station market.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Neema is a 35-year-old married woman with four young children. She owns a Mama Lishe, or local cafe, in the Kinondoni area of Dar es Salaam thatshe runs with an additional employee. When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

Neema is requesting $US350 to purchase additional stocks of sugar, wheat and maize flour, rice, and beans to enable her to serve more customers in the future and thus hopefully increase her profits from the cafe.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Euk

texts.en:
Euk L., 28, is a rice farmer who resides with her children in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Collecting output is hard this year because the weather has been bad in the past year. Most of the provinces have no irrigation systems yet, so farmers have to farm by depending on the sky. They all are very happy when the clouds are dark but if there is no rain they will face crop damage.

Euk L. normally makes US$ 3 each day. Her husband since 2001 has a business as a motor-taxi driver to earn a living and is able to make US$ 4 a day as well. This couple together has two children. Euk L. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business

loans.name: Valasiolaga

texts.en: Valasiologa B., 34, is single with no children.  She has many years of experience in the store business. She sells to the public 7 days a week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Valasiologo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to buy a box of mutton flaps, chicken legs, sausages, pots, teapots, a new oven and other materials used in her business. Her older sister is helping her run the business.

loans.use: purchasing a box of mutton flaps, chicken legs, sausages, pots, teapots, a new oven and other materials used in her business

loans.name: Yousos

texts.en:
Mr. Yousos K., 36, (shown in the picture on the right) is single and lives with his sister's family and their parents. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. His sister and her husband are fisherman.

Mr. Yousos and his family members have been fishing since they were young. They do fishing from the Mekong River and the lake near their village. Besides fishing, Yousos assists his neighbor selling chickens to get extra income.

Mr. Yousos is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase one boat motor and fishing nets for fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat motor and fishing nets.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Mrs. Betty Doroteo S., 52, is a resident of Barangay San Isidro, Tibiao, Antique Philippines. She was blessed with 7 children and six of them have already finished their studies and have a stable job now.  For Betty, education is very important that’s why the couple did everything they could to earn more income just to send their children to school. Like others, she has also had experience with the many challenges of poverty. She mentioned that she  would have to wake up early in the morning  to harvest rice just so that they have something to feed their children. 
 
Betty used her first P5, 000 loan to open up a variety store. She gave her best to establish it and hopes to make it a mini-grocery store someday. She plans to request her second loan amounting to P 10,000 that she will use for this grocery. The sacrifices that she has encountered are her weapon to survive, i.e., through ASHI after a year she will begin to have a mini-grocery.

Her greatest dream is to have a mini-grocery with refreshments situated at their home.   And if possible she can have a branch in the town proper of Tibiao in order to provide employment to others but she needs a working capital of Php 10,000 for her next loan.  Though this is her first time to join a micro-finance institution, she hope that these dreams will come true and that ASHI will in fact give the best direction and opportunity to all members.

loans.use: starting up a variety store

loans.name: Nancy Vanesa

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=34342&_tpos=9&_tpg=1

Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Imperio.

Nancy es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Nancy junto a su hermana tienen una marisquería llamada Conchas Negras en donde venden comidas preparadas a base de pescados y mariscos siendo la especialidad de Cebiche, su local esta ubicado en una avenida concurrida, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 5 personas.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 2250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales para comenzar a construir su casa.

Nancy sueña con comprar una casa, salir adelante, tener ahorros y casarse
texts.en:
Nancy’s first loan Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank “Imperio.” Nancy has a partner, is 27 years old, and has 2 children. Along with her sister, Nancy has a seafood market called “Conchas Negras” (Black Shells) where they sell fish and seafood-based prepared food, specializing in ceviche. Her locale is located in a busy avenue, and she runs this business with the help of 5 people. Nancy needs a loan for 2250 Soles to invest in buying materials to begin building her house. Nancy dreams of buying a home, being successful, having savings, and getting married.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to begin building her home

loans.name: Ray's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by three borrowers, all of whom live in Sarika Keo Commune in Kandal Province, Cambodia. The group leader, Mrs. Ray S., was born in 1959 and is a widow. She has four children: two are single and the other two are married. Three of her children are employed—two of them are fisherman and one is a farmer—and earn money to help meet with the family's living expenses. Since 1985, S. has run a business selling fish , and is currently earning an average of $3 each day. Because fish-selling is the main way for her to earn money, S. is applying for a loan to purchase additional fish to sell, and the remaining loan will be used to do rice farming. The other two borrowers are:
San S., 32, who is a vegetable seller and a widow. She needs a loan to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.
Um S., age 28, sells coffee from home, and she is applying for a loan to purchase a pump.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishes for sale

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.pt:
Bernardo A. é natural de Inhambane uma das províncias da zona sul de Moçambique, tem 39 anos de idade, casados maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos com idade entre 5 e 6 meses anos respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta 3 irmãos.

Bernardo estudou até 12ªclasse e neste momento faz um curso a distância. Bernardo mudou se de Inhambane na companhia dos pais transferidos em missão de serviços, dai saiu da cidade para Distrito de Boane com propósito de praticar agricultura nas culturas de Hortícolas. Dai que lhe surgiu a ideia de desenvolver a criação de pintos sendo um dos negócios que tem bons rendimentos/lucros.

Para Bernardo este é seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende ampliar o seu negócio. É dono do negócio e desenvolve a 5 anos, onde trabalha das 6h as 12h. Bernardo pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar mais afim de construir mais capoeiras para permitir ter mais frangos.
texts.en:
Bernardo A. is from Inhambane, one of the Southern provinces of Mozambique. He is 39 years old, married and the father of 2 children - one is 5 years old and the other 6 months old. Besides his children, he also support 3 brothers.

Bernardo was in school until the 12th grade and at the moment he is on a distance learning course. Bernardo moved to Inhambane with his parents who were transferred there for work. He left the city for the district of Boane in order to practice agriculture in the more horticultural region. This is where the idea to breed chickens came from, as it is a business with a good income/profits.

This is Bernardo's first loan from Hluvuku and from Kiva, which he intends to use to grow his business. He owns the business which he has been developing for 5 years and works on it from 6 am to 12 noon. Bernardo intends to pay off his loan before it is due in order to request another one to build more hencoops and breed more chickens.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and breeding of chickens

loans.name: Issah

texts.en:
Issah B. has been trading in the local market of Berekum in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. She is 48 years old, divorced, and the mother of three children; one is in school. She is a busy petty trader who sells tomatoes and other foodstuffs like beans, onions, peppers, and ginger, on the top of a table in the market. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business which retards her business progress.

Issah buys her stock of goods from Kumasi. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to purchase increased stocks to revive the business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Tumi’ which means ‘God’s Power’. She hopes to receive GHS 600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase increased stocks of onions, tomatoes and ginger, etc.

loans.name: Tiémoko

texts.fr:
Né vers 1952 à Fono dans la préfecture de Bla, Monsieur Tièmoko est marié à deux épouses, père de 8 enfants et vit avec sa famille dans le quartier Lafiala de la ville de koutiala (  Région de Sikasso ).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance de faire des études, il a embrassé le travail de fabrique de marmites auprès d’un vieux forgeron de son quartier depuis son enfance et il exerce ce métier il y a 39 ans. La marmite est un ustensile de cuisine très important pour les femmes et Tiémoko il reçoit  beaucoup de commandes à travers ses clients, car il peut vendre plus de 70 marmites par mois.  
Pour parvenir à satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle en qualité et quantité, il n’a pas pris du temps à rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui li est à son  premier prêt individuel. 
Il compte acheter sa matière première à Bobo (Burkina Faso) soit,  200  kg d’aluminium et des charbons de bois pour la fabrique des marmites. Monsieur  Tiémoko effectue sa vente chez lui même, au grand marché de koutiala, et dans les foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants de koutiala à une clientèle  constituée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant et à crédit 
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur  compte avoir un bénéfice de 80 000  FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et assurer une bonne partie des charges familiales.
texts.en:
Born around 1952 in Fono in the prefecture of Bla, Mr. Tièmoko is married to two wives, father of 8 children, and lives with his family in the Lafiala district of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso Region).

Not having had the good fortune to attend school, he took up manufacturing cooking pots at a young age, together with an elderly blacksmith in his neighborhood, and he has been doing this work for 39 years. The cooking pot is a very important kitchen utensil for women, and Tiémoko receives lots of orders from his customers, since he sometimes sells more than 70 cooking pots a month.

In order to satisfy the needs of his clientele, both in quality and quantity, he wasted no time in making up his mind to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his first individual loan.

He intends to buy his raw materials in Bobo (Burkina Faso): 200 kg of aluminum and charcoal for making the cooking pots. Mr. Tiémoko sells from his home, in the big open-air market of Koutiala, and in the weekly fairs of the surrounding villages to a clientele constituted of women and men, for cash or on credit.

With this loan, Mr. Tiémoko expects to have a profit of 80,000 F CFA per month which he will use to reimburse the interest on the loan and cover a good part of his family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of aluminum and charcoal for manufacturing cooking pots

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Yadira B. es una dama muy trabajadora que ha logrado establecer su propia tiendita de ropa y productos de pulpería atendida por ella misma en el departamento de Masaya donde se dedica a dicha actividad.

Hoy en día el motive por el cual la señora Yadira ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque se le ha agotado su mercadería y requiere adquirir de sus proveedores los productos de la tiendita y es por esto que ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de dichos productos y así continuar en su negocio en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Ms. Yadira B. is very hard-working lady who has managed to set up her own little clothing boutique and general store, which she herself minds, in the department of Masaya.

The reason for which Yadira is now turning to Ceprodel for help is that she is running out of merchandise, so she needs to purchase some products from her suppliers. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy more goods and stay in business in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Crescencio

texts.es:
El señor Crescencio Ruíz Balbuena tiene 41 años y está acompañado con la señora Vrginia Rotela desde hace 20 años. Tienen un hijo en edad escolar de 6 años de edad.

Empezaron con el negocio desde de que la señora le tuvo al hijo, ya que la misma no podía salir a trabajar fuera de la casa. Empezaron a vender frutas y ensalada de frutas. La señora se desempeñaba como ama de casa y cuidaba de su hijo, como tuvo éxito en la prueba  se animaron a crecer y fueron  adquiriendo más clientes quienes le pedian otras cosas como empanadas, luego verduras, y así poco a poco fueron creciendo con el negocio. Hoy ya cuenta con 6 años de esta actividad y según comenta Don Crescencio le gusta  ya que pueden seguir consrtruyendo y modificando su casa, que con mucho sacrificio empezaron hace un tiempo.
texts.en:
Mr. Crescencio Ruíz Balbuena is 41 years old and is accompanied by Señora Virginia Rotela, his wife of 20 years. They have a school age son six years old. They began the business when Señora Virginia had her son, since at that time she could not leave to work outside of the house. They began to sell fruits and fruit salads. She carried on as home maker and cared for their son. Since Don Crescencio had success in the trial, they were encouraged to grow and continued acquiring more clients who asked them for other things such as empanadas and then vegetables, and so they grew the business little by little. Today they have worked for six years in this business and according to Don Crescencio he likes it since they can continue building and improving their house which, with much sacrifice, they began some time ago.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for his store: Consumer products like sugar, breads, meat, milk products, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Ruth Angelica

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal “Palomas de Oro” en  Distrito de Puno, la  provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en el Barrio Progreso, ella tiene estudios de primaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años, ella tiene su negocio de venta de productos de la zona (papa, papalisa, ocas, quinua).  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo de S/ 700.00 nuevos soles, comprará mas productos propios de la zona como choclo, papa, que son productos de la época.  Le gustaría poner un negocio de servicio de fotocopias o una cabina telefónica (servicio público).

Le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal ya que puede compartir con sus compañeras, y está agradecida de las charlas que les da Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the “Palomas de Oro” (“Golden Doves”) Community Bank in Puno district, Puno province, Department of Puno. She is 32 years old, single, and does not have any children. She lives in the Progreso neighborhood, and has an elementary school education. Ruth has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 8 years. She has a business selling products from the area, such as potatoes, papalisas and ocas (local Andean tubers), and quinoa. Her first loan was for 300.00 soles. She will use the current loan of 700.00 soles to purchase more products from the area such as corn and potatoes, which are currently in season. She would eventually like to have a photocopying service or a public telephone booth. Ruth likes her communal bank’s meetings, since she can share with the other members, and she is grateful for the lectures that Manuela Ramos provides.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing potatoes, ocas and papalisas (Andean tubers), corn, and vegetables

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn has a hog-raising and poultry business. She is married to Floriano, who is a farmer. They live in a rural place located in Barangay Sta. Maria Dupax Del Norte of Nueva Vizcaya. Maribel hopes to give her children a better future  by doing her best in providing them with their basic needs and education.  According to Marilyn, her family is poor but they are doing their very best to rise from poverty. 

Aside from raising hogs, they also plant rice and vegetables as alternative sources of income.  She is requesting a loan of PHP6, 000 for her hog-raising and poultry business and hopes to generate a higher income.  She hopes to buy more piglets, and will also purchase grower feed for her hogs.  She strongly believes that someday somehow they will be successful in their business with the help and support of the microfinance institution ASKI, through the help of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Business Capital

location.town: Sta. Maria, Dupax Del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Aliu

texts.en: Aliu A. sells tinned tomatoes, groceries and a variety of spices for cooking in Hohoe. She has received junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader who makes little money for a living. Aliu is responsible for paying payment of utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to add to her stock to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to add to her stock to sell

loans.name: Sokhna Top

texts.fr: Sokhna Top D. est âgée de 26 ans, elle est restauratrice au niveau du gare routier de Mbour. Elle vend du petit déjeuner et du déjeuneraux chauffeurs et aux voyageurs . Ce prêt lui servira d’accroitre sa capacité  pour satisfaire la forte demande des client surtout en cette période de vacance.  les revenus qui lui permettraient de faire face à d’autres besoins familiaux
texts.en:
Sokhna Top D., age 26, is a restauranteur at the bus station of Mbour. She sells breakfast and lunch meals to drivers and travelers who are en route. This loan will be used to increase her capacity and revenues, enabling her to cope with other family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food catering

loans.name: Fayez

texts.en: Fayez is a 27-year-old married man with 2 children. He has owned a car repair shop since 2008 and has 8 years of previous experience. Today, Fayez is requesting to borrow $1,200 in order to purchase a specific machine used for the cars maintenance so he can satisfy the demands of his customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for making auto repairs.

loans.name: Edivina

texts.en:
Edivina P. is from the village of Punta Sulong , Baliangao Mis. Occ.. She is 39 years old. Edivina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Edivina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Edivina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Edivina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edivina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Edivina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Edivina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor M. is 29 years old, married and the mother of one young child who is already enrolled in primary school. She contributes to her family by working as a garment worker for a factory, while her husband works as a construction foreman in the village. The family finds it hard to travel to work or anywhere else, because they don’t have their own vehicle for their family’s driving requirements. Sor M. hopes to buy a new motorcycle but her personal savings are still not sufficient. She is therefore requesting a loan to add to her little savings in order to buy a new motorcycle which she will use to transport her family. She and her husband are pictured at their house.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Santos Tulio

texts.es:
El señor Santos tiene 59 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de loteria menor y mayor desde hace varios años, el se ubica a vender frente a la Curacao es la plaza central de tegucigalpa, sus clientes son las personas que transitan el lugar ya que esta ubicado en un lugar estrategico el sr. Santos es NO VIDENTE desde hace 30 años tuvo un accidente en el trabajo lamentablemente 
no recibe ningún apoyo de dicha institucion, de esta forma el ha podido sacar adelante su hogar.
ya que el vive con su familia y les ayuda al sustento de la alimentacion el compra loteria mensualmente $1,420.00 y vende $ 1,850.00 obteniendo una ganancia de $ 430.00 mensualmente, el necesita el credito para comprar mas loteria ya que se hacerca una temporada alta y la gente compra mas, su meta a corto plazo es poder vender mas y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos is 59 years old. He has been selling retail and wholesale lottery tickets for a few years. He sells them in front of Curacao, Tegucigalpa’s central square. His customers are the people that pass by since it is a strategic spot. Unfortunately, Mr. Santos has been BLIND since he had an accident at work 30 years ago.

He doesn’t receive any support from that institution. This is the way he has been able to maintain his home. He lives with his family and he helps them with the food. He buys $1,420.00 worth of lottery tickets and sells $1,850.00 for a monthly profit of $430.00. He needs the loan to buy more lottery tickets since a high season is coming up and the people buy more. His short term goal is to sell more and make a greater profit.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Honduran retail and wholesale lottery tickets.

loans.name: Asilbek

texts.en: S. Asilbek is 33 years old and lives with her mother, husband and two children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and her two young sons both attend kindergarten. Asilbek manages a pharmacy with the help of her husband in her town. She is a doctor therefore sells a variety of medicines, and treats people in their shop. Due to it's location in a high traffic area near the local market, the pharmacy attracts many customers. Asilbek started her current business in 2005 after previously managing a medicine trading center in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She then moved to Bayan-Ulgii and started a medicine transportation service between Russia and her province. Over the years, Asilbek has gained much business experience and built a positive reputation for her buisiness in the community. She says, "My future dream is to expand my pharmacy in order to increase my sales." She is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug (~1750 USD) loan to purchase more medicine for his pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for his pharmacy

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor Jose  se dedica a la fabricacion de juguetes, almohadas y mochilas desde hace 4 años. Tiene su taller en la Av. principal de la zona de Villa San Antonio. Él y su esposa, la señora Remedios, viven en la misma avenida pero a dos casas del taller,en la casa de su suegra. Tienen una pequeña hija de cuatro años de edad. Jose Luis es una persona muy hábil y trabajadora ya que tiene un taller con varias máquinas y ayudantes  y vela siempre por el bienestar de su familia
texts.en:
Sr. Jose Luis has been manufacturing toys, pillows, and backpacks for four years. He has a workshop on the main avenue in the district of Villa San Antonio. He and his wife, Sra. Remedios, live on the same street but two buildings down from the workshop at his mother-in-law’s house. They have a young daughter who is 4 years old. Jose Luis is very skilled at his job and a hard worker. His workshop is equipped with several machines and staffed with assistants, which enables him to provide for his family’s welfare.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bright fabrics, thread, and black wool

loans.name: William

texts.en:
M. William is thirty-four years old; he is married with two sons who are not yet in school.

William has a retail grocery situated in Bajja trading centre and at the same time he is a professional teacher (civi servant) at King David High School in Lukaya Town. He is using the loan purposely to increase the stock in his grocery store for better profits and daily higher income generation for his business expansion.

William’s future plans are to make his business big for sustainability and to become a business-oriented person.

loans.use: To buy sweets (candies), soap, bread, sugar, etc. for his grocery store

loans.name: Leu

texts.en: Leu F. is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Salua Manono. She is married and has five adult children. Leu owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 550 WST a month. In 2009, Leu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Raisa's Group

texts.ru:
Злых Раиса – лидер данной группы. Раисе пятьдесят два года. Она с мужем работает в одном и том же месте – кафе «Этис». Он работает электриком, она же является поваром. Они вырастили одного сына, которому двадцать один год. Сейчас он учится в ВУЗе на заочном отделении. Пользуясь свободным временем, сын Раисы работает разнорабочим в частной строительной фирме в г. Бишкек. В современный век, когда мало одну профессию или работу, Раиса также решила идти в ногу со временем. Она сумела найти применение своим поварским навыкам. Да ещё и таким образом, чтобы это приносило ей материальную пользу. Она договорилась с некоторыми магазинами и кафетериями, о том, что она будет поставлять им пельмени собственного изготовления. Помимо этого, ей также удалось найти клиентов на закупку лапши для лагмана, которую Раиса также будет готовить сама. Для Раисы это дополнительное занятие явилось настоящим благом. Ведь ей не приходится ездить куда – либо. Все свои заказы она выполняет дома и поэтому эта работа её совсем не утомляет. Кроме всего прочего у Раисы не так давно были кое – какие долги. Одной зарплаты повара в кафе не хватало, чтобы разом погасить все долги. Но после того, как она начала своё дело, ей не стоило особого труда расплатиться со всеми долгами. Всего несколько часов работы по выходным приносит Раисе ежемесячно около трёх тысяч сомов. Ради таких денег, многие люди трудятся целый месяц. Сейчас Раиса решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы закупить два мешка муки, мясо для фарша и оставшейся частью кредита оплатить контракт сына. 

У Раисы четыре партнёра по группе:

Насыкат 20 лет. Она работает барменшей в кафе. Насыйкат не замужем и живёт с родителями. Она нуждается в кредите, чтобы оплатить контракт.

Жылдыз 25 лет. Жылдыз не замужем, работает официанткой в кафе. Дома Жылдыз и её брат занимаются откормом и продажей скота. Жылдыз нужен кредит, чтобы купить двух бычков.

Ольге 52 года. Ольга работает мойщицей посуды в кафе, а также недавно открыла маленький магазин и продаёт продукты питания. Ольга хочет получить кредит и купить две тонны угля, и закупить товар для магазина. 

Турату 21 год. Он учится в политехническом университете и параллельно работает оператором на АЗС №1. Турат надеется получить кредит и оплатить контракт. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Raisa Z. is a leader of this group. She is fifty two years old. She works with her husband in the same place - cafe Etis. He works as an electrician and she is a cook. They have raised one son who is twenty one right now. At this time he is studying in university. Using his free time he works as a miscellaneous worker in a private construction company in the city of Bishkek. In today's time one profession or job is not enough and Raisa also decided to walk in foot with time. She has managed to find a good use for her cooking skills.
