Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Preciosa quer usar o dinheiro para a compra de lenha para o fabrico de tijolos. Preciosa e casada e mae de 4 filhos. O marido de Preciosa trabalha num Instituicao do governamental e escriturario. o seu salario e de aproximadamente $150. Preciosa, para alem do fabrico de tijolos para a venda ela tambem cria galinhas poedeiras. Os 4 filhos de Preciosa estao a estudar.

loans.use: Purchase firewood to produce bricks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials in order to keep producing and selling food.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma is 35 years old and is a married woman with three children. Mwajuma is also a coconut seller through a business she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $150 to buy more coconuts  for her business.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Tulkinjon

texts.en: Tulkinjon B.  lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan and he is married with 3 children. Mr. B. Tulkinjon is engaged in business for 5 years and has the appropriate knowledge and skills that has helped him to develop business. Tulkinjon started the business  from the scratch but now he has a trade outlet for selling food products. He has a good assortment and many customers. He sells different goods including  milk products, vegetable oil, sweets, flour products and sugar. Tulkinjon applies to  KIVA with a request for a  business development loan of 2800 TJS for 10 months. The loan will be used to increase his assortment of items for sale and to open a meat products department..

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase his assortment of items for sale and to open a meat products department..

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
Silvio works as a cashier in a financial institution, and he studies Auditing at the Universidad Salesiana de Bolivia. He lives in the Llojeta El Rosal neighborhood in La Paz, Bolivia. He is 30 years old, single and supports himself; at 30, he no longer counts on his parents' help. This is the fourth time that he asks for a loan at Impro. The loan he requests this time will be used to purchase a computer, which he needs to complete the practical homework assigned in the last two years of his studies.

Sivio is very responsible; he had a good record on the previous loans, and he did not have any problems making the payments on time. His desire to obtain a university degree is one more reason to help him.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Silvio trabaja como cajero en una entidad financiera y es estudiante de auditoria en la Universidad Salesiana de Bolivia. Vive en la zona de Llojeta el rosal de la Ciudad de La Paz Es soltero y se mantiene por si mismo ya que no cuenta con la ayuda de sus padres porque tiene 30 años. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. El crédito que ahora solicita será destinado para la compra de una computadora ya que esta en los últimos dos años de la Universidad y es un bien necesario para que pueda realizar sus trabajos prácticos. Es una persona muy responsable ya que en todo el tiempo que trabaja, su comportamiento en los créditos otorgados fue bueno y no tuvo problemas para efectuar sus pagos respectivos. Sus ansias de terminar su carrera universitaria es una razón más para que podamos ayudarlo.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer, needed to finish university studies

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba E. sells Banku, a local dish of fermented maize. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Araba and her 2 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. makes a living producing cellophane. She is 28 years old, married and has four children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in her current line of work for five years. She learned this business from a friend, and needs a loan to buy more materials to make additional cellophane.

loans.use: To buy more materials to make additional cellophane.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: MR M. EST UN VIEL HOMME  QUI HABITE AU DVF DE BAMBEY .IL EST MARIE ET PERE DE CINQ ENFANTS .IL FAIT DU COMMERCE DE CHARBON DEPUIS UN AN CECI DANS LE BUT DE SUBVENIR AUX BESOINS DE SES ENFANTS . IL DEMANDE CE PRET DANS LE BUT DE RENFORCER SON STOCK PENDANT LA SAISON DES PLUIES.
texts.en:
Mr. M. is an elderly man who lives in DVF in Bambey. He is married and the father of 5 children. He has been selling charcoal for one year, with the intention of better supporting his children. He is requesting this loan to bolster his stocks before the rainy season.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of charcoal

loans.name: Ihana

texts.en: Ihana A., 51, is married and has five children.  She has many years of experience growing vegetables. She sells fruits and vegetables four days per week. She has two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 440 Tala (about $183 USD).  SPBD loans are Ihana's only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She will use part of her loan to pay her son's school fees. Ihana has been selling pancakes for the past two years, but due to the cost of living in Samoa, she realized that her pancake business was not making much, so she is now concentrating on her vegetable garden.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, vegetable seeds, gardening tools, a wheelbarrow, gloves.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao H. is a villager in Thaom Ney Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who grows rice. She harvests her crop and earns her revenue every January.

Her husband Mr. H. Kosal is a fisherman who earns a small income to help support his family.

Although Mrs. Mao H. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot support their family. In order to improve their family's living conditions, Mrs. Mao H. has decided to ask for a loan to start a new business. She would like to buy a buffalo for breeding. She hopes to increase her income by eventually selling the buffalo.

Mrs. Mao H. is 40 years old and the mother of four children. All of the children attend the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for breeding.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
In the little barangay of Mabini, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Lourdes P., 61 years old, used to operate a copra-buying business. Her husband was her greatest business partner for 20 years. They educated their 2 children from their copra-buying business. Life is not so tough for the family to survive. The business they operated was good and their neighbors are their loyal customers, but the family would like to venture into a mini grocery store. They want to help their neighborhood by providing a store that has it all. They know that this business would not be possible without help. Paglaum MPC came as a resource for their capital needs. They applied for a PHP 50,000 loan to purchase additional stocks for their store and for store improvement as well.

Lourdes and her husband have a big wish for their “apo” (grandchild) to finish his studies. But above all, they want to serve the community and for their business to flourish.

loans.use: Purchase of additional stocks for her store and store construction

loans.name: Amoako

texts.en:
This client has a passionate story to tell; Amoako I. is his name. He is thirty-two years old, married and a father with two kids. Fortunately, both his kids are in school through the help of government free basic compulsory education.

Amoako lives at Atebubu with his immediate family where he was born and bred. He is a teacher and also sells bags of charcoal. He has been in this business for five years now, earning income to care of his household.

Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes. He obtains his supply of charcoal from Awaso which is two towns over from Atebubu where he lives, and he retails it to his customers who come from Kumasi to buy.

Amoako is a very clever person. He was a student at the University of Development Studies (UDS) in the Northern part of Ghana. He deferred when he was in second year because of financial constraints, thinking that he could get a job that could fetch him high sums of money to pay his fees and other expenses. Unfortunately he could not make it and finally dropped out of school.

Amoako says he has been affected psychologically. He wants the loan to buy more bags of charcoal to meet his customers' demand and use part to further his kids' education. He is member of the group called ‘Ahobrase’ meaning Humility Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. He has registered with the health insurance which takes care of his medical problem in the mix of sickness.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to restock his inventory before the rainy season

loans.name: Liv

texts.en: Liv P. is a tailor and works from her house in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She earns around $0.5 per day. She is widowed and has two children—one is married and lives in the family's home—and one nephew and sister are also living with her family. One single son is studying in university and also is employed as cashier for a club in Phnom Penh city, and he can help to reduce the family's expenses. Because she faces difficulties paying for transportation, to reduce costs, Liv would like to ask for a loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her son go to work. Also, her son can earn income from the motorcycle by driving a taxi sometimes. For the remaining amount of the loan, she uses it to purchase wood to repair her old house. She said the loan will help to improve her family's income and living conditions. Her son is shown in the photo because she was not available for photographing.

loans.use: to buy a second hand motorcycle for her son go to work

loans.name: Valeriy

texts.en:
Valeriy is married and has two adult sons. He owns a retail business and sells fishing accessories at local market. The demand is high especially in winter and the competition is low. So, his business is quite successful. 

Valeriy has been in this business for 7 years. He knows this business well, because he is a professional fisherman himself. Valeriys is very responsible and entrepreneurial person and wants to develop this business even further. 

Valeriy would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase the inventories. He hopes to receive additional income and finish fixing his house.

loans.use: to increase the inventories

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco S. se dedica a la actividad de crianza de cerdos en su localidad del municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León. Es importante destacar que el señor S. ha logrado salir adelante y mantener su núcleo familiar que tanto requiere de él.

La razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los cerdos ya que así lo requiere y de esta forma sale adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Francisco S. is dedicated to the breeding of hogs in his area of the municipality of Telica in the city of León. It is important to emphasize that Señor S. has managed to do well and to maintain his nuclear family that needs him so much. The reason why he has contacted Ceprodel is to request a credit for the purchase of hogs, since he requires it and in this way he will get ahead in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de cerdos

loans.name: Bertha Fany

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Fanny Z. López  tiene 38 años, vive en el caserío de Sicsa, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio primaria completa, dejo de estudiar debido a que el colegio era muy lejos para que vaya y se quedo en su hogar ayudando a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar. Tiene 03 hijos de los cuales 03 aun dependen económicamente de ella.
Bertha dedica a la compra-venta de animales, empezó su negocio hace 15 años vendiendo huachos y chanchos, así como venta de quesillo el mismo que  abandono ya que no le era muy rentable. En tiempo de cosecha se dedica a la compra-venta de cereales y papa.  Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Luchando por el Progreso”, lo invirtió en la compra 02 chanchos.
Con el crédito de 1800 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de un toro.
Bertha sueña con comprar su casa en Trujillo y conseguir que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha Fanny Z. L. is 38 years old, lives in Sicsa which is in Salpo, part of the Otuzco province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She completed elementary school but had to stop going to school after that because high school was too far from home and she stayed home helping her mother with household chores. She has three children all of whom still depend fully on her. She has bought and sold livestock for the past 15 years. She began her business selling orphaned livestock and pigs as well as cheese but stopped selling cheese since it wasn't very popular. During harvest season she buys and sells cereals and potatoes. She runs her business from her home. With her first 300 sol loan from the "Luchando por el Progreso" bank she purchased two pigs. With the 1800 sol loan, which she intends to repay in 4 months, she will buy a bull. Bertha dreams with purchasing a house in Trujillo and to see her children finish professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull.

loans.name: Rose J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 28 year old Rose M. from Mbeya. She is single with no  children, but she is responsible for supporting two dependants because they are orphans. 

Rose has been running a vitenge and clothing sale business since 2008. She sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Rose currently earns about 90USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 250 USD in order to purchase more vitenge in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Rose thanks you for your support!


ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more vitenge in bulk

loans.name: Tesape´ara Group

texts.es:
El Comité Tesape´ara se conformó en fecha 12 de diciembre 2008, gracias a que la actual Directora de General la Sra. Clara Benítez se acercó a la asesora en una Renovación de Crédito que la misma tenía en la zona, para averiguar de como funciona el programa de Comité de Mujeres.  Una vez enterada luego de 3 días apróximadamente, se comunica con la asesora, informándole que logró juntar a 17 mujeres, quienes se encuentran trabajando muy contentas dentro del Programa.

El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de 500.000 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como venta de comestibles, venta de mercerías, venta de ropas, venta de cosméticos y perfumes, venta de carbón, venta de ropas de propia fabricación, ect.

Todas ellas estan trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria, ayudandose mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.

Las integrantes son: 

Clara B.	Venta de articulos de mercerias.
Lorenza V.	Costura.
Deisy M.	Copetín.
Marcelina C.	Copetín.
Lourdes D.	Venta de carbón.
María Verón	Venta de comidas y golosinas
Antonia F.	Venta de ropas
Manuela I.	Venta de helados
Claudia Benítez 	Venta de ropas usadas.
Lidia González	Venta de gallinas caceras.
Lorena C.	Venta de comidas.
Rosalia Martínez	Venta de perfumes
Dionicia Martínez	Venta de carbón y copetín
Verónica D.	Venta de lencerias
Nilda E.	Venta de comidas
Celva L.	Venta de ropas
María R.	Venta de ropas
texts.en:
The Tesape´ara group formed on December 12th, 2008, thanks to the General Director, Mrs. Clara Benítez. She approached the Loan Renewal Advisor in her zone to find out how the Comité de Mujeres de Fundacion Paraguaya works. About 3 days after getting the information, she told the advisor that she was able to gather together 17 women who are now contentedly working in the program. The average loan per member is 500 PEN, which will be used for different activities such as food sales, cosmetic and perfume sales, coal sales, homemade clothing sales, etc. They all work together in a supportive way, mutually helping each other reach the common objectives of their group and the Fundación Paraguaya. The members are: Clara B. Sells Sewing Items Lorenza V. Seamstress Deisy M. Local Fast Food Marcelina C. Local Fast Food Lourdes D. Sells Coal María Verón Sells Food and Sweets Antonia F. Sells Clothes Manuela I. Sells Ice Cream Claudia Benítez Sells Used Clothes Lidia González Sells Turkeys Lorena C. Sells Food Rosalia Martínez Sells Perfume Dionicia Martínez Sells Coal and Local Fast Food Verónica D. Sells Lingerie Nilda E. Sells Food Celva L. Sells Clothes María R. Sells Clothes

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing items, ingredients for food preparation, lingerie, clothes, fruit and vegetables, sweets, fabrics and thread to make clothes, coal, perfume, turkeys, ice cream, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha  es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos.  Vive en la Comunidad de Punta sahuacasi-central, ella posee estudios  superiores incompletos (agropecuaria).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de ganado ovinos.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles.
 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará mas ovinos para engordarlos y así venderlos a un mayor precio en la feria de la zona.  Le gustaría mucho tener más capital para poder agrandar su negocio. (“me gustaría ser mayorista”).

Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal y el ahorro individual.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Punta Sahuacasi community bank in the Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 28, in a common law marriage, and has two children. She lives in the Punta Sahuacasi-Central community. She studied agriculture in college, but did not finish. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. She buys and sells sheep. Her first loan was for 500 PEN. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy more sheep to fatten and sell for a better price at the fair in the zone. She would very much like to have more capital to be able to expand her business. (“I would like to be a wholesaler”). She likes her community bank’s meetings and the individual savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en: Thoa C. Thị was born in 1958. ( no: 010102090031). Her main job is farming. She raises pigs and sells vegetables in the market. She lives with her son. Her son is a worker. She has a monthly income of about 2.500.000 VND. She wants to borrow 1.972.000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy food for her pigs

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr: Daba S. vend de la boisson, des cannettes et des jus de fruits qu’elle fabrique chez elle.  Elle exerce ce métier depuis plusieurs années. Les revenus tirés du commerce lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins quotidiens. Ce prêt a pour but de renforcer son activité avec une forte demande de sa clientèle constituée de chauffeurs de taxi et de voyageurs
texts.en:
Daba S. sells beverages, cans and fruit juice that she makes at home. She's been running this business for several years. Her income enables her to provide for herself. She will use this loan to bolster her business, which experiences a high demand from her clientele comprising taxi drivers and travelers.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional bulk supplies of women’s clothes for her store.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes B. is a single parent and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Agnes sells soap at Yesomo near Elmina, which she has done since 2003. Agnes uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses.

Agnes will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to manufacture soap. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to manufacture soap

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is engaged in the 'sari-sari' store (community-based store) business and her shop is located just in front of their house. She offers various goods in her store like detergent, soap, canned goods, snacks, and soft drinks. At present, she is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 that she can use for the expansion of her business. Aside from her store, she is also planning to venture into a new business which is hog-raising. Milagros believes that with the financial support coming from Kiva lenders, she will be able to fulfill her plans and sustain the needs of their family and pay for the education of their children.

Milagros is 40 years old and married to a farmer named Arnel. Their eldest child is enrolled in college taking a Midwifery course while their youngest is a high school graduate and at the moment stopped his studies due to lack of money. He is now helping his father in maintaining their farm.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Kamardin

texts.en: M. Kamardin is 35 years old, is married, and has four children. The last five years of his life he has devoted to agricultural work and on market days he brings his products to the market. For Kamardin the harvest is what he enjoys the most and he devotes a lot of time to sorting the melons and watermelons that he will sell because the price will depend on their size. Agriculture is full of satisfaction for him and his family - even more when the produce sells for a good price at the market. That is his motivation to continue planting. This is the second loan that Kamardin has with IMON International, having made his payments on time for his first loan. With the money requested he will buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his farm. Kamardin is very grateful to those who support him because they allow him to provide well-being to his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Mr. Bunna Sok Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of fourteen people living in the village of Kdol in the province of TaK.. Each of the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mr. Bunna S. is the village bank president. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also a fisherman. His wife, Mrs. Muong Thav, is a housewife. Mr. Bunna S. is applying for a loan to add to what he has already saved up to buy zinc and timbers to build a house for himself and his family. He is 36 years old and the father of four children: the eldest is a laborer in a cake shop, another works with his father, the third attends the local school, and the youngest is is too young yet to work or study.

Seven members in this group loans have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy zinc and timbers to build a house for himself and his family

loans.name: Yanzaga

texts.en: N. Yanzaga is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three sons in Zavkhan province in western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest two sons attend a local secondary school and the youngest, 2 year-old, Batdorj, stays home with his mother. Yanzaga operates a wooden product making business in his town. He makes and sells a variety of furniture items to his customers. Yanzaga started his business in 2003. Since then, he has grown his business and is well established in the local business community. His earnings have enabled him to provide for his family and buy his own workshop. He says "My wish for the future is to save enough money for my children's education and one day build a house for my family." Yanzaga is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1050 USD) loan to purchase more wood for his wood products business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for his wood products business

loans.name: Pepetua

texts.en:
Pepetua T. is a 31-year-old woman living in the town of Vaitele K Fou.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Pepetua owns & operates a taxi business.  Pepetua has just started operating this business and earns approximately 600ST WST a month from these activities.

Pepetua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Pepetua is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  Pepetua plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and maintain taxi

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en:
N. Barbra is a business lady aged thirty-two years. She is a single mother with three children.

Barbra owns a grocery shop in Kimaanya, Masaka municipality, and has been operating this business for over three years. She is using the loan to increase her business stock by buying more sugar, eggs, cooking oil, sweets (candies), bags of maize flour (for posho, also know as ugali - a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), rice and much more.

Barbra’s future dream is to expand her shop, especially by stocking it with the essentials for domestic use which will help her increase her number of customers.

loans.use: To increase her business stock

loans.name: Thok

texts.en: Thok C., 41, is married and lives with her two children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who works for US$1.60 each day, while her husband is a horse-cart driver making US$7 per day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Thok C. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a new horse cart for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a new horse cart for her husband.

loans.name: Phoem

texts.en:
Mr. PhO. O., 51, and his wife Mrs. Kimlib Kol, 49, have been married for more than 20 years. They have two daughters: one is a garment factory worker while the other one attends university. The family lives outside of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. His wife is shown in the photo.

PhO. is a policeman. His wife stays at home and does housework. In the past, she would sell rice pork. PhO. is asking for a loan of $800 to pay the school fee for his daughter, who is in the last year of her bachelor's degree in Accounting.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Solidarias está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras, emprendedoras y trabajadoras. Una de ellas es Esmeralda R. Z., ella hace tres años instaló una pequeña venta de chiverías, dulces con el tiempo y con ayuda de los préstamos logro introducir granos básicos, jabones, carne, verduras, frutas, y otros productos hasta convertir su venta en una pulpería pero ella sueña que sea una miscelánea. 

Zoraida Leonor B. de 40 años vende productos lácteos como leche, leche agria, cuajada queso, crema y gaseosa. Mientras Azucena C. tiene un tramo de cosméticos en el mercado oriental y que a pesar de que el último incendio de este populoso lugar su economía se vio afectada debido a que su tramo fue uno de los primeros consumidos por las llamas como la del resto de sus compañeros su arduo trabajo le ha ayudado a salir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Solidarias" group is made up of three determined, enterprising, and hard-working women. One of them is Esmeralda R. Z.. She has had a business for three years selling snacks and sweets. With the help of her loans, she has managed to start selling basic grains, soap, meat, vegetables, fruit, and other products to convert her business into a grocery store, but she hopes that it will become a general store.

Zoraida Leonor B. is 40 and sells dairy products like milk, leche agria [a product similar to buttermilk], curd, cream, and soft drinks.

Azucena C. sells cosmetics in the eastern market despite the fact that the last fire in this crowded place affected her business since her stretch in the market was one of the first consumed by flames. But as with the rest of her co-workers, her hard work has helped her get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and other food products

loans.name: Mahbobullah

texts.en:
Mahbobullah is the son of Y.. He is 24 years old and lives in the 9th district of Kabul, Aghanistan. He is a married man with two children who are in school. He has a mobile-card selling shop. He requested an individual loan of 14,000 Afghani.
 
He would like to make his shop larger and make some changes in it. He wants to buy more mobile cards for his business. He is very pleased with this small loan in Afghanistan and would like to extend gratitude to AFS and to the Kiva process in this poor country.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Rafael Antonio Zeledón Martínez de 26 años reside en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su madre y un hermano menor. Juntos elaboran pan francés, el cual es el nombre que se le da al pan tipo baguete en El Salvador. El pan es elaborado en su hogar, el cual es comercializado en el mismo lugar.  Así mismo cuenta con varios clientes quienes compran por mayoreo el pan. Rafael cuenta con 3 años de elaborar el pan francés, negocio con el cual ha logrado brindarles todo lo necesario a su madre y su hermano. Debido a que es esta es la única fuente de ingresos que posee, él solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar toda la materia prima para elaborar el pan. Ingredientes tales como harina, levadura, manteca y otros más, son necesarios para obtener mayores ganancias, lo que beneficiará a su familia ya que le permitirá invertir más en el negocio, puesto que podrá tener mayor producción, más ganancias y de esta manera obtener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio Zeledón Martínez, 26, lives in San Salvador department with his mother and younger brother. Together, they make French bread, which is what the typical baguettes in El Salvador are called. They bake and sell the bread at home. He has several customers that buy the bread wholesale. Rafael has been baking for three years and this commercial activity has provided for all his mother's and brother's needs. Because this is his only source of income, he needs funding to buy the raw ingredients he needs for his bread. These are: flour, yeast, lard, etc. They are needed in order to produce higher profits which will benefit his family and allow him to invest more in his business and produce larger yields and higher profits. All this will lead to better economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast and lard for bread-making.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca tiene 50 años, es viuda y tiene un hijo mayor de edad con quien trabaja. 
Ella tiene un terreno en el cual cultiva distintas plantas ya sean ornamentales, como de estación, para luego comercializarlas en el Mercado municipal de Itaugua ; también las vende casa por casa con su hijo en una carreta a tracción animal y a hogares particulares en las cuales ademas de vender sus plantas realizan trabajos de jardinería ( Siempre en compañía de su hijo). 
El crédito será de ayuda para la compra de semillas de Azalea Brasilera, esta especie es muy requerida por sus clientes y es un tanto costosa, como es el inicio de su temporada desean realizar la compra para cubrir los pedidos que van recibiendo, ademas de esto desean seguir adquiriendo las semillas de estación.
El anhelo de Doña Francisca anhela poder adquirir un puesto fijo en el Mercado de Itaugua lugar cercano a la Ciudad de San Lorenzo para la ubicación en el mismo de un vivero permanente.
texts.en:
Francisca is 50 years old, a widow, and the mother of an adult son that she works with. She has a plot of land on which she grows many different seasonal ornamental plants in order to later sell them in the municipal market of Itaugua. She also sells them door to door with her son in an animal-drawn cart, and at some specific houses where in addition to selling her plants she does gardening jobs (always in the company of her son). The loan will be used to help her buy Brazilian Azalea seeds, a species in high demand by her clients that is a bit expensive. As it is the beginning of its growing season she wants to buy enough to cover the orders that she is receiving. Additionally she would like to continue to acquire the seasonal seeds. Francisca's wish is be able to acquire a permanent place at the Itaugua market, a place close to San Lorenzo City and to have a permanent residence there also.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Brazilian seeds, and other seasonal seeds.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom C. is 40 years old and a villager who lives in Prech village in Takeo province. She is a grocery seller who owns a small store. Her husband, Mr. Hun Men, is a security guard for a private company where he makes a small salary to support his family living. Her husband has to travel far for work. Thus, Mrs. Sokhom C. now is requesting 1,500,000 Riel from AMK to purchase a motorbike to support her husband transportation. This couple has two children who all are students in the local school. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia E. is married with three children. She has received junior high education. Her husband is a teacher.

Cecelia operates a provisions shop and sells things such as cooking oil, cups of sugar, toffees, mints and other groceries at Elmina. She uses her income to support her husband to pay for the children’s tuition and the utility bills.

Cecelia will use the loan to add to her initial capital to purchase a more spacious store where more of the groceries can be stocked for sale. She also wants to acquire an oil palm plantation.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecelia plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To add to her initial capital to purchase a more spacious store

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
El Señor José Alfredo H. S., es comerciante del mercado central tiene un negocio de venta de granos básicos en el callejon de la distribuidora de el Masaya, anteriormente el Señor H. S. trabajaba como contador en una empresa y su esposa era la que administraba el negocio pero su señora falleció y luego el quedo administrando su negocio.
Tiene once años de dedicarse a esta actividad, se esfuerza bastante para salir adelante abre su negocio de lunes y domingo de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde.
Sus financiamientos los solicita para surtir su negocio comprando la mercadería que poca existencia tiene en ese momento. Tiene cuatro años  de trabajar con ceprodel en los cuales dice que estos financiamientos le han ayudado a salir adelante a surtir su negocio poco a poco.
texts.en:
Señor José Alfredo H. S. is a merchant in the central market. He has a business selling basic grains in the alley by Masaya Distrubutors. Señor H. S. used to work as an accountant in a firm and his wife managed his business, but his wife died and he ended up taking care of the business. He has been doing this for eleven years and tries hard to get ahead. He opens his business Mondays through Sundays from 7:00 a.m to 4:00 p.m. He's asking for a loan to stock his business by buying merchandise that is hard to come by at this time. He has been working with Cedropel for four years and says that these loans have helped him to get ahead and stock his business bit by bit.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for my business, basic grains.

loans.name: Luisa Lerna

texts.es:
En el barrio Germán Pomares   Municipio de Somotillo La señora Z. G.  realiza su trabajo en atención alos clientes que pasan por su local(A almorzar o  tomar algún refresco)
 Ella quiere el crédito para la Compra de 10 bolsas de cemento para repellar el local y  4 bidones de pintura para pintar su local  y tenga  mejor presentación y mejor condición para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
En el barrio Germán Pomares Municipio de Somotillo La señora Z. G. realiza su trabajo en atención alos clientes que pasan por su local(A almorzar o tomar algún refresco) Ella quiere el crédito para la Compra de 10 bolsas de cemento para repellar el local y 4 bidones de pintura para pintar su local y tenga mejor presentación y mejor condición para atender a sus clientes.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de 10 bolsas de cemento para repellar el local y de 4 bidones de pintura para pintar su local  para que tenga mejor presentación.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. ANASTACIA LIDIA, TIENE 37 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SOLTERA Y TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA HIJA, QUE ES LA RAZON DE TODO SUS ESFUERZOS Y SACRIFICIOS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "FORTALEZA" JUNTO CON 9 PERSONAS MÁS, RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO Y QUE LA ELIGIERON COMO PRESIDENTA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
LA SRA. ANASTACIA LIDIA, HACE SEIS AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ABARROTES EN SU DOMICILIO, TUVO QUE INGENIARSE UN TRABAJO QUE PUDIERA DESEMPEÑAR EN SU DOMICILIO Y ASÍ PODER TENER CERCA A SU HIJA PARA CUIDARLA.
CON SU TRABAJO Y ESFUERZO HA PODIDO MANTENER A SU PEQUEÑA HIJA, ASUMIR GASTOS DE LA CASA Y COMPRAR SUS ARTEFACTOS, NECESARIOS EN EL HOGAR.
SU PROXIMA META, SERÍA INSTALAR UN MINIMARKET.
CON EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO PAGARÁ ALGUNAS DEUDAS Y EL RESTO LO INVERTIRÁ.
texts.en:
Anastacia Lidia is 37 years old, single, and has a small daughter who is the reason for all of her efforts and sacrifice. She is part of the group "Fortaleza," along with 9 other people who live in the Carabayllo district. They chose her to be the president of the board of directors of the group. Anastacia Lidia has sold groceries from her home for 6 years. She had to devise a job for herself that she could perform in her home, so that she could stay close to her daughter to care for her. With her work and effort, she has been able to support her small daughter and assume the household expenses and buy the appliances needed for the home. Her next goal would be to establish a mini-market. With the loan requested she will pay off some debts, and she will invest the rest.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Kamuyu Group

texts.en:
Memuna F. (left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Memuna was born in Makeni city, about 42 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple have five  children – one in secondary school, two in primary school and two already grown-up and living on their own. For over 20 years now, Memuna has been selling fish.

This is first loan that Memuna and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Memuna will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business; she will buy a basket full of fish to add to her current stock of fish. 

(In the photo is also loan officer Zainab Bangura, handing over the loan to the group.)

loans.use: Buy a basket full of fish to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables for her son's cart

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una madre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el sector San Nicolás, una zona rural del distrito de Zaña, el lugar se caracteriza por tener como principal actividad económica a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cinco a ños a la crianza y venta de animales, ella cuenta con varias cabezas de ganado ovino los cuales cría en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos animales ya ha alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona esporádicamente y a sus vecinos que los adquieren para consumirlos en fiestas y celebraciones.

Esta actividad le provee de algunos ingresos económicos que utiliza para apoyar a su esposo en el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares. Laura desea seguir apoyando a su familia a salir adelante y para ello desea mejorar la alimentación de sus ovejas para poder venderlas a un mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que planea invertir sembrando forraje para sus animales en un pequeño terreno de cultivo ubicado cerca de su vivienda.

Teresa es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una mujer responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 47-year-old mother who lives with her husband and son in San Nicolás, a rural area in the Zaña district. San Nicolás is located 45 minutes away from Chiclayo and most of its inhabitants are farmers. For the last five years Teresa has raised and sold animals. She has a number of sheep which she raises in a pen in her backyard. Once they are old enough, she sells them to one of the businessmen who periodically visit her area or to her neighbors who buy them for parties and celebrations. She uses the money from this endeavor to help her husband meet household expenses. Teresa wants to keep helping her family get ahead and she wants to improve the quality of feed that she gives her sheep so that she can sell them at a better price. She is asking for her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa to meet this goal. She will use the 1000 Peruvian nuevos soles to invest in planting crops on a nearby field to use as food for her animals. Teresa is a hardworking and enterprising woman known to her neighbors and friends to be responsible and trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs related to planting crops to feed sheep

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota S. is from Sta Cruz, Tangub City. She is 33 years old and single. To make a living, Carlota owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products such as rice, shampoo, candies sugar, salt, etc. in the local community. Carlota has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carlota joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carlota has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Carlota is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Carlota from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel G. Jr. is from the village of Carikkikan Norte. He is 36 years old, married and has 2 very young children. Miguel owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Miguel has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Miguel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miguel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Miguel is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Miguel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es unj padre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos menores hijos en el sector Las Delicias del distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola ubicada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, se caracteriza por poseer tierras fértiles y muy accidentadas debido a su cercanía a la sierra norte del país.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a actividades relacionadas con la agricultura, el cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en el cual suele sembrar algunos granos como maíz. Adicionalmente  se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, esta actividad le permite agenciarse de ingresos permanentes ya que la agricultura solo le brinda ingresos durante cada campaña de cosecha.

Fernando desea mejorar la alimentacion de sus animales para porder obtener mayores ingresos al momento de venderlos, para lograr su meta se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Fernando es un padre que siempre da lo mejor de si para poder sacar adelante a su familia, las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo, trabajador y responsable. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Fernando is a 35-year-old father who lives with his wife and their two small children. They live in the Las Delicias area in the district of Oyotún. This is an agricultural area that is situated more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo – the area is characterized as being fertile and very hilly due to its proximity to the mountains in the northern part of the country. For more than ten years Fernando has made a living from farming-related activities. He has his own plot of land on which he typically grows grains such as corn. In addition, Fernando makes a living raising and selling small animals. This activity allows him to earn an income year-round, in contrast to growing crops, which only provides him with an income at harvest time. Fernando wants to improve the diet of his animals so that he can increase his earnings when he sells them. That is why he is requesting a loan of 1000 Peruvian soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. He wants to use the money to invest in balanced animal feed. Fernando is a father who always does as much as he can to help his family get ahead in life. The people who know him consider him to be someone who is calm, hard working, and responsible. He has worked with our organization before and has shown punctuality and responsibility in making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing balanced feed for the animals he sells.

loans.name: Mame Coumba

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Coumba F. est âgée  de 35 ans. Elle habite a Yoff Layenne. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 3 et 6 ans.
Elle a choisi l’activité de commerce dans le but de réaliser des bénéfices et ainsi  satisfaire  ses besoins personnels. Elle s’active depuis 2008  dans l’achat et la vente de chaussures, de parfums, et de produits cosmétiques. 
Madame F. est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis novembre 2007. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de marchandises destinées a renforcer son stock dans sa cantine. 
Elle souhaite avec l’accroissement de ses revenus améliorer  la situation  sociale de sa famille et aussi élargir son magasin.
texts.en:
Madame Mame Couba F. is thirty-five years old. She lives in Yoff Layenne. She is married and the mother of 2 children, ages 3 and 6. She chose business with the goal of earning a profit and being able to meet her personal needs. She has been active in the purchase and sale of shoes, perfumes and cosmetic products since 2008. Madame F. has been a member of the bank of Yoff since November 2007. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 FRS to be used to buy merchandise to reinforce her stock in her shop. She hopes, with the increase in revenue, to improve the social situation of her family and also to increase the size of her store.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Minerva Mirabal 2 Group

texts.en:
Enriketa is the coordinator of her group, 'Minerva Mirabal 2' (named after one of the famed trio of sisters who stood up to Dictator Rafael Trujillo and paid the ultimate price for doing so). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her four children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to study. She needs to finish her studies. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to sew.

Enriketa is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for a year, starting when she received her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying goods for her little colmado where she sell rice, beans, sugar and vegetables and she want to build a wall for her business locale. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and finish building her home.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to have a business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy goods for her store and build a wall

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: If there is an individual who has taken pride in her teaching profession despite the low remuneration that teachers get, it has to be 46-year-old Bamuloho Grace. She has been a teacher for only three years.  Grace is married with three kids and teaches mostly in Bweyogerere which is a fast-paced suburban area. In a month she says earns about 145,000 shillings and with this loan, she wants to be empowered to comfortably pay up her kids' school fees on time.

loans.use: paying school fees for her kids on time

loans.name: Elizabeth Adjoa Bedu

texts.en: Elizabeth Adjoa Bedu M. sells 'wakye' with sauces at Elmina. She serves it with tomatoes and black sauce. Bedu is divorced and takes care of seven dependents. She has junior high educational background. Elizabeth responsibly takes care of her family. She will use the loan to purchase more rice and beans to prepare 'wakye' for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Bedu plans to invest into her children’s education.

loans.use: purchase more rice and beans to prepare 'wakye' (rice and beans cooked together) for sale

loans.name: Soun

texts.en: Soun N., 41, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She is a recycler, typically making US$3 of profit every day, while her husband operates a moto-taxi, earning US$2 per day. This couple has four children, two are in school, one stays at home and the other one is employed. Soun N. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for her employed child to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy different kinds of threads and cloth

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley P. is a married woman who lives in Zone 1, Nabulao, Sipalay City, Neg. Occ. She earns her living by operating five business ventures: sari-sari (general) store, buying and selling of vegetables, fishing, farming, and transport. Her husband Arturo P., who is 41 years old, works as a driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 1 child who is 9 years old.

Shirley joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Shirley has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to use as funds for business operations so that she can continue to save up for future education expenses for her child. Shirley P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Funds for business operations.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon G. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 40 years old. Marlon is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marlon owns & operates a business providing transportation services. Marlon has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marlon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlon is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marlon from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel W. is 43 years old and runs a motorcycle transport business popularly known as “Bodaboda” in Kenya. He is married to Jane Wacera and they have two daughters together: Winnie, who is in secondary school, and Susan, in primary school. His business is in Kiserian town, which is well populated. He has run the business for 4 years, and his monthly profit is Kshs 19,000 with no other sources of income.

Samuel was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients. This loan of Kshs 55,000 will be his first loan with KADET, and he plans to use the entire amount to purchase another motorbike. If the loan boosts the business, Samuel will develop his piece of land, which he bought previously.

Samuel's dream is to be able to build rental houses in the next 2 years. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike for his business.

loans.name: Dioubo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe solidarité Jàppo est créé depuis 06 mois, le 17 mai 2010. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui sont issues du même village. Elle ont formé leur groupe par des liens de parenté et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de MAKA L.. 

Madame BASSINE T. debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de niébé, de la transformation d'huile d'arachide et de l'embouche ovine. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle avant s'approvisionner en marchandise et acheter un mouton.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises et  renforcer ses épargnes. Elle soutien aussi son mari dans la prise en charge familiale
texts.en:
The Dioubo Solidarity Group was created half a year ago, on May 17, 2010. It is composed of 12 women, all native of the same village. They have created the group because they are linked through strong ties of kinship and natural affinity. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois Maka L..

Mrs Bassine T., standing at the right side of the photo, chairs the group. She is 42, married and the mother of ten children.

She sells black-eyed peas, produces peanut oil and rears cattle.

She will use her new loan to expand her inventory and buy a sheep. Her objective is to expand her inventory and save more money. She also supports her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: To buy a sheep, black-eyed peas and peanuts

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is from the village of Dumalogdog. She is 60 years old. Esterlita is a group member of PMPC. Esterlita is married and has eight children. To make a living, she operates a general store in the local community. This involves selling goods. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used for additional capital. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Esterlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her immediate family. About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To have additional capital to buy goods and other products to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda B. is married and lives in Prk. Bugnay, Brgy. Vsta Alegre, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by buying and selling nipa, a type of palm leaf which is used in homes and to make items such as baskets. Her husband Josue B., who is 52 years old, works as caretaker of a fish pond and also helps in his wife in her business activities. They have two children who are 18 and 21 years old. The older one is married while the younger is still in school. Merlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 because she wanted a better for her family. With the help of her 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been slowly lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. She has applied for a new loan to buy more nipa to sell, and hopes to generate enough income to help her younger child complete school. Merlinda B. following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To expand a small business selling nipa

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Unity” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 1,400,000.00 each in order to invest in their businesses. 

John Y. K. is the leader of this group. John is thirty-nine years old, and married with three children who are attending primary school. John sells drinks and provisions - powdered milk, butter, sardines, mayonnaise, etc. He has been in this business for ten years now. With the help of this loan, John will invest in his business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy drinks and provisions - powdered milk, butter, sardines, mayonnaise, etc. in large quantity to add to his business.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ángela es madre de  tres hijos, comerciante de ropa nueva y segunda mano, iniciando hace varios años con apoyo de su esposo quien labora como docente.
Atreves de los préstamos en Afodenic, ha logrado las mejoras de su vivienda pues son ocho ciclos de los cuales se ha beneficiado para obtener un techo digno para su familia.
Lo que quiere es poner cerámica en sala, ya que por medio de estos financiamientos le ha sido posible. Lo que comprara: cerámica, cemento bond, para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Ángela is the mother of three children and sells new and second hand clothing. She began her business a few years ago with the help of her husband, who is a teacher. 

Through loans from Afodenic, she has managed to improve her home. With eight loans, she has been able to obtain a good roof for her family. She now wants to put stoneware in a room in her house, and this method of financing has made that possible. She will buy tiles and cement to begin the work.

loans.use: Purchase of stoneware and cement to put in her home

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margret K., who lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda, is married and has seven children, six of whom are students. For over six years Margret has operated a business selling beer and local brew seven days a week. Her main business challenge is thieves. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more more crates of beer and jerycans of local gin.

Margret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and jerycans of local gin

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 56-year-old married woman. She lives in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family.

Maria is engaged in farming. She grows rice crops then sells her harvest to the people in her community. Maria said farming alone isn't enough to provide for all her family's needs. She opened a sari-sari store where she sells items like canned goods. She said that the store helps in their daily needs. Maria wishes for her businesses to improve.

Maria's loan will be used to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en: Esperanza is a member of the communal bank Musuq Rumi ("New Stone", in Quechua) which is in its 22nd loan cycle at FINCA Peru. She has been working with FINCA Peru for several years and was previously president of the communal bank and now acts as treasurer. She has three children, two of whom are still studying. She sells firewood from her home, which she purchases from producers. She will be using her loan of 500 PEN to purchase more firewood. She would like eventually to increase her sales and expand to sell other items such as groceries.

loans.use: to purchase firewood from producers to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 4 calves.

loans.name: Henry Nyabuto

texts.en:
Henry has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  He is 47 years old, married to Ruth Njambi and they have eight children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of 20,000 KES well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Henry hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Didancienne

texts.en:
Didancienne is 56 years old, she has four children who are between the ages of eight and sixteen. Her husband is a farmer. She raises cows and goats. She has done this business for 21 years. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more animals in order to get more produce from them. She thinks of renovating her house with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been educated through junior high school. Maame sells kako (a salted dried fish), wele (an edible cowhide) and fish in Elmina, which she has done for just 6 months. Maame uses her income to support her husband by paying for  utility bills and other household expenses. She will use the loan to purchase kako, fish and wele for resale. Her plan is to further grow her business with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase kako, fish and wele for resale.

loans.name: Riazan's Group

texts.en:
Riazan is 40 years old and married with four children. Her children stay at home and don’t do anything. Riazan unfortunately, couldn’t give them a proper education due to financial constraints. 

She is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She takes care of her children and fulfills their needs. 

Her husband operates a grocery store business. In his store, he sells daily household items such as lentils, spices, rice, etc. to his clients at reasonable rates. His business earns him good income every month which allows him to manage the household expenses. 

Riazan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband's business. Being the only breadwinner, his establishment in business is very necessary because the children are growing up now and their needs are also increasing. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity to offer more products to his clients and increase his profits. 

She is very hopeful that the loan will bring positive financial changes and improve the living standard of her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Riazan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Ramish

texts.ru:
Ramish rodilsya v 1978 qodu. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. 
Uje 8 let kak Ramish zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnogo produkta dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Ramish was born in 1978. He is an internally displaced person and has been relocated from the town Fuzili and now lives in the Fuzili region together with his friendly family. He is married and has two children. It has been eight years now since Ramish has been doing animal husbandry and breeding cows. Right now he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to increase their headcount and the volume of milk production for growth of his business.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Blanca Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora Blanca es socia del banco comunal El Mirador, vive por las afueras de la parroquia Turi, lugar que es reconocido por ser el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca ya que se puede observar desde allí gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es muy amable, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.
 
Doña Blanca tiene 46 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos de los cuales 5 son casados e independientes, sus tres hijos solteros son de 28, 25 y 17 años de edad, sus hijos mayores de edad trabajan y también estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como carpintero, la casa en la que habita es propia siendo el sacrificio del trabajo conyugal. 

La Señora. Blanca se dedica a la cría de  cuyes y pollos, esta actividad la realiza desde que se ha casado, también se dedica a la agricultura donde siembra hortalizas y vende en un mercado de la ciudad de Cuenca.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes para crecer en la cría de estos animales.
 
Su meta es realizar el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the community bank called El Mirador. She lives in the outskirts of the parish of Turi, a place that is well known for its viewpoint or "mirador" from which you can see most of the city of Cuenca. The people of Turi are very nice and they work in commerce, raising livestock, and agriculture. 
Blanca is 46 years old, married and has 8 children, 5 of whom are married and independent. Her three single children are 28, 25, and 17 years old. Her oldest children work and also study, and her youngest child is studying at the high-school in the city. Her husband is a carpenter, and the house they live in is the result of their own work and sacrifice. 
Blanca works raising guinea pigs and chickens. She has been doing this since she got married and she is also a farmer, raising vegetables that she sells in the market in the city of Cuenca. 
She has been a member of the community bank for 3 years and she will use the loan to buy guinea pigs to breed.
Her goals is to build a second story for her house.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Ena Melania

texts.es:
Ena de 51 años es madre de familia, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Monsefú que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.    Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

Ena se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace 5 años, su mercadería lo ofrece a sus clientes, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ena is a 51 year old mother.  She lives with her family in her own house, which has all of the basic services.  It is located in an urban zone in the Monsefú district, which belongs to the Chiclayo province.  The zone is known for its agricultural, livestock, and handicraft activities.

Ena sells clothes.  She set up this business in her house five years ago.  She has merchandise to sell to her customers, and she also takes orders.  She is trying to have more customer demand.  That way she will have more income to pay for the family expenses.

Upon noticing that her business is thriving more each day, she believed that she needed to request a loan for 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of merchandise and to stock her store with innovative products.  She will do this so that the number of customers that she has continues to increase.  This is so that she will be able to pay her loan and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Taufao

texts.en:
Taufao, age 65, owns and operates a bakery business in her local community. She has a year of experience in this business. Taufao hopes to obtain a loan in the amount of WST $1,000 to purchase additional cooking ingredients, such as baking powder and flavoring. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 230 talas or US $96 per week) to improve and expand the business. Taufao and her husband have four children. 
 
Taufao joined SPBD earlier this year in order to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Taufao's first loan through SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients such as baking powder and flavoring

loans.name: Abdilaziz

texts.ru:
Абдилазиз женат и любящий отец двух совершеннолетних детей. Он добрый и целеустремленный человек.  Он занимается купля продажей и установкой национальной печки (тандур).
