Он начал свой бизнес собственными капиталами и вложил все свои силы в нем. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить максимум прибыль для содержания соей семьи. Абдулазиз хочет отремонтировать своего автомобиля, который поможет ему для перевозки тандуров. С этой целью Абдилазиз запрашивает займ на сумму 1000$ США.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Abdilaziz is married and is a loving father of two adult children.  He is a kind and goal-oriented person.  He is involved in buying, selling and installing of national ovens (tandoor).  He started his business with his own funds and invested all his efforts into it.  He wants to expand his business and maximize his profits in order to support his family.  Abdilaziz wants to repair his vehicle, which will help him to deliver tandoor ovens.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $1000 for this purpose.

loans.use: to repair his delivery vehicle

loans.name: Maria Aurora

texts.es:
María Aurora tiene 26 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y con los tres hijos de nueve, ocho y seis años de edad en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Virgen de Guadalupe se encuentra ubicada en la Ciudadela 10 de noviembre, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a labores comerciales.

María se dedica a la crianza  y venta de pollos, los compra y los distribuye en Ventanas cada dos meses. Solicita el crédito para poder incrementar el negocio, comprar la  alimentación para los pollos balanceado, vacuna para la plaga y comprar más pollos para poder venderlos.

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder tener utilidades al momento de vender los pollos en buenas condiciones,  Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentemente es la competencia y las plagas que ha sabido manejar eficientemente.

El sueño es poder una granja para poder criar mejor a los pollos y posterior venderlos a mejor precio.
En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música y bailar.
texts.en:
María Aurora is 26 years old, married and living with her husband and three children who are 9, 8 and 6 years old in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Virgen de Guadalupe” communal bank are located in Ciudadela 11 de Noviembre belonging to Ventanas Canton.  They are in commercial activities.

María raises and sell chickens.  She buys them and sells them in Ventanas every two months.  She requests the loan to increase her business, to buy nutritionally balanced chicken feed and vaccines for the illnesses and also to buy more chickens to sell.

The loan will be of much help for her to have profits at the moment of selling the chickens in good condition.  Challenges she faces very frequently are competition and the diseases that she’s managed to handle efficiently.

Her dream is to be able to set up a farm to better raise the chickens to be able to sell them later for better prices.  She enjoys listening to music and dancing in her free time.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Betty has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Betty has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Betty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Santigie

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Santigie. He is married and has 4 children aged 2, 5, 7 and 9 years. In 2005, Santigie established his fuel (petrol, kerosene and diesel) station and bar business. Santigie started this business on a very small scale, selling fuel in small containers, and latter developed it to a full scale fuel station. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month. 

He would like a loan of Le 4,500,000. Santigie has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan and now requires a new loan to buy drinks: Stout - 10 crates @ Le88,000, Maltina - 10 crates @ Le37,000, Heineken - 10 crates @ Le210,000, soft drinks - 20 crates @ Le30,000, Carlsberg - 7 crates @ Le75,000 and pure drinking water - 10 bundles @ Le2,500. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Santigie plans to open a mini market and also to open other outlets. He wants to see his children attain better positions in society. By accessing more loans to sustain his business he can achieve his goal. He serves drivers and offices in the city centre and outskirts of town. His business is popular because he is always there to serves his customers. He has two workers: a sales man and a security guard. He gets his supplies from Freetown Kissy Terminal and the drinks along the main streets of Freetown. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy stock of drinks

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 30 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres a lado de ellos, asimismo ayuda constantemente en la economía de su hogar y es por eso que todos los días trabaja mucho para tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Liz consiste en la crianza de pollos, ella tiene un galpón que esta en la huerta de su casa, lleva ya trabajando con esto hace aproximadamente un año, y tiene la ayuda de su padre ya que él verifica a diario el crecimiento de sus pollos, y su madre quien sale a ofrecer y a vender en los diferentes mercadillos de la ciudad. Le gusta mucho este trabajo pues menciona que tiene ingresos diarios y le genera buenas ganancias, además es el único sustento de su familia, es rentable ya que su ganancia es un porcentaje alto. Espera poder seguir con este rumbo ya que le esta yendo bien, quisiera mas adelante instalar un  galpón más grande para así criar en mayor cantidad. Este será el sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy satisfecha con su grupo ya que son responsable y no tienen retrasos en sus pagos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará pollos pequeños para iniciar su crianza, además comprará vacunas, alimentos y algunos accesorios para criarlos.
texts.en: Liz is 30 years old and she is a very hardworking and she is a fighter. She is single and she lives in her parents' house together with them. She constantly contributes to the household economy and so she works very hard every day to have a better quality of life. Liz's business consists of raising poultry. She has a coop that is located in the garden of her house. She has been in business for approximately one year. Her father helps her by checking on the poultry every day. Her mother sets out to offer them up for sale in the different mini-markets in the city. She loves her work especially because she perceives a daily income and it generates good profits. It is the only source of support for the family and it is very profitable because the profit is a very high percentage. She hopes to keep working in this business because it has gone so well. She would like to install another larger cook in the future to be able to raise more poultry. This will be her sixth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is very satisfied with her group because they are responsible and they do not have any delays in their payments. With the amount requested, she will purchase chicks to raise them. She will also purchase vaccines, feeds, and a few accessories she needs to raise them.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, vaccines, and feed.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is married and 60 years old with 6 children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is operating a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for more than 6 years. Each month, she earns about Php 3,500. She has requested a loan in the amount of Php 5,000 to buy more products to sell. Alicia has been a member of GDMPC for more than one year. In the future she will save the returns for her educational plan for her six kids.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 21 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the  region of Uganda. For the past four years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her business, which sells timber. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more wood, and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and boost her family's welfare. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to complete the houses she is building and will eventually rent out. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ruth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more wood.

loans.name: Toth

texts.en:
Mrs. Toth is 47 years old. Mrs. Toth has six single children, all of whom live with her in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. Two of her children are chefs, working for a hotel in the province; every day they go to work by using a motor-taxi service, which causes them to spend a great deal on transportation fees to and from work. In the picture she is making baskets by joining strips of bamboo together. She learned these skills from her grandparents, who were successful basket weavers in prior years. Besides making baskets herself, she also buys them from other local weavers and then resells them to her frequent and regular customers. She said that many of her products are sold in the markets, especially to foreigners visiting Cambodia. She is able to earn approximately $5.00 per day from this business.

Mrs. Toth wants to reduce some of her business expenses and to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her two children that travel to work. Thus, she is seeking her first loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a second-hand motorcycle. In the future, she hopes to own a store where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle so that her children can save money traveling to and from work

loans.name: Milton Eduardo

texts.es:
Milton de 41 años, empezó con esta actividad porque toda su niñez le ha gustado la carrera corte de cabello y confección y puso sus habilidad es este negocio, y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien.

Su trabajo lo realiza de 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, también se ayuda vendiendo cosméticos de belleza. Hasta ahora no ha tenido ningún problema ni de robos ni de salud. No esta casado y no tiene hijos.

Quiere el prestamo para poder comprar tintes y maquinas para cabello para su peluquería. Su meta es poder tener su propio local para asi no pagar arriendo, y poder establecer sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Milton is 41 years old and started this business because as a child he liked the hairdressing profession. He applied his skill in this area to set up his own business and "gracias a Dios" (thanks to God) he is doing very well. 

He works from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening. He also supplements his income selling cosmetics and beauty products. So far he has not had any problems with thefts or his health. He is not married and has no children.

He wants the loan to buy hair dyes and machines for his hairdressing salon. His goal is to have his own locale so as not have to pay rent and be able to stabilize his income.

loans.use: to buy dyes and machines.

loans.name: Satria 2 Group

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is married and now she is 38 years old. She is a mother of three children. They are 18 years old, 15 years old and 13 years old. She has been selling vegetable soup since 2009 from her house. She also sells fried snacks. The business is running smoothly and she can generate income to help her husband sustain the family. Her husband is a part-time laborer and only works if there is an order. She is taking this loan to buy more vegetables and to make more varieties of vegetable soup. She likes to do this business because people like to eat her vegetable soup.

In the future, she wants to rent a space to open a small restaurant. She also hopes her children can finish studying at the University.

loans.use: to pay for more vegetables such as spinach and carrot to cook and sell.

loans.name: Bong

texts.en:
Mrs. Bong is a 43-year-old single parent who has been living in Kompong Cham province. To generate her income, she has been involved in cultivating rice crops. She has five children, one of whom works as a laborer in Korea in order to support the family and provide a good education for his younger brothers and sisters.  

Bong is now taking out a loan of $500 to buy a stock of cashew nuts from her local villagers’ plantations. This project will create a good income for the family later.

She will use the increase in her income to expand her businesses. She hopes to uplift her family out of poverty some day as she strives to work harder.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa is 43 years old, married, and the father of five children. He is in the motorcycle transport business and has been in it for the last three years earning a monthly profit of about Kes 15,000. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 30,000 which he will partly use to service his motorcycle, as well as also to buy some goats so that he could practice livestock farming. He will save the anticipated profit to help take care of his children.

 In future, the client hopes to grow his businesses and be financially stable.

loans.use: To service his motorcycle and open a new business.

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr: Honorine est âgée de 51 ans et vit au Bénin. Honorine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Honorine est une veuve et mère de deux enfants dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Honorine vit seule avec ses deux enfants et assure seule les diverses charges de la maison. Pour répondre à ses divers besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Honorine vend depuis une dizaine d’année des tissus et des bijoux par le système de distribution. Honorine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère cette activité, Honorine contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Honorine sollicite pour une quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois crédits reçus antérieurement par Honorine ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Honorine is 51 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. Honorine is a widowed mother of two children, both of whom are in her care and one of whom attends school. Honorine lives alone with her two children and provides for the household by herself. To respond to her various needs and those of her children, Honorine has sold fabric and jewelry through the distribution system for about ten years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. Thanks to the income generated by this activity, Honorine contributes to the various household expenses. To satisfy the needs of her growing clientele, Honorine is seeking a fourth loan with ALIDÉ. The three previous loans she received were all repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy jewelry and fabric.

loans.name: Suvadra

texts.en: Suvadra is 38 years-old .  She is Married and has 2 children aged 19 and 17.  In 2000, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys seeds and fertilizers for her farming work.  In the future, Suvadra plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 0  Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.  Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Qahtan

texts.en:
Qahtan is 23 years old. He is single. Qahtan as a carpenter for five  years. Qahtan has a brother study in secondary school. Because of his low income he was always worry about making enough money and pay for his brother's school expenses and at the same time he wants his brother to get high grades.
He is requesting a 3000 $ loan to pay for his brother's tuition fees. He aim to see his brother graduate.
The story of Qahtan and his brother is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients that are able to get better education.
The picture is showing Qahtan and his brother (the student).

loans.use: to pay for his brother's education.

loans.name: Sitan's Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  KANTIGUIYA I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DIALAKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le riz et le mil avec   GNELE, 1ère personne  assise de la  gauche vers   la  droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de DIALAKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider  aussi son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Enemecia

texts.es:
Enemecia, está acompañada, vive con su compañero de vida y dos hijos, en total su familia tiene 4 miembros, ella es sastre, oficio que aprendió con ayuda de su madre, pero ofrece sus servicios de forma independiente desde hace 9 años, es así como ella puede tener entradas de dinero para aportar en los gastos de su familia.
Con el crédito Enemecia podrá comprar telas, hilos agujas, botones, dedales, etc., al contar con estos materiales atenderá las demandas de prendas de vestir que ya tiene y las que espera que surjan en la temporada de fin de año, considera que la inversión le será de ayuda para estabilizarse económicamente.
Su visión es tener un negocio más grande y tener más clientes satisfechos con sus servicios.

loans.use: comprar telas, hilos agujas, botones, dedales, etc., al contar con estos materiales atenderá las demandas de prendas de vestir que ya tiene y las que espera que surjan

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lydiah would like to buy bicycles spare parts and house paints.

loans.name: Mohubbat

texts.en:
Mohubbat enjoys looking after calves. He has been in this business for 2 years. 
Having borrowed $600 he bought 3 calves. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a cow. 
Mohubbat is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region who is settled in the Fizuli region Kayidish village,which is built for IDPs.
Mohubbat is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Shiren Agha

texts.en: Shiren Agha lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a carpenter with his own shop. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to buy new machines and enlarge his shop and earn more money because he wants to get married. He wants to work hard to solve his problems and he is very happy that he can expand his business and make a good income. He would like to thank AFSG for helping him.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Marcelle

texts.en: A. Marcelle is a 40 year old single mother. She lives with her beautiful 10 year old daughter in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. Early every morning, she goes to the Yopougon open market to sell various food products such as ground-nut paste and spices. Marcelle has been active in this business since 1980. This business helped her to pay for tailoring courses for her daughter, whose dream is to open her own fashion wear shop when she has completed her training. Marcelle is dynamic and courageous. She heard about AE&I in 2005 from her friend and has benefited from some microcredits that she reimbursed in a good manner.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of ground-nut paste

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa is a married woman with four children. She has been in business for the last seven years. She deals in shoes and clothes. She hopes to turn her shoe business into a wholesale shop to be able to sell in big quantities and therefore increase her income. She will also be able to supply many retail traders in Kayunga town, hence reducing their costs of shopping from Kampala which is 78 km away from Kayunga town. She anticipates sales of USD $70 daily after stocking the highly demanded shoes from China.

loans.use: Hanifa wants to buy two boxes of ladies' shoes and one box of children's shoes.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam C., age 62, lives with her husband and six children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She runs a stand in Phnom Penh city selling rice, making around $3 each day.  Her husband owns a grinding mill and hires it to his neighbors, earning a meagre income.  Two of her children work selling rice with her; two others run a store, and the rest attend school. Mrs. Sam C. hopes to use this loan to purchase more rice to expand her inventory in order to meet the growing demands of her clients.  (Mrs. Sam C. with the black shirt is pictured with one of her daughters).

loans.use: To purchase more rice to expand her inventory

loans.name: Sera

texts.en: Sera F. lives in the village of Sinamoga, where she runs a barbecue business. She is 27 years old and has one son. She sells her goods three days a week , and usually earns about $160 a month. Sera has received two loans from us, and made good use of each of them to run and expand her business. She is a hard-working woman, and has come to us for a new loan to buy more food to cook and sell at her barbecue stand.

loans.use: To buy items to barbecue, such as mutton, turkey and sausage

loans.name: Mini

texts.en: Mini, 22, has a food stall at her house, where she sells snacks, earning USD3 a day. Her husband, U., sells steel and earns USD6 a day. She is requesting a loan of USD100 to fill her stall with more goods, and as a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her stall with more goods

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 22-year-old taxi driver. He lives in the Beirut suburbs. Ali is planning to get engaged to be married. He needs a loan for the maintenance of his car so as to be able to sustain his business and pay for all his engagement expenses. This is the first time Hussein is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his car

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Naila lives with her husband and child in the Khachmaz region (her husband is pictured here). They have had a general store for 6 years. Now they are requesting a loan of $850 to buy goods for improving their business.

loans.use: Buy goods to sell in the store

loans.name: Emira

texts.en:
Emira is a 58-year-old woman from Donja Orahovica, a small village near the town of Gračanica. She is married and her husband has a full-time job in a shopping mall. His monthly income is 400 KM (about US$ 320). They live alone and this is her second loan through MCO WWI.

Emira intends to use this loan in the amount of US$ 500 for buying compost for her agriculture work. Her wish is to improve her monthly income and their living standard generally.

loans.use: To buy compost for her fields

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 27 year old entrepreneur and mother of four school-aged children. She and her husband live in Kisumu in Kenya. She began her current business selling second-hand clothes three years ago. She specializes in women’s clothing: skirts, dresses, and casual and formal tops. She is able to purchase a good variety at wholesale prices. And the prime location of her business on a busy street, three years of experience, and friendly interaction with customers have established a good client base. Her customers return to her shop for her wide selection or to make requests for certain styles.

Jacinta plans to expand her business with her next loan of $600.00. She will use the loan to increase her current stock of second-hand clothes and save the remaining funds in a savings account so that she may continue to purchase new stock even when cash flow slows due to delays in customer payments.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock of second hand clothes

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian K. sells provisions. She is married but her husband's income from his job at the University Press is not sufficient for Vivian and her six children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling provisions.

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es:
Araceli is a domestic employee and her husband is a construction bricklayer. They have two children in school age. Her house is located in the area of Irpavi II in the city of La Paz. She lives as a minder and she is requesting a loan to be able to pay the down payment of a lot. This way she will be able to own her own house in the future, since she is a combatant woman. This is the fourth time that she has requested a loan with Impro. Her record qualifies her as client 1 meaning that she pays her loans on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

Araceli es empleada domestica y su esposo es albañil constructor, tienen dos hijos en edad escolar Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz; vive como cuidadora por lo cual solicita el crédito para cancelar una parte del monto total requerido para la compra de un terreno, y así poder contar con una vivienda propia en el futuro ya que es una mujer luchadora. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.

loans.use: Buy a lot so later build her own house.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing I. is 40 years old, married and has two children. She owns a store were she sells groceries and other items. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria and has been in business for one year. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more provisions to sell, and wishes to extend her thanks to everyone who chooses to help her.

loans.use: To buy more provision to sell

loans.name: Nuria

texts.es:
Nuria tiene 34 años, es madre de 4 hijos estudiantes que son su mayor inspiración de salir adelante. Ella vive junto a su esposo Vicente, quien la apoya en todo, sobre todo en su negocio.
Se dedica a la venta de verduras regionales (tomates, caiguas, ajíes, pepinos, culantros y otras variedades) en un puesto del mercado Bellavista. Se levanta muy temprano (2:00am), para ir a comprar en el puerto, las variadas verduras que traen los campesinos.Luego de comprar, trae sus productos a venderlos al mercado hasta las 7 de la mañana, cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que consumen mucho de estos productos regionales. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es vender y dar una buena atención.
Nuria trabaja para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos diarios y la educación de sus hijos.
Ahora, quiere implementar su puesto con más productos y exportarlos a la capital, posteriormente poner una  bodega en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Nuria is 34 years old and the mother of 4 children who all attend school. They are her greatest inspiration to succeed. Nuria lives with her husband Vincente, who supports her in all things, above all in her business. She sells regional produce such as tomatoes, cucumbers and many other types of vegetables from a small stand in the Bellavista market. She gets up very early, 2am, in order to go shopping at the port and take advantage of the variety of produce brought in from the countryside. After purchasing the vegetables, she brings them to the market to sell at 7am. She counts on a good quantity of customers who consume a lot of the regional produce. What she likes about her work is the selling and the good customer service. Nuria works to help with the household costs and the education of her children. Now, she would like to stock her stand with more products and grow her business, eventually setting up a small cafe/shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO STOCK A GREATER VARIETY OF PRODUCE TO SELL AND GROW HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Sofai

texts.en: Sofai T., 56, is married with 9 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the taro and banana plantation business. She sells to the general public, villagers 3 days per week. She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (~291 USD).  SPBD loans are Sofai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She is the centre chief of their village, running a plantation with the support of her relatives.

loans.use: Purchase loan will be used for purchasing wheelbarow, spade, crowbar, weedkiller chemicals and fungicide for prevention of taro blight

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 50 years old and married with four children. Grace sells drinks and foodstuffs and she has been in this business since 2004. Her children assist her in selling drinks and foodstuffs, and they do not attend school. She buys foodstuffs from the village market and sells to her customers through retail. She buys her drinks from distributors in Lagos. Grace needs the loan amount of 70000 Naira to buy more drinks directly from the company at a reduced rate. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support, and to LAPO MICROFINANCE for their business training.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 48 años, es casada tiene cuatro hijos, ahora vive con tres de ellos. Desde los 25 años se dedicó al negocio de venta de comida en las ferias, con esfuerzo pudo adquirir su propia casa donde ahora tiene un restaurante y le va muy bien. Los más fieles de sus clientes son los transportistas, los días no puede abrir su negocio, la buscan impacientes. La venta de comida le es muy rentable, también aprovecha en vender gaseosas y cervezas. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero piensa comprar bebidas y cervezas, además de víveres para la preparación del menú diario.
texts.en:
Julia is 48 years old and married with 4 children. 3 of the children still live at home. For 25 years, Julia has worked selling food at the markets. With a lot of effort, she was able to buy her own house where she runs a small restaurant. The truckers are her most loyal customers, and on the days when she can't open her business, they are all waiting impatiently for her to reopen. The business is good, and she also sells sodas and beer to generate additional income. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money, she wants to purchase more drinks and beer, as well as ingredients needed to prepare the daily meals she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beverages for her restaurant, as well as ingredients for the daily menu she offers

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: El señor Marcos labora para una empresa de pisos y acabados, su esposa la señora Berenice trabaja para una compañía de la ciudad, ellos están solicitando este crédito ya que desean construir una barda en el frente de su casa para mayor privacidad y seguridad de la familia.
texts.en:
Marcos works for a flooring business, his wife Berenice works for a company in the city. They are seeking a loan as they wish to construct a fence in front of their home for greater privacy and security for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buid a fence in front of their home

loans.name: Mondoukpè Bilikissou

texts.fr: Originaire de LAGBE un petit village du département de l'OUEME, dame Y. Bilikissou est née le 18/05/1979 à cotonou la capitale économique du BENIN. Elle est mariée à AKANDE Basitou un commerçant de profession. Elle a trois enfants dont deux garçons et une fille tous scolarisés. Elle exerce l'activité de la vente de divers; par exemple: les produits de beauté, de cheveux, sucre, lait liquide et en poudre, savons, détergents, biscuits, bombons et huile d'arachide. Elle va s'approvisionner à Tokpa (marché international du BENIN). Elle est à son troisième crédit pour soutenir son activité.
texts.en:
From LAGBE, a small village in OUEME County, Ms. Bilikissou Y. was born on May 18, 1979 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Mr. Basitou AKANDE, a merchant by trade, and has three children, including two boys and a girl, all of whom are in school. Her work involves selling various goods, for example: beauty products, hair products, sugar, whole milk and powdered milk, soap, detergents, cookies, candy, and peanut oil. She is going to get supplies in Tokpa (international marketplace of Benin). She is on her third loan for supporting her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products, hair products, and various other goods

loans.name: Isabel Petronila

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Bancomunal Maria De la Paz.
Isabel  es casada tiene 46 años, tres hijos 22, 21, y 20 años, ellos  estudios superiores.
Estudió corte y confección, trabajando conoció al que ahora es su esposo, que también confeccionaba, se casaron y ambos pusieron un taller de confección, desde hace diez años, ahora reparte su mercadería a gamarra, al mercado central y lleva para Trujillo.  
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió   como enseñan a ahorrar ha sido de mucha ayuda, también los prestamos que brindan, le gusta por que ha conocido mujeres emprendedoras responsables, también puede hacer intercambio de negocios, su auto-estima  como mujer a crecido.  
Isabel necesita un crédito de 1600 soles, para la compra de tela polipima blanca y zapatos.
El sueño de Isabel es tener una tienda para vender la ropa que confecciona.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the community bank "Maria de la Paz". Isabel is married, 46 years old, and has three children aged 22, 21, and 20; they are attending higher education schools. She studied dressmaking and met her husband through work as was also in tailoring; they married and opened a dressmaking and tailoring shop 10 years ago. Now she delivers her merchandise to the Gamarra shopping centre, to the central market and to Trujillo. Since joining Finca she has learned about saving money, which has been very helpful, as wells as about loans; she likes that she has met responsable women entrepreneurs as well as been able to exchange businesses. Her self-confidence as a woman has grown. Isabel needs a 1,600 soles loan to buy white polycotton fabric and shoes. Isabel's dream is to own a store where she would sell the clothes she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy white polycotton fabric and shoes

loans.name: Ramona Auxiliadora

texts.es: Ramona Auxiliadora S. S. tiene 40 años, su estado civil es casada, y tiene un hijo. Doña Ramona tiene la actividad económica de la venta de mercadería en general como ropa, calzado y cosméticos. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a su negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Ramona son de abastecer su negocio para que de esta forma no tenga carencia de productos. El financiamiento solicitado es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de su mercadería. Sus sueños son de innovar cada día con su negocio ya que todos los días se promociona un nuevo producto. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 15.000 córdobas a un plazo de 14 meses.
texts.en:
Ramona Auxiliadora S. S. is 40 years old, married, and has one son. Ramona’s job is to sell general merchandise like clothes, shoes and cosmetics. She has worked in this business for the past 10 years. Ramona’s goal is to stock up on merchandise so she won’t lack any products. The loan is for the capital needed to purchase her merchandise. Her dream is to be innovative with her business and promote a new product every day. The amount she is asking for is C$ 15.000 córdobas that will be repaid in 14 months.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase volume of goods sold

loans.name: Domitila T.

texts.es:
La señora Domitila T. A. R. tiene 51 años, vive en el caserío de San Luis, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 2do de primaria, dejo los estudios debido a que sus padres se enfermaron y no tenían los medios económicos para seguir apoyándola. Domitila no tiene hijos, se dedica a la fabricación y renovación de calzado, empezó ayudando a su hermano en la fabricación de calzado, al casarse decidió junto a su esposo poner su propio negocio que le ha sido muy rentable y que lleva mas de 28 años, asimismo en tiempos de cosecha se dedica a la venta de cereales y papa, su negocio se desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, lo invirtió en la compra de material para calzado.
Con el crédito de 2500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en ampliar su capital con la compra de material para fabricación de calzado. 
Domitila tiene el gran sueño de comprarse un carro y una moto.
texts.en:
Señora Domitila T. A. R. is 54 years old and lives in the San Luis country house in the district of Salpo, in the province of Otuzco in the region of La Libertad in Peru.

She was in school until the second grade and left her studies as her parents became ill and didn’t have the financial means to keep supporting her. Domitila does not have any children and dedicates herself to making shoes. When she got married she decided with her husband that she would start her own business which has been very profitable and is now 28 years old. In times of harvest she also sells cereals and gruel - her sales take place at her home.

With her first loan for 300 soles which she received from her communal bank, “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (“Working Women”), she purchased materials for shoes. With the loan for 2500 soles, which will be paid off in 4 months, she intends to increase her capital for buying materials for the fabrication of shoes.

Domitila’s big dream is to buy a car and a motorbike.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of all types of materials to make shoes

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru: Умеда - женщина 36 лет. Вдова и мать 2-х детей. Её муж умер несколько лет назад и она осталась одна со своими детьми. Она занимается откормом скота дома. Её брат помогает ей продавать скот на скотном рынке. Так как в сельской местности нет другой работы, ей приходится заниматься мужской работой. Ведь ей нужно прокормить и вырастить своих детей. Умеда очень надеется, что наш кредит поможет ей в достижении её цели.
texts.en:
Umeda is a woman of 36 years of age. She is a widow and a mother of two children. Her husband has passed away several years ago and she was left alone with her children. She raises cattle at home. Her brother helps her sells the cattle on the market. There's no other work in the villages and she has to do a man's job. She needs to feed and raise her children. Umeda is very hopeful that this loan will help her achieve her goals.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Arolyn

texts.en: Arolyn M. sells pigs at the public market as well as in neighboring towns and to her neighbors. She is a 44-year old housewife, married with four children, and resides in Mobod, Oroquieta City. Her husband is an overseas Filipino worker (OFW). She plans to expand her piggery and wishes to buy more piglets and pig supplements. She wants to see her business expand so that her family can live comfortably in the future.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and pig supplements

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
" I am a tenant but I never stop believing that someday I will have a farm of my own that I will use to provide the needs of my family. For many years, I acquired the skills to properly grow rice. My husband is also a farmer and we are working together to send all of our three children to school", says Aida D. C., a 32-year old farmer from Agusan Del Sur.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase 2 sacks of complete fertilizer and 3 sacks of ammonium sulfate. She thinks that, by doing so, she will be able to help her husband increase their harvest.

CEVI helps small business grow. It not only provides people with loans, but with training and insurance coverage, too.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and ammonium sulfate

loans.name: Jamaladdin

texts.en: Jamaladdin F. is 42 and married with three children. He sells confections, such as candies, cookies, pastries, and fruit jelly. In business for eight years, Jamaladdin sells the goods from the market in the small village of Agsu city. The generated income allows him to support his family, for whom he is the sole income earner. Today he is requesting 1200 USD to increase the range of goods he carries. Jamaladdin thanks all for their support and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: purchase more goods for store

loans.name: Jachaptañani Jovenes Group

texts.es: En el Centro Focal  “Panamericana” se encuentra el grupo “Jachaptañani Jóvenes”, con casi dos años de vida, cuenta con cinco integrantes dos se dedican a la artesanía en yeso, dos a la costura de ropa y uno a la venta de videos. Su presidenta es Fabiola F. que tiene el negocio de artesanía en Yeso y se encuentra muy motivada a invertir el préstamo en su negocio, específicamente comprará materia prima como el estuco. Al igual que Fabiola, todos los integrantes del grupo desean hacer crecer su negocio y al mismo tiempo esperan que sea un gran apoyo para culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
The group “Jachaptañani Jóvenes” can be found in the Panamerican Center. The five group members have been together for almost two years; two of the group create crafts from plaster, two make clothing, and one sells videos. Fabiola F. is the president of the group, and she has a business selling plaster crafts. She is very eager to use the loan in her business, specifically to buy basic materials such as stucco. Like Fabiola, all the members of the group want to expand their businesses, and as well they hope to complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic materials

loans.name: La Soñadora 2 Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Soñadoras” esta representado por la señora Cristina Vanessa y conformada por 15 miembros los cuales van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas  D. trabajar para salir adelante con sus pequeños negocios D. venta D. productos como refrescos, cosméticos, comida, ropa, empanadas y a actividades como la costura D. prendas D. vestir y al servicio D. entrega en moto taxis. Dentro D. los rubro comercial existe un alto nivel D. competencia pero las ganas D. salir adelante hacen que nuestras socias trabajen para sacar adelante a sus familias; es por esta razón que requieren D. un financiamiento, que les ayudara en la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas para mejorar sus ingresos y por enD. a mejorar la calida D. vida D. sus familias. Por ser su segundo ciclo la Fundación Agrocapital les brinda un apoyo económico para que sigan creciendo y fortificando más sus ingresos diarios.
texts.en:
The “Las Soñadoras" ("The Dreamers") Community Bank is represented by Cristina Vanessa and consists of 15 members who have enrolled in their second loan cycle demonstrating responsibility, honesty and a desire to work to make headway with their small business. The members sell products such as drinks, cosmetics, food, clothing, empanadas, make dresses and drive taxis. There is a high level of competition within their commercial environment, but their desire to keep moving ahead and proviD. for their families has maD. the members work hard. It's for this reason they are requesting the loan, which will help them acquire materials, ingredients and tools that will increase their profits and in turn improve their families' quality of life. With their second loan cycle from Kiva partner Fundación Agrocapital, they are provided financial support so they can continue to grow and increase their daily income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Liliane

texts.en: Liliane is 21 years old, engaged and lives with her parents. Earlier this year, she decided to open a clothing store called the "Lily Shop" in order to improve her life and the life of her fiancee. Today, she is seeking to increase her income by applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita S. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 50 years old. Carmelita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In May 2009, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Vali

texts.en:
Vali A. is 43 years old. Together with his wife he has been raising cattle for more than 3 years. This produces the income which allows him to feed his  wife and 3 children . As well as caring for his livestock, Vali also cultivates agricultural crops which helps with the family's diet and provides additional income. Vali has asked for this loan to buy young cattle in order to obtain a better profit. His greatest wish is to be able to improve his farm by constructing enclosures and establishing better grazing for his livestock.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario R. is a 57-year-old widow who currently lives in a socialized government housing facility for the poor in Malibay, Pasay City.

Life has been hard for Rosario especially now as she is adjusting to her new environment since she and her siblings moved to their new house under government subsidy. But she stays strong and with her will, she has been able to re-establish her general store in the heart of the housing facility. She is now earning at least P7,000.00 a month and is quite optimistic that she can make the dream of having a grocery store in the community come true in the soonest possible time.

Rosario got to know the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2001.  She is now on her 17th loan cycle and has applied for a new loan in the amount of PHP11,000.00 so that she can expand her general store.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: business expansion.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni E. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread and is requesting a loan to purchase baking flour. Poni is 39 years old and married to a policeman. She has one child who does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase baking flour

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia F. is a 31-year-old woman living in the town of Leualesi, Leauvaa. She is married and has five school-aged children. Malia owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 400 WST a month. In 2007, Malia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Malia is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya de l’association Sindiya sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  ayant  une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire. Tous  les deux  prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles font la vente du bois de chauffe, des savons traditionnels,  des condiments alimentaires etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, un chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 185 morceaux de savons traditionnels et 4paquets condiments alimentaires. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et dans les villages avoisinants.
Elles vendent  dans les marchés de Sikasso ville, à domicile et de façon ambulante, au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members in the Danaya group of the Sindiya association are made up mainly of married women who are on average 30 years old, with 3 children and live in monogamous families. They live in Hamdallaye, a suburb of the city of Sikasso, the third administrative region im Mali. They work with the Soroyiriwaso microfinance company to meet their customers needs and they are making their third group loan. Their two previous loans have been duly repaid. They sell firewood, traditional soaps, basic food condiments, etc. With their new loan, they plan to buy, a truckload of firewood, 185 pieces of traditional soap and four crates food condiments. They buy their supplies at the main market in the city of Sikasso and in the surrounding villages. They resell their products in the markets of Sikasso, door to door and by hawking, for cash and often times for credit to a clientele made up of both men and women. They each expect to earn a monthly income of 23,000 CFA. Part of the profit will be used for savings and the needs of the family. Part will be invested in their business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies of varions products for resale

loans.name: Christine Achieng

texts.en: Christine is twenty four years old and married with four children. For the last four years, she has been selling new and used clothing. Her business is threatened by strong competition from similar businesses and hurt by the relative lack of customers during the rainy season. She will be using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy used and new clothes in order to prepare herself for the festive season, when demand is expected to more than double. In the future, she wants to own a large boutique in Kisumu City. Christine describes herself as hardworking, patient and determined.

loans.use: purchasing new and used clothes

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret A. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and bananas at the market and is requesting a loan to stock onions to sell. Margret is 30 years old and is married to an electrician. She has three children who do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop in the market.

About BRAC:
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock onions to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, 39, is a housewife who sells barbecue on the side street. Married to Juan Apolonio B., they are blessed with nine children. Of the nine, three are already working, and six stay at home. Her husband works as a head of exploration in a mining company and they live in Caloocan City. In spite of the great size of her family, Mary Ann is a determined businesswoman. Her barbecue stand has been helping her family for three years as an added source of income. She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation* just this year, and has already received three loans from CCT because of good attendance in their weekly fellowship meetings and her regular payment of dues.

She wants to further expand her business this Christmas season by applying for a PHP 8,000 loan so that she can use it as additional capital to buy more meat for her barbecue stand. With her extra earnings she hopes that by next year she can start another business aside from her barbecue stand. 
Her prayer is that some day, all her children can finish their studies and eventually have a job.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more meat for her barbecue stand.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn Z. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Marlyn owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Marlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Gloria Angelica

texts.es: Gloria angélica M. de 44 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su familia, la cual está conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Desde hace 19 años Gloria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, negocio el cual es muy rentable para ella por el hecho de que no cuenta con ningún tipo de competencia en la zona. Ella posee la tortillería en su casa de habitación, lugar en el cual las personas llegan a comprar su producto diariamente, ya que las tortillas se comen todos los días, incluso acompañan a los alimentos hasta dos veces al día. Gloria solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz al mayoreo, ya que ella desea aprovechar esta temporada en la que el maíz es más barato que en el resto del año. Para ella es de mucha importancia el poder vender más tortillas, esto debido a que sus hijos a medida van creciendo van teniendo necesidades extras, e incluso los estudios se van haciendo más caros, a pesar de esto Gloria desea poder brindarles todo lo necesario, razón por la cual quiere invertir más en su negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
44-year old Gloria Angélica M. lives in the municipality of San Martín which is located in San Salvador department. She lives with her husband and two children who are students. For nineteen years Gloria has made and sold tortillas. Her business is very profitable because, as she says, there is no competition in the area. She runs the business out of her home, where her customers come to buy the tortillas on a daily basis. Tortillas are eaten everyday, and up to twice daily with meals. Gloria is asking for a loan to buy corn wholesale and take advantage of cheaper prices by buying at this time of year. It is very important to her to be able to sell more tortillas as her children are growing and will need extra things. As well, the cost of their education will get more expensive. In spite of these problems Gloria wants to be able to provide all the necessities of life for her family, so she wants to further invest in her business and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Diolizana

texts.es: Diolizana, es una mujer muy responsable, vive en Distrito de Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 39 años, es madre de tres menores de edad, ella se dedica a la repostería, esta actividad la realiza en su domicilio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es Ingeniero Agrónomo. Diolizana forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas 2”, desde hace 2 años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en su negocio de repostería, ahora ella necesita un crédito de  1,000 soles, para invertir en la compra de materiales e insumos para repostería. La meta de Diolizana es crecer en su negocio y como empresaria.
texts.en:
Diolizana is a very responsible woman. She lives in the Calleria district of the Ucayali region. She is 39 years old and the mother of 3 young children. Diolizana makes baked goods from her home, where she is assisted by her husband, an agronomist. Diolizana has been part of "Las Golondrinas 2" (The Swallows 2) community bank for 2 years. The first loan she received was for 300 PEN, which she invested in her bakery business. She now needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to invest in the purchase of materials and supplies for baking. Her goal is to develop her business and her entrepreneurial skills.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials and supplies for baking.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena B. is from the village of  Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 42 years old. Lorena is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Lorena owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from her computer ink refilling business in the local community. Lorena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lorena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lorena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 33-year-old ambitious married lady who has been running an electronic shop for ten years, assisted by one employee.  Previously, she   farmed and sold clothes.  Grace feels great gratitude to Faulu Kenya for helping her save her money, and now she wants to take her first loan of Kes.20,000 to add a stock of spare parts for sale.  She hopes to buy a car and a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a wife of H. A. and lives in the city of Borewala, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines. Her husband has a sweetmeat shop in the main market. He has a long list of customers because he has maintained the quality of his shop over the seven years he has been in business. His earnings help him to improve his family's standard of living. 
Khalida is also a very hardworking lady. She sells different kinds of books in her bookshop. Her collection is centered on syllabus books, religious books and comic stories, which are all in high demand. She has been running this business for the past two years. Her income helps her to meet financial expenses with her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy items, such as cooking oil, sugar and dry fruits, to expand her husband’s sweetmeat shop.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her husband's sweetmeat business

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita P. is from the village of Southwestern. She is 38 years-old and married with five adult children. To make a living, Marianita sells ready-to-wear items. Through this activity she is able to earn a monthly net income of about to 1,600.00. She has been doing her business for more than two years.

In 2001, Marianita joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marianita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business . Marianita is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new stock. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Marianita from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luis Tiene 43 años de edad es separado tiene una hija de 10 años de edad ella se encuentra viviendo en Lima juntamente con su madre. El Sr. Luis vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en el AA.HH el Juncal B-04 casa de material noble de dos pisos. El  actualmente cuenta con el ingreso del servcio de transporte en vehiculo propio recientemente adquirido, el se inicio como chofer el viene trabajndo hace 14 años, asi pudo juntar su dinero para adquirir su vehiculo propio.El Sr. Luis tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener una cas propia, con el dinero que solicita invertira en mantenimiento de su vehiculo.El Sr. Luis Tiene 43 años de edad es separado tiene una hija de 10 años de edad ella se encuentra viviendo en Lima juntamente con su madre. El Sr. Luis vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en el AA.HH el Juncal B-04 casa de material noble de dos pisos. El  actualmente cuenta con el ingreso del servcio de transporte en vehiculo propio recientemente adquirido, el se inicio como chofer el viene trabajndo hace 14 años, asi pudo juntar su dinero para adquirir su vehiculo propio.El Sr. Luis tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener una cas propia, con el dinero que solicita invertira en mantenimiento de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Luis, 43, is separated and has a 10-year-old daugther who lives in Lima with her mother. Luis lives in his parents’ house which is in El Juncal; it’s a two-story house made of substantial materials. He recently acquired a vehicle with which he provides public transportation services. He has worked as a driver for 14 years and was able to save up enough to buy his own vehicle. Luis has many dreams and objectives one of which is to own his own home. He will use the requested funds for vehicle maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase mulches and hire more laborers

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 43 years old. Josephine is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP whenever she sells her raised animals.

In 2010, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda B. is a widow who lives in Prk. Santol, Sitio Malarong, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a food vending business. Nilda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past thirteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nilda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 15,000 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, she is borrowing 17,000 PHP which she intends to use to improve her business so that she can continue to save up for the future. She will purchase new equipment that can be useful for her business. Nilda B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
This is Miriam F., 48, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo Figueroa, a businessman, and mother of five children, one of whom is not going to school yet. By the grace of God, Miriam has managed to support her older children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to send her children to school until they are in college. This is a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Miriam, as she herself was a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave their children.

Miriam operates a variety store while overseeing operations of their tricycle. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Miriam earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and reselling at a piece rate. 

Meanwhile, her tricycle, a sidecar attached to a motorcycle which is used as transportation between narrow streets and off the highways, is being operated by her husband. Miriam’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers in her store and for her tricycle are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products such as groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Miriam dreams of being able to give all her children a good, high quality education through her hard work in her business. She also hopes to save part of her income to use for future expansion of her business.

loans.use: buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en:
Duyen T. D. is 23 years old and is married. She lives in Luc Canh village with her husband and her two children who are going to school.

Duyen T. D. sells pork in the market and, beside that, she grows rice. She has had this job for three years and earns a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND).

Duyen T. D. has participated in SEDA since 2006. For her last loan, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and has completely repaid this amount punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rosa Violeta

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 57 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el sector El Espinal del distrito de Oyotún, un distrito agrícola situado a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, se caracteriza por poseer tierras fértiles y un terreno accidentado dada su cercania con la sierra norte del país.

Se dedica desde hace mas de treinta años a la agricultura, ella cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar arroz, cabe resaltar que la zona posee abundante agua en sus canales de regadío por lo que este cultivo se siembra dos veces al año, a diferencia de la mayor parte de los distritos de la región que solo lo siembran una vez al año.
