Esta actividad es una fuente bastante importante de ingresos para su familia por lo que siempre trabaja arduamente de modo que pueda conseguir una buena cosecha, precisamente, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas.

Su mas grande anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, Rosa es una persona tranquila, responsable y muy trabajadora, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 57 year old mother who lives with her husband in the El Espinal area of Oyotún, an agricultural district located 2 hours away from the city of Chiclayo. The area is known for its fertile land, and to the rugged terrain it owes to its proximity to the mountains in the north of the country. Rosa has spent more than 30 years working in agriculture. She has a plot of land on which she grows rice, and which has so much water for its irrigation channels that she is able to plant twice a year. Most rice-growing districts in the region are able to plant just one crop per year. Rice-growing is very important to the family's income, so she always works hard to ensure a good harvest. To achieve her aim of a good harvest, Rosa has decided to seek a loan for the first time, of 2000 soles ($725) from Edpyme Alternativa. She plans to invest it in the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides. Her greatest wish is to go on working to be able to improve her family's quality of life. Rosa is a calm, responsible and very hard-working woman, and her neighbours regard her as a reliable, trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides that will improve the rice crop

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

El socio es el Sr .Marco;  El tiene 27 años de edad,  es soltero y  se dedica a la compra y venta de celulares, el alquila un espacio en el mercado el paraíso y hay vende celulares de segunda mano, también repuestos y accesorios y algunas veces los repara. El necesita el dinero como capital de trabajo. El socio solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de mercadería.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” communal bank. This bank is located in the Santiago district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. His name is Marco, and he is 27 years old. He is single and works buying and selling cell phones. He rents a space in the El Paraíso market, and there he sells secondhand cell phones. He also sells spare parts and accessories, and he sometimes repairs phones. He needs the loan funds as working capital. He is requesting the loan to buy merchandise. The borrower appreciates and values the loan, and accordingly, he is committed to making his payments in a disciplined manner according to the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Yovana Ubaldina

texts.es:
Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Kantuta” desde hace tres años, que pertenece al distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con grado de instrucción secundaria (completo), tiene dos hijos, uno de 6 y otro de un año respectivamente.
Se dedica a la compra y venta de casacas de cuero que lleva de desaguadero a Tacna, lo distribuye al por mayor, paralelamente tiene una tienda de abarrotes en Yunguyo. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Solicitará  un nuevo crédito de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles  para comprar casacas de cuero.   
Su visión es tener un locutorio. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal es la forma de trabajo de su promotora.


En la foro se muestra a la socia en su otro negocio, venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Yovana has been a member of the communal bank “Flor de Kantuta” for three years. It is in ths district and province of Yunguyo, Puno department. She is 27 years old, in a common law marriage, and has finished her secondary education. She has two children, 6 and 1, repsectively. She buys and sells porks rinds, which she takes from Desaguadero to Tacna. She distributes them wholesale. She also has a grocery store in Yunguyo. With the first loan that she asked for from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, which was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, she was able to increase her capital. She will ask for a new loan of S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles to purchase pork rinds. Her vision is to run a call center. What she likes the most about her little communal bank is the way her developer works. The photo shows the member at her other business, selling groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pork rinds wholesale.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: La señora Viviana  de 24 años de edad casada hace 9 años, tiene  dos  hijos de siete  y seis años  que se encuentran en edad escolar, viven el Barrio Toborochi zona parque Industrial, la Sra. Viviana Viviana se dedica hace  cinco años a la elaboración de pan, la Sra. Viviana  cuenta con un ingreso  como  profesora interina,  es clienta antigua  de Emprender ya que  por su buena conducta de pago se accedió a otorgarle el  crédito kiva. El crédito que se le aprobó al cliente es para la compra de mercadería (compra de harina, levadura, huevos ,manteca ,aceite queso, latas para hornear garrafas u otros) nos manifestó que esta muy agradecida con nuestra institución por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito
texts.en:
Viviana is 24 years old and has been married for 9 years. She has two school-aged children who are 7 and 6 years old. They live in the Toborochi neighborhood of the Parque Industrial zone. Viviana has been making bread for a living for the past 5 years. She also has income as an interim teacher. She is a former Emprender client and through her good loan repayment, they are able to provide her with a loan from Kiva. The loan approved for Viviana is for the purchase of merchandise (flour, yeast, eggs, butter, oil, cheese, tins for the over, gas cylinders, and others). She expressed to us that she is very appreciative of our institution for the confidence provided in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies at wholesale price

loans.name: Jose Juan

texts.es:
José Juan tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Ferreñafe y ubicada a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de carne de pollo en los diversos caseríos de la zona, para lo cual se vale de una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina que sirve para transportar carga y pasajeros) el recorre la zona ofreciendo su mercadería y cuando ya terminó de vender su productos se encarga de brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros.

José desea adquirir mas mercadería para ampliar su negocio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de pollos para la posterior comercialización de su carne.

José es un joven bastante responsable y trabajador. Los ingresos que percibe los suele utilizar para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía.
texts.en:
José Juan is 19 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the Pítipo district, an agricultural zone located in the Ferreñafe province, and 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He’s been selling poultry in the various hamlets in the zone [where he lives] for the past year.  He travels all around the zone in his mototaxi (a motorcycle modified to include a passenger compartment), offering his merchandise.  When he is sold out, he offers transportation services for passengers and cargo.

José wants to acquire more merchandise in order to expand his business, so he’s seen fit to request his first loan of 800 PEN ($300) through Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use the money from this loan to buy chickens so that he can sell more poultry.

José is a responsible hard working young man.  He uses his income to pay his personal expenses and to offer some financial support to his family.

loans.use: Expand his poultry business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie M. is from the village of Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old. Rosemarie is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, detergents and snack foods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Azar

texts.ru:
Azar V. 37 let. Om jenat i imeyet 3 detey, doch kotoroy 9 let ona uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya tancami, doch kotoroy 7 let ona uchitsya toje v shkole i sin kotoromu 1 qod. Azar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste s semyoy. 

Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Azara on ochen blaqodaren lenderam za pervuyu ssudu. S pomoshyu pervoy ssudi on razvil svoy bizness i uvelichil svoy budjet i poetomu reshil otkril sebe magazin. On uje 1 qod kak otril magazin. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo dyadyi. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye.
texts.en:
Azar Valiev is 37 years old. He is married and has three children. His daughter is nine years old and she goes to school and takes dancing lessons. Another daughter is seven and she is also in school and his son is one years old. Azar is an internally displaced person and has been relocated from Fuzuli and now lives in the region of Absheron together with his family.

This is a second loan for Azan and he is very grateful for the first one. With the help of the first loan he expanded his business and increased his budget which enabled him to open his store. It has been one year since he opened the store. He has learned his business from his uncle. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to expand the store.

loans.use: To expand the store

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo C. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Gumamela, Vista Alegre, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a business of buying and selling nipa (palm branches) and gasoline. Her husband, Riolly, who is 33 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have one child who is 7 years old.

Consuelo joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Consuelo has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle, so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her child. Consuelo C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of business.

loans.name: Alejandra's Group

texts.en:
Alejandra B. is from the city of Talic,Oroquieta City.  She is 42 years old.  Alejandra is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Tanglad.

Alejandra is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Alejandra owns and operates a business that makes and sells food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety food products in the local community.  Alejandra has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alejandra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alejandra from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Jonathan Kimanzi

texts.en:
Jonathan is 31 years old and married to Kambua who contributes to the family income. He has been using a motorcycle for transport business for the past eight years with an income of about Kshs. 2,000 per month.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD which he intends to use to buy another motorbike so that he can be able to get more clients and more profits. He will employ someone else to offer the services on the other motorbike. 

He hopes to one day own a fleet of motorcycles and Lorries for transport.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transport.

loans.name: Marouan

texts.ar:
مروان في عمر 47 سنة يعمل في موقف للسيارات متزوج وله اربع اولاد يحب عائلته ويريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وان
يدعم عائلته طموح مثابر ومحب للعمل ما يميزه هي المعاملة الجدية والصدق تاريخ مروان جيد مع المجموعة حيث كان
للقرض مع المجموعة الاثر الايجابي على عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء سيارات للعمل عليها يطمح
بشراء بيت له ولعائلته وان يكون لديه مدخول صغير يستطيع ان يعيش من خلاله هو وعائلته براحة مادية
texts.en: Marouan is a 47-year-old husband and father of four who wants to secure a better income for his family. Marouan is very passionate and diligent in his work at the car garage. He stands out for his professionalism and integrity. His last loan from Al Majmoua had a very positive effect. Marouan is now seeking another loan to purchase multiple cars which he could work on. He hopes that, later on, this will enable him to purchase a home and provide his family with a comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: Purchase cars to work on

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is from the village of Siayan. She is 45 years old and an individual member of PMPC. She is married with one child. To make a living, Florenda owns and operates a Videoke Bar but her main source of income comes from her salary as a government employee. 

Florenda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florenda is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to finance her Videoke Bar. This will be the second loan taken out by Florenda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To finance her Videoke Bar.

loans.name: Edgar Osmin

texts.es: Edgar Osmin R. G., reside en el departamento de Chalatenango, ubicado al norte del país, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa.  Edgar es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica a vender minutas, las cuales son hechas de hielo granizado, cubierto de jarabes de frutas, las cuales comercializa de forma ambulante por diferentes lugars de Chalatenango. Su venta es bastante estable, y es la que le permite sostener su hogar, ya que su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Edgar solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de maquetas de hielo, así mismo para comprar más variedad de jarabes de distintos sabores. De esta manera él espera mejorar sus ganancias y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Edgar Osmin R. G. lives with his wife in the Chalatenango department, which is in the northern part of the country.  Edgar is a very hard-working person.  He sells snacks, which are made from crushed ice and covered with fruit syrups.  He sells in an itinerant manner at different places in Chalatenango.  His sales are stable enough, and they allow him to support his household.  His wife does the household chores.

Edgar is requesting a loan to be able to have the money he needs to buy a greater quantity of blocks of ice.  He also wants to buy a greater variety of different flavors of syrup.  This way he hopes to improve his earnings and get ahead.

loans.use: To buy ice and fruit flavored syrups

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Renacer, se conformó en la fecha 05 de Enero del 2011, mediante la iniciativa de la Sra. Liduvina Brizuela, quien ya había participado del programa en otro grupo, quien luego de una comunicación con la asesora para la formación de un nuevo grupo logró juntar a 20 mujeres, quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en el primer ciclo del préstamo con mucho esfuerzo y esmero, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante va destinado para diferentes actividades que realizan de forma independiente, pero todas son del mismo ramo: los alimentos.
Además del trabajo independiente que realiza cada una también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, se ayudan  mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos, que es la de trabajar para apoyar a sus familias, en especial económicamente.
La sra. Ilda C. posee un copetín (restaurante pequeño) en el que ofrece varias comidas, en especial para aquellos trabajadores que no pueden ir a almorzar a sus casas, esto le deja buen ingreso económico, pero necesita del crédito para mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en: The "Renacer" ("Reborn") Women's Group began on January 5, 2011 through the initiative of Ms. Liduvina Brizuela, who had participated in Fundación Paraguaya's program with another group. She communicated with the adviser in order to form this new group, which is made up of 20 women who are all very pleased to be in their first loan cycle. They work with great effort and care, both on their own and as a group. The typical loan for a group member is used for the different work they perform on their own, but they all work in the same area: food. Along with the work that each woman does independently, they work together in order to raise funds so that the group can have its own capital. They help one another to reach their common goal -- to work in order to support their families, especially financially. Ms. Ilda C. has a copetín (small restaurant) where she offers various foods, particularly to those workers who can't go home for lunch. This provides her with a good income, but she needs a loan to improve the quality of her products.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruits, breads, sugar, salt, milk, and other dairy products

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Walter; el tiene 36 años de edad y es casado y tiene 1 hijo; el socio trabaja para una entidad nacional él trabaja de lunes a viernes de 08:00am hasta las 01:00pm y de 03:00pm hasta las 07:00pm, el socio se siente muy contento con este trabajo ya que de esta forma el saca a su familia adelante y pudo realizar algunas mejoras en su casa y desea construir y mejorar su casita.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la construcción de su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Sr. Walter is a member of the Communal Bank “Patron San Sebastian” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

He is 36 years old, married, and has one child. Walter works for a national entity Monday through Friday from 8am to 1pm and from 3pm to 7pm. He is happy with his job because it has enabled his family to get ahead and make a few improvements to their home. Walter wants to build and improve his house.

The loan he is requesting will be used for home construction. Walter is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Cotilda

texts.en:
Cotilda Nakasi lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has four grown up children. Cotilda has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days out of every week. Cotilda has requested for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.

The main business challenge for Cotilda is the rainy seasonal and defaulters. She aspires to goto to villages for charcoal. Cotilda lives in a home that she owns; she does not have access to electricity or to piped water.  Her major monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Safeyya

texts.en:
Safeyya is a 47-year-old mother of three daughters and four sons. Safeyya and her husband have a grocery store in Deir al Balah in Gaza Strip.

Safeyya and her husband wanted to increase the profit and number of customers to ensure a better income for a big family, so Safeyya took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a larger variety of goods which will attract more customers.

Safeyya's husband is photographed instead of her because she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to improve the store by increasing the variety of goods

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana sells ready-made garments to support her family financially. She purchases them from Lahore, which is a big city in Pakistan. She visits Lahore once a month to buy the stock and then sells in her city for a profit. She started this business after the death of her husband a few years ago. 
She also prepares embroidered dresses for her neighborhood clients but her primary business is selling ready-made clothes. She is also a responsible mother. She takes care of her children and does her household work very well.  She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works as a compounder in a medical clinic. Her remaining two children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her own business because she wants to improve it further. With the loan, she will buy ready-made garments in bulk that will not only cut the cost of travelling but also allow her to offer more variety to her clients to earn better profits. Rehana has good experience in her business. She hopes that she will be able to make her business more profitable after investing the loan in it. She is a resident of a small city called Kot Radha Kishen located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She lives there in a three-room brick house with her family.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rehana.

loans.use: To buy ready-made garments to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia R. is a married woman with three children. She is 42 years old and runs a sari-sari (variety store) business.

Alicia sells items like shampoo, soap and canned goods. She usually earns about 3,000 PHP per month with her business.

Alicia is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as sugar and canned sardines. 

In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her store. She also hopes to see her children graduate from college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like sugar and canned sardines.

loans.name: Uzma's Group

texts.en:
Uzma is a housewife who spends her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities.  She is very active and performs her daily routine tasks with a great sense of responsibility. She has given birth to two daughters. The elder one is in class one and younger one is only a year old. Uzma is a very good mother and takes care of her children very well. Her husband sells sweetmeat on his four-wheeled cart by visiting different areas of the city. Uzma helps her husband in his business by preparing the sweetmeat and arranging it on the cart.  

Uzma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. She wants to buy the required ingredients such as milk, sugar, cooking oil, dried fruits, etc., which enable her to prepare a larger quantity of sweetmeat to sell. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and has a good reputation among his clients due to his fresh quality and tasty sweetmeats. 
 
Uzma is hopeful that an investment will put her husband’s business in a more profitable position and increase his profits. 
She lives in Chichawatni, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Uzma.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make sweetmeat

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru: Рачабгул проживает в районе Дангара. Возраст, 48 лет. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Муж работает в городе Душанбе, а дети еще учатся. Сама Рачабгул занимается торговлей. Она на центральном рынке района занимается продажей женской одежды и обуви. В этой области она работает уже два года. Кредит берет для покупки обуви и рубашек.
texts.en: Rajabgul lives in Dangara. She is 48 years old, married, and has six children. Her husband works in the city of Dushanbe, and her children still go to school. Rajabgul works in trade. She sells women’s clothing and shoes in the city’s central market.  She has been doing this work for two years. She is taking out a loan to buy shoes and shirts.

loans.use: to buy shoes and shirts

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El Sr. Javier es un hombre que vive solo  y por lo cual decidió hace  mas  de  dos años  instalar  un local  frente a la estación de autobuses,  ofreciendo a  sus  clientes desayunos y comidas corridas todos los días de la semana. 
El junto con su hermana  atienden   el  negocio,  en  un futuro le gustaría contar con  meseros los  cuales  les  permitirán  brindarles  mayor  atención  y  servicio  a  sus  clientes, en esta  ocasión el  requiere   realizar la  compra  de mercancía   para  continuar  operando  su negocio.
texts.en:
Javier is a man that lives alone so he decided to set up a locale across from the bus station two years ago selling breakfasts and daily menus to customers every day.  

He tends to the business with his sister.   In the future he’d like to have waiters to provide better customer service.  On this occasion he wants to buy merchandise to continue operating.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Iratwibutse 2 Group

texts.fr:
Angélique est une commerçante âgée de 29ans qui habite Gatumba en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle  fait le commerce ambulant des ustensiles de cuisine et articles de ménage depuis  2ans. Elle est mariée à Israël, un chauffeur. Ils ont ensemble  4 enfants qui étudient. Elle prend en charge 2 autres enfants de sa famille proche. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaires.
Son crédit de 180,000frans burundais va contribuer a augmenter son capital et agrandir le volume des achats des ustensiles de cuisine et articles ménagers a revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« IRATWIBUTSE II».
texts.en:
Angélique is a 29-year-old merchant who lives in Gatumba, in Bujumbura, the capital. She has been going door-to-door selling kitchen supplies and equipment for two years. She is married to Israël, a driver, and they have four children in school. She supports two other children from her extended family. She  has a 6th grade education. 

Angélique’s loan of 180,000 Burundi francs is going to help increase her capital and the volume of kitchen and household goods she can purchase to be sold, so as to make bigger profits. She is a member of the community group “IRATWIBUTSE II”.

loans.use: to increase her capital and to buy a greater volume of kitchen utensils and household goods to sell

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en: Isaiah is 36 years old, married and has three children aged between 1 and 15 years old. He operates a tailoring services business and he specializes in making menswear. He has been in this business for 11 years now and has 5 employees. Isaiah plans to use this loan to purchase materials for making men's suits to sell. In the future, he hopes to grow his business. Isaiah describes himself as an obedient person.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make men's suits.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José tiene un negocio mediante el cual se dedica a la venta de diversos artículos, como papelería cosméticos, servicios de juegos electrónicos y venta de variedades en general. Aunque  tiene 8 meses de experiencia funciona como si tuviera muchos años de trabajo en esta actividad. Su negocio  se encuentra ubicado en el municipio de Sabanagrande, en el departamento del Atlántico.  Cuando José inició su negocio,  aplicó a un préstamo con el cual compró su primera vitrina y mercancía, pero como invertía todo lo que ganaba,  logró comprar juegos play para ofrecer otro servicio, atrayendo a más clientes sobre todo jóvenes que son el mercado objetivo que más compra y se encuentran  en el  barrio  donde está ubicado y en los alrededores del mismo.  Sus compras las realiza de contado  en almacenes del centro Barranquilla y complementan su actividad comercial, el servicio de  juegos de play y un  motocarro  que le generan ingresos adicionales y esto es porque José es un joven muy activo y productivo, por eso con su negocio es capaz de cubrir  todos los costos y gastos, maneja estabilidad y sus cuentas por cobrar rotan rápidamente, ya que generalmente sus ventas son de contado, aunque maneja créditos con sus clientes rentables.   
José todo lo comparte con su esposa y ambos están empeñados en volver su negocio un gran almacén posicionado, que ofrezca diversos servicios, además de artículos que requieran las amas de casa y vecinos de todo Sabanagrande. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará papelería para surtir su negocio y adicionará comestibles y nuevas lìneas de cosméticos ofreciendo así,  gran variedad de productos que colmen de satisfacción a  los reyes de su negocio: Los Clientes”
texts.en:
José has a business selling a variety of items like: stationery, cosmetics, electronic gaming services and miscellany.  Although he’s only been in business for 8 months, he works as if he’s been in this business for many years.  His business is located in the town of Sabanagrande, Atlántico Department.

When José started the business he applied for a loan that he used to buy his first display case and merchandise but because he reinvested all his profits he managed to buy play games to offer an additional service attracting more customers, especially youngsters, who constitute the objective market that spends the most and are located in the neighborhood and in adjacent ones as well.

He makes his purchases in warehouses in downtown Barranquilla and he complements his commercial activity with the play games and with a car that generate additional income because José is a very active, productive young man and this is why he’s able with his business to cover all his costs and expenses.  He’s stable and his accounts receivable turn over quickly because his sales are usually cash although he does offer credit to his profitable customers.

José shares everything with his wife and they are both determined to turn their business into a great, well positioned store that offers a variety of services as well as items needed by housewives and neighbors from all of Sabanagrande.

His Kiva loan will be his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy stationery items to stock the business as well as to buy foodstuffs and new lines of cosmetics to offer a wide variety of products that will fulfill the satisfaction of his business’ royalty: The Customers.

loans.use: to buy stationery items as well as foodstuffs and cosmetics.

loans.name: Darwin Efraín

texts.es:
Darwin tiene 23 años vive en Tulcan, su estado civil es unión libre, vive con su mujer y tiene 2 hijos los cuales tienen 2 añitos, y el otro 11 meses.

Es una persona tranquila, bondadosa, le gusta ser amigable y ayudar a las demás personas que lo necesiten.

Trabaja en la elaboración de ladrillos desde hace 2 años, tiene un ayudante, en su trabajo le ha ido bien si esta produciendo ladrillos.

Trabaja con FODEMI desde hace 4 años, el prestamo que requiere es para comprar una prensadora de ladrillo, gracias a la compra de esta prensadora optimizara su tiempo y mejorará su calidad de vida junto a su familia, su sueño es ayudar a mas gente y que no le falte el pan de cada día a su familia.
texts.en:
Darwin is 23 years old and resides in Tulcan. He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his wife and two children, ages 2 and 11 months.

Darwin is a peaceful and kind person who likes getting along with and helping people in need. He has been manufacturing bricks for two years. Darwin employs an assistant and has done very well in his job of producing bricks.

He has worked with FODEMI for four years. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a brick press. By purchasing this device, he will be able to make effective use of his time and improve the quality of life of his family. His dream is to help more people so that they can provide for the daily needs of their families.

loans.use: to purchase a brick press.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 31 years old and married with four children.

Arlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Arlyn has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for nine years and earns additional income from dried fish vending and rice and corn retailing.

Arlyn aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Mrs. Sou, 32, is a married woman and has two children who live on her income. Currently, she is a pig raiser. She has been running this business for many years. She earns about $3 US per day. For two months, her pigs weren't growing well, so she intends to use the loan to buy feed concentrate to fatten the pigs up. She owns several pigs and she intends to feed them concentrate to fatten them up more quickly. She wants her animals to reach ideal weight to sell in the local and nearby markets. She wants to earn higher profits for her family's and her parents’ well-being and to expand this pig-raising project. 

This is Mrs. Sou's first loan with Kiva. She’s had no previous loans from state banks, but Hattha Kaksekar Ltd. offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate. So, she would like to request some funds to purchase pig feed.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos los mismos que son mayores de edad, con ella vive una hija que es madre soltera de sus dos hijos de 10 y 6 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella es un gran ama de casa que a mas de dedicarse al hogar también se  dedica a la venta de pescado, ella recorre con sus productos por los  alrededores de Montecristi, trabaja cuatro días a la semana desde las 5h00 hasta las 12h00, esos días sale de su casa muy temprano en la mañana  y se va a Manta a traer el mejor pescado para sus clientes, dice que siempre le gusta traer lo necesario para vender todo el mismo día ya que mantener el pescado hasta el otro día cuesta mucho  y a sus clientes no le gusta el pescado congelado. Lleva más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar  pescado para el negocio diario, está en el Banco Comunal 15 ciclos y le gusta por las reuniones ya que en ellas comparte buenos momentos con sus amigas. 

Su sueño  tener un local donde poder vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The December 24th Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi. This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts have received national and international recognition. The famous Panama hats are made in this place.

It is here that one can meet Sra. María. She is 54 years old, married, and has five grown children. Living with her is a daughter, who is a single mother with two children (ages 10 and 6) who are in school. Her husband is a bricklayer.

María is a good housewife who spends most of her time maintaining her home, but she also sells fish. She travels with her products in the surrounding areas of Montecristi. María works four days a week from 5am to 12pm. On the days that she sells, María leaves the house very early in the morning and goes to Manta in order to bring back the best fish for her customers. She says that she always likes bringing back only what she needs to sell and then attempts to sell it all because keeping any leftover fish for another day has a high cost since her customers do not like frozen fish. María has been in business for more than eight years.

This loan will be used to buy fish for her daily business. She has participated in 15 loan cycles with the Communal Bank and likes the meetings because they allow her to share nice moments with her friends. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана замужем, у нее есть взрослый сын Вячеслав. Светлана предоставляет парикмахерские услуги в салоне красоты «Дашенька». В этом бизнесе она проработала уже около 30 лет. В обороте у Светланы около 5 000 гривен, ее чистая прибыль составляет 3 000 гривен ежемесячно. 

Светлана планирует использовать кредит в размере 8 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести новое оборудование и материалы, увеличить виды услуг и количество клиентов, а, значит, получить дополнительную прибыль. За счет полученной прибыли Светлана планирует сделать ремонт в квартире, улучшить благосостояние семьи и дальше развивать свой бизнес. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Svetlana is married and has an adult son, Vyacheslav.  She provides hair-styling services at the "Dashenka" beauty salon.  She has been working in this business for about 30 years.  Svetlana has a revolving capital of about 5 000 hryvnia, and her net profit is 3 000 hryvnia per month.  She plans to use the loan in the sum of 8 000 hryvnia to purchase new equipment and materials, expand service offerings and customer base and, thus, make additional profits.  Svetlana plans to use the resulting profit to make repairs to her apartment, improve her family's welfare and further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and materials, expand service offerings and customer base

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда живет со своей семьей в городе Запорожье, на юго-востоке Украины. Она занимается розничной торговлей женской одеждой: продает женские домашние костюмы, трикотаж, халаты, а также мужскую обувь местного производства. Начинала Надежда с работы реализатора в обувном магазине. Сейчас у нее свое торговое место и свое дело. Точка Надежды располагается на крытом рынке, прямо при входе на рынок. Надежда работает в этом бизнесе уже 16 лет. На данный момент в товар у нее вложено около 60 000 гривен. 

Надежде необходим кредит в 12 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить  сезонную обувь производства местной обувной фабрики «Мида». Упорство, желание работать и достигать результатов всегда помогали Надежде двигаться вперед и достигать поставленных целей и она надеется и дальше развиваться и вкладывать в свое дело, достигая стабильности и процветания. Более того, она надеется использовать полученные от бизнеса средства, чтобы помочь своему единственному сыну встать на ноги.   
Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Nadezhda lives with her family in the town of Zaporozhye in the south-east of Ukraine. She does retail sales of women's clothing: she sells clothing for the home, knitwear, robes and also mens shoes produced locally. Nadezhda started out as a salesperson in a shoe store. Right now she has her own vendor location and her own business. Nadezhda's space is located on the open market near the entrance. She has been in this business for sixteen years. At this time she has around 60,000 hrivna invested in her inventory.

Nadezhda needs a loan in the amount of 12,000 hrivna to buy seasonal shoes made by a local factory maker Mida. Persistence, willingness to work and to achieve results always helped Nadezhda to move forward and reach her goals, and she hopes to further develop and invest into her business achieving stability and growth. Moreover, she hopes to use the profit from the business to help her only son get on his feet.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal shoes made by a local factory Mida

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y no tiene  hijos.  Estudió hasta la secundaria.
Desde hace dos años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizo en la compra de quesos.  Nos cuenta que también vende quinua y artesanía en miniaturas.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles comprará quesos, diez arrobas de quinua y lanas para sus tejidos, la señora nos cuenta que la quinua la compra en Tiquillaca a S/. 40 a 45 nuevo soles y ella lo vende a S/. 60.00 a 65.00 nuevo soles.  En el negocio trabaja sola, su esposo trabaja como transportista (taxi).
Desea tener un carro para dar servicio de transportes y tener un terreno.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el plazo.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the communal bank “Bellavista” located in the district of Puno, in the province and department of Puno. She is 35 years old, lives with a partner and has no children. She studied through high school. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the last two years. Her first loan was for the sum of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles (PEN), money she used to buy cheeses. She tells us that she also sells quinoa and handcrafted miniatures.

With this new loan for S/.500.00 nuevos soles (PEN), she will buy cheeses,10 pounds of quinoa and wool for her weaving. She tells us that she buys the quinoa in Tiquillaca at S/.40 to 45 nuevos soles (PEN) and she sells it for S/.60.00 to 65.00 nuevos soles (PEN). She works her business alone, her partner works as a taxi driver . 

She wants to have a car in order to offer transportation services and have a piece of land. What she likes about the communal bank is the loan facility and the terms.

loans.use: to buy cheeses, 10 pounds of quinoa and wool.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is a 42-year-old widow who lives with her daughter, aged 5, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends kindergarten. Altantsetseg supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. 

When she first began her business, she had 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) in working capital. Now she has 4,400,000 MNT in working capital. She sells jeans and trousers, which she imports from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more jeans to sell in order to increase her jeans and trousers variety.

Her goal is to expand her business and then to be able to improve her daughter’s education.  She is one of our trusted client who is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more jeans to sell

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana de 26 años, una mujer muy emprendedora que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa. Trabaja todos los días sin horarios fijos.

Su único problema que se le presenta es el transporte desde su casa a su trabajo.

Es madres soltera que con todos sus esfuerzo sale adelante para poder mantener a su hija.

El sueño que ella desea alcanzar es poder tener su propio taller de costura con maquinas industriales que le facilita el trabajo y así poder sacar adelante a su hija y a su mama.
texts.en: Diana is 26 years old. She is a very enterprising woman who makes and sells clothes. She works every day without a fixed schedule. The only problem she faces is transport from her house to her work. She is a single mother who with all her effort manages to get ahead and take care of her daughter. The dream she most wants to realize is having her own sewing workshop with industrial type sewing machines which make work easier and so take care of her daughter and mother.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making blouses and pants as well as thread.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 22 years old and a married woman with three young children. Her husband is a fisherman. Nelfa and her husband started their fishing business three years ago. She sells her husband’s catch at the market.

Nelfa has requested this loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fishing nets, hooks and buckets. This will help the couple to catch more fish to sell.

Nelfa hopes to be successful and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and buckets.

loans.name: Ericka Yorleny

texts.es:
Yalaguina municipio de Estelí, es originaria Ericka de 30 años de edad, de oficio comerciante, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 3 años de edad. Ella nos cuenta que inicio su pulpería con sus ahorros de 2 años trabajando como conserje de una escuela primaria localizada en su comunidad, pues necesitaba un negocio que le permitiera generar mejores ingresos a su familia  y que mejor que una pulpería y al mismo tiempo que solventara muchas de las necesidades básicas de su comunidad pues no hay muchas pulperías cercas.  
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, aceite, maíz, papel higiénico, detergentes, jabones, desinfectantes, pan dulce y simple, avenas, enlatados y azúcar.  Con esta inversión le ayudara a adquirir por cantidad mayor estos productos y ofrecer algunos nuevos que antes no vendía por falta de capital. Una de sus próximas metas es reunir dinero para comprar y vender pollo, carne.
texts.en:
Ericka is originally from Yalaguina, in Estelí.  She’s 30 years old, has two children, ages 12 and 3, and works as a merchant.  She tells us that she started her general store with her savings of two years, working as a school counselor at the local elementary school.  She needed a business that would allow her to generate a better income for her family, and what better than a general store?  At the same time she could provide for the community’s needs because there are not many general stores nearby.

She needs this loan to buy basic grains, cooking oil, corn, bathroom tissue, detergents, soaps, disinfectants, sweet and basic bread, oatmeal, canned goods, and sugar.  This investment will help her to acquire these items in bulk and also to offer some new ones the she didn’t have before because of a lack of capital.  One of her next goals is to save money to be able to buy and sell chicken and meat.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Jimu1 Group

texts.en:
Lazarus is a 37-year-old married man with six children ages one, five, seven, nine, 11 and 14. Three of his children still attend school. Lazarus occasionally supplies food to nearby elderly in his community. For the past 14 years, he has operated a flea market in Masvigo and he has one employee. Lazarus sells perishable goods and sometimes they become stale before they are sold, resulting in a financial loss. He has no other source of income.

Lazarus is requesting a loan to open a vegetable shop in town. He will use the profits from his loan to be able to look after his children. In the future, Lazarus intends to have a cold room where he can store his perishables.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en: Leonita is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. Leonita has a food shop (or sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 17 years. She requested a loan for 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Leonita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Leonita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 45-year-old married woman with seven children who are all in school. She has had a business of selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale

loans.name: Ko-Jo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KO-JO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sèhoue Enagnon Loïse est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sèhoue Enagnon Loïse est âgée de 30 ans et vit au Bénin. Sèhoue Enagnon Loïse a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Sèhoue Enagnon Loïse est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. En plus de leur enfant, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Sèhoue Enagnon Loïse vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Sèhoue Enagnon Loïse vend depuis cinq ans des tissus et des vêtements au Bénin. Sèhoue Enagnon Loïse s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaires et son revenu, Sèhoue Enagnon Loïse sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KO-JO, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Group Ko-jo is composed of three persons who reside in the same area of town. The group representative, named Sèhoue Enagnon Loïse, is raising her hand on the photo.
Sèhoue Enagnon Loïse is 30 years old and lives in Benin. Her education stopped in elementary school. Sèhoue Enagnon Loïse is married to a man named Jean. The couple has on child in their care, who attends school. In addition to their child, the couple takes care of another child. Sèhoue Enagnon Loïse lives together with her husband and children. The couple provides for the household together.
In order to support her family, Sèhoue Enagnon Loïse has been selling fabrics and clothing in Benin for five years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. Looking to create customer satisfaction and to increase her sales and revenues, Sèhoue Enagnon Loïse is requesting a loan from ALIDé together with the other members of group Ko-jo.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and children's clothing.

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé depuis 2011.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce,l'agriculture.

Celle qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée ,est âgée de 41 ans et mére de 06 enfants.

Sa principale activité est la restauration ,elle tient un petit restaurant où elle vend du petit déjeuné.Elle fait cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans,ce qui fait qu'elle a pu fidéliser un nombre important de clients.

Avec le prêt reçu,elle compte acheter 10 caisses d’œuf pour une valeur de 20000f ,un kilo de café pour une valeur de 7000f,05 kg de sucre en poudre pour une valeur de 3000f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et assurer les frais de scolarité de ses 02 enfants qui étudient encore.
texts.en:
This group was created in 2011. It is made up of members who live in the same village, their principal activity is small businesses and farming.

The member who is on the far right in the photo with her arm raised is the leader of the group. She is aged 41, and married with six children.

Her main business is catering. She has a little restaurant where she serves breakfast. She has been in this business for 10 years, which means that she has many faithful customers.

With the loan, she plans to buy 10 crates of eggs worth 20000f, a kilo of coffee for 7000f, and half a kilo of caster sugar worth 3000f.

Her aim is to increase her savings and pay the school fees for her two children who are still studying.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sugar, milk and coffee.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FIGURACORO, un des villages de KANGABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est   l’arachide et riz  avec   MINATA , 1ère personne assise de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau de KANGARE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider  aussi son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Mère  d’un enfant, Kossiwa est une femme mariée résidant à Agoè. Agée de 26 ans, Kossiwa produit des gâteaux faite à base de la farine de blé généralement appelé « Paté ».  Kossiwa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Kossiwa sollicite ce crédit pour commander des bols de farine de blé en vue de bien revendre puis gagner des bénéfices afin de satisfaire les attentes des clients puis soutenir son mari à bien prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Acheter 25 bols de farine de blé.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nancy would like to invest in the stock market.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.en:
Juana Isabel is married and has three kids. Her family went through an economic crisis after her husband Juan de Dios had an accident, but Juana began to sell ceramics and jewelry. This helped her family deal with the problem and pay for the children's education. She started her business two years ago and now has many customers. Demand for her products has also increased, which is why she requests a loan of $200 to buy merchandise and complete the orders from her customers.

Hardworking, responsible and dedicated are words to describe Juana. She has worked hard to resolve her family's economic situation and now she needs your support. Now is the time to help those who most need it, don't think twice and help Juana and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana Isabel es casada y tiene tres hijos. A raíz de que Juan de Dios, su esposo, sufrió un accidente su familia pasó una dura crisis económica, pero Juana inició con la venta de cerámica y joyería, esto le ayudó a la familia a superar sus problemas y pagar la educación de sus hijos. Hace dos años que ella empezó con su trabajo y ahora tiene muchos más clientes, la demanda por sus productos se ha incrementado. Por lo que ahora necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares que utilizara para la compra de mercancía y para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes.

Trabajadora, responsable y dedicada, son características que pueden definir a Juana, ella ha trabajado mucho para poder solventar los gasto de su familia, en estos momentos necesita de tu apoyo. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien mas lo necesita, no lo pienses más y ayuda a Juana y su familia.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Parda

texts.en: S. Parda has been working in entrepreneurship activity already for 10 years. He sells poisons – specific and rare kinds of poisons, besides industrial poisons.  Some kinds of poisons he produces himself. He has technical secondary education.  There are 5 children in his family, four of them at present live with him and as it is expected from a father – he should create good conditions for his children to obtain education, and also develop their private life and create conditions for independent lives – to build separate dwelling and so on.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his telephone services

loans.name: Anatoli

texts.en: Anatoli is married with five children all in secondary school. He sells bicycle spare parts and repairs bicycles. His business is located in Bukeeka Village on the way to Lake Kyoga where most of the fish in Kayunga market is caught. He has operated this business for the last five years. He repairs bicycles and sells spare parts. His main customers are the fish mongers and they come from Kayunga town, as well as Bukeeka Village where a majority of members in the village own bicycles. The loan will help him to restock the spare parts and hence be able to meet his customers’ needs.

loans.use: Sanyu wants to buy bicycle spare parts tyres, spokes, ball bearings, and break shoes.

loans.name: Ni Luh Sumiarni

texts.id:
Ni Luh Sumiarni is a house wife and a mother of three. She started her business by using IDR 2 million (approx: USD 210) loan provided by Dinari. She bought 2 female local pigs for IDR 1.2 million and used the remaining IDR 800 thousand to feed the pigs. At the moment one of her pig has delivered 4 piglets while the other one is expecting very soon. When the piglets are 2 months old, they can be sold for IDR 250 thousand per piglet. Once every 5 month she can earn gross revenue of IDR 2.5 million from selling piglets produced by 2 female pigs. Those revenue is deducted with money spent to feed the pigs of IDR 500 thousand will give her a profit of IDR 2 million. Ni Luh Sumiarni plans to use this profit to refurbish the pig’s hut by make the hut structure more permanent as at the moment it is only made of bamboo structure.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dengan pinjaman modal yang di dapat dari Dinari sebesar Rp.2.000.000,- Ni Luh Sumiarni memulai usahanya. Ni Luh Sumiarni membeli 2 induk babi lokal atau Babi Bali dengan harga perekor Rp.600.000,- jadi 2 ekor induk babi harganya Rp1.200.000,-. Sisanya Rp 800,000,- dipergunakan untuk modal pakannya. Saat ini salah satu induk babinya sudah beranak 4 ekor dan induk yang lain masih hamil. Setiap hari Ni Luh Sumiarni sibuk disamping sebagai ibu rumah tangga yang mengurus 3 anaknya yang masih sekolah juga sibuk mengurus ternaknya. Setelah berumur 2 bulan nantinya anak babinya sudah bisa dijual dengan harga per ekornya Rp 250.000. Setiap 5 bulan dari hasil penjualan anak babi dengan dua ekor induk babi memperoleh pendapatan kotornya Rp 2.500.000,-. Pengeluaran pakan untuk anak dan induknya Rp.500.000,-. Jadi bersihnya Ni Luh Sumiarni memperoleh keuntungan Rp2.000.000,-. Dengan keuntungan ini Ni Luh Sumiarni ingin memperbaiki kandangnya agar lebih permanen karena saat ini masih memakai kandang bambu.

loans.use: To buy female pigs and pig's feed

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. Him C. and her husband are traditional doctors together earning around $10 each day. They have five children, two who are employed at a casino, making about $100 per month each, one who is a part-time traditional doctor earning about $100 per month, and one who is a student. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase pigs to breed and sell for additional income.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to breed and sell for additional income.

loans.name: Tabu's Faidilea Group

texts.en:
Tabu is 47 years old. She is married and has three grown children. She and her husband also take care of three other children, ages 15, 11, and 6. Tabu is a food vendor and sells dishes and snacks between 6am and 8pm daily. She started this business in 1997 and now she makes a monthly profit of about $170.

Tabu hopes to receive a loan to buy more food items in order to increase her sales. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members have businesses dealing in clothing and food sales.

loans.use: to buy food items

loans.name: Namuwaya Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mariam J.. She is currently in the business of running a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Mariam is 34 years old and is married. Her husband is a builder. She has 4 children ranging from age 4 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Mariam makes approximately UGX 80000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand business. Mariam has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 800000 in order to invest in the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Mariam is joined in her small group by Salama N., Hafisa Namugga, Jane N., and Hasifa M.. Salama N. has a business running a hotel and wants to buy more foodstuff. Hafisa Namugga is currently operating a business running a beauty salon and wants a loan to buy hair wigs. Jane N. operates a business of selling new clothes and wants to increase stock. Hasifa M. is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To expand beauty salon business to boost it

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena is a young entrepreneur that struggles to improve her living conditions. She sells a collection of perfumes, deodorants, hand and body lotions, hair care products and the like. She’s been running this business for a couple of years.
Milena regularly visits other women in the neighborhood to show them some catalogs of the products she sells. Currently, she offers to her customers the products lines of AVON and EBEL. She plans on using her loan to add new types of products to her stock. Milena had already taken from FSMA a loan which she used wisely, and she managed to make her business successful and she repaid the loan on time. Milena says she’ll keep working hard so that she can soon buy her own house.

loans.use: To replenish a small business of selling beauty products.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is the thirty-six year old married father of one son. His wife works as a hairdresser. He has been selling auto parts of different kinds for over ten years. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more clutch disks and pressure plates from Germany and Italy. In Ghana there are no auto parts stores, but there is a high demand for parts as the taxi networks are the main transportation option. His stand operates in an area of Accra called Abossey-Okai that is a conglomeration of hundreds of entrepreneurs who each sell specific auto parts.

Albert is a member of the lending group Respect. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: Albert would like to buy more clutch disks and pressure plates to sell.

loans.name: Sadi.

texts.ru:
Sadi B. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 27 years okd, is married and has 2 children. He has been raising livestock for four years. He owns several young bulls which he fattens and sells. Right now he needs to purchase a cow which will provide milk. He needs a loan to do this. This will increase his livestock count and will give him the opportunity to earn additional profits. Sadi will pay back the loan over a 5 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобокалонов Сади проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 27 лет, женат и имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Четыре года он занимается животноводством.Имеет несколько голов молодых бычков, которых откармливает и продает. Сейчас ему необходимо купить корову , которая будет давать молоко. Для этого ему необходимо получить кредит.Это поможет ему увеличить поголовье скота и получить возможность увеличить дополнительный доход. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 5 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Hermenejilda

texts.es:
Hermenejilda P. is a woman that with much effort along with her husband works providing a mill service to her customers. This allows her to improve the structural condition of her house, which being in bad shape due to tremors and hurricanes is a danger to her family and children that live in it. P. says that her dream is that her two small children have a place to live which provide the necessary living conditions for their development.

Because of the aforementioned, she has come to Ceprodel to obtain a necessary loan for the purchase of construction materials to continue with the reconstruction of her house since when she started previously she had to stop the work for lack of economic resources. Today she is waiting very confidently for her loan to be granted so that she can fulfill her dream of having a house that provides the necessary living conditions, all of which will be achieved through the improvement of her mill business that she has in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Hermenejilda P. es una dama que con mucho esfuerzo en conjunto con su cónyuge labora brindando el servicio de molino a sus clientes para mejorar las condiciones estructurales de su vivienda por lo que al estar en mal estado a causa de los temblores y huracanes es un peligro para su familia e hijos que habitan en ella. Según comenta la señora P. su sueño es que sus dos pequeños hijos tengan un lugar donde vivir el cual preste las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo

Por lo antes descrito, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de los materiales de construcción para continuar con la reconstrucción de su casa ya que al haber iniciado anteriormente se vio en la obligación de detener la obra por falta del recurso económico. Hoy en día espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será concedido y de esta manera logrará su sueño de tener una casa que preste las condiciones necesarias para vivir y todo esto lograrlo por medio del mejoramiento de su negocio de molino el que atiende en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a divorced mother of 5 children. Two of her children are currently in school. She has been selling yams since her husband died 10 years ago in order to support her children. She buys the yams from the city market, Kumasi, which is very expensive, and therefore she does not get a good income from the sales. She wants to use the loan to buy the yams from the farmers instead of buying from the market dealers. This she believes would increase her sales and income to support the 2 children who are in school. Mary is a member of the group called Isaiah. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a form of social collateral in order to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more tubers of fresh yams

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca L. P. was born in 1972 and is currently 36 years old. She resides in the Buena Vista area of the town of La Ceiba, which is in the municipality of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, department of Solola. Every day since she was a young girl, Francisca L. P. has wanted to become a successful member of her community. When she was young, her parents did not give her the chance to go to school. But she was a fighter, always trying to meet great people and glean something from them so that she would have a successful future. Thanks to her efforts, she was was able to set up a small store selling and buying traditional clothing, which is what most people wear in her community. Every day she is friendly and respectful of people and so her business has been growing. This is why she needs enough money to fulfill her clients' needs. She decided it necessary to go to the Asociacion ASDIR office in order to apply for a loan, always with the goal of her business becoming the most well-known businees in the community. This way she can fulfill her clients' needs and create better living conditions for her family. Francisca L. P.'s community know her as a helpful person with good principles. She has created jobs for her community through her current business which helps all members of the community have an example of a person who is always capable of achieving goals as long as he or she seeks to be a better person every day.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Francisca López P., nació en el año de 1,972, actualmente cuenta con 36 años de edad, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en el Sector Buena Vista de la Aldea La Ceiba, jurisdicción municipal de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, departamento de Sololá, día adía desde su niñez doña Francisca López Perechú ha venido siempre con el objetivo de lograr ser una persona exitosa en la comunidad, en su niñez sus padres no le dieron la oportunidad de asistir a una escuela, mas sin en bargo ella lucho y siempre se propuso conocer personas importantes y lograr captar algo de ellos para lograr ser una persona con futuro, gracias a sus esfuerzos ella logro establecer un pequeño negocio en compra y venta de Ropa típica que es el que mas se utiliza en la comunidad de su residencia, día a día la gente con su amabilidad y su buena conducta en la comunidad este negocio se ha ido creciendo, por tal razón que le falta capital suficiente para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela se vio en la necesidad de acudir en la oficina de la Asociación ASDIR, para solicitar un crédito siempre con en objetivo de que su negocio sea el mas conocido en la comunidad y así lograr satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela y lograr una mejor condición de vida para su familia. A dona Francisca López P., se le conoce en la comunidad como una persona con buenos principios y colaboradora y en la cual ha generado fuentes de trabajo en su negocio que tiene actualmente y también esto contribuye a que cualquier persona de la comunidad tenga como ejemplo que uno siempre tiene la capacidad de lograr las cosas solo teniendo díaa día el objetivo de ser cada día mejor.

loans.use: Store: "Buying and selling Traditional Clothing"

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es:
Sadith tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Es una mujer trabajadora que siempre ha visto la manera de solventar los gastos de su familia, diariamente y durante todo el día, atiende su bodega, con ello aporta en la economía de su hogar, ya que muchas veces el sueldo de su esposo no alcanza, hace 4 años que puso su  propia bodega, en la cual, desde sus inicios ha ofertado todo tipo de productos, así como verduras, frutas y también carne. Por motivos de salud, un tiempo, solo se limitó a traer mercadería no perecible, ahora está en ese proceso de recuperación y falta poco para que se restablezca por completo, esa fue una dificultad pasajera, pero que ya está superando.
Sadith se esfuerza diariamente por sostener la educación de sus hijos.
Solicita este préstamo porque con ello podrá incrementar su mercadería y surtir su tienda como fue desde el inicio, con variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Sadith is 36 years old, and lives with her husband and two children. She is a hardworking woman who has always found a way to settle her family's expenses. Every day, for the whole day, she tends to her general store, and that is how she contributes to her household's economy because her husband's income is often not enough. Four years ago she set up her own general store, which from the beginning has offered all sorts of products such as vegetables, fruits, and also meat. For a while, due to health issues, she limited herself to non-perishable merchandise. She is now in the process of recuperating and her health is nearly completely restored. That was a temporary difficulty which she is already overcoming. Sadith works every day to support the education of her children. She requests this loan to increase her merchandise and stock her store as it was in the beginning, with a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Re-stocking her store with a variety of products.

loans.name: Auvasa

texts.en: Auvasa M. F., 70, is married and has seven children. She has many years of experience in the sewing business. She sells the products she makes five days a week. She has six previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (about $104 USD).  SPBD loans are Auvasa's only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She will use the loan to buy items for her sewing business (material, thread, elastic, and so forth) and to pay for her grandson's school fees.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is single and has one child. She lives in Musang, just outside Bamenda, Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in a call box and the sale of food items, dresses, and fish pile (a fried dough containing fish). She intends to contribute 400,000 CFA ($800 USD) of her own personal savings towards her business plan.

This is Mariana's fourth loan; she has been a GHAPE member since 1998. Mariana has a great deal of experience in farming and her workshop. The location of her business is quite good for selling items. She has many customers already that rely on her for certain items. Also, since she now has enough capital, she can ensure that her products are always available. Many people run out of goods during the day since they cannot afford to purchase any more in the morning due to a lack of capital. This loan will increase her customer's confidence in her shop.

Mariana will use the profits from this loan to purchase a plot of land for herself. She also hopes to help her son open a shop. Her training in marketing and business management will help her to succeed in her shop.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount to a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase coco yams, Irish potatoes, flour, dresses for resale, and credit for phones for a call box.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes empezó con el negocio ya que es una mujer le gusta salir adelante y no estar solo con el ingreso  que le da su esposo. Es madre de tres hijos de  2, 8, y 11 años y su esposo trabaja como taxista.
