Ella se dedica  la venta de ropa , poco a poco junto dinero para comprar una paca de ropa y así fue que inicio su negocio con las ganancia que va obteniendo lo re-invierte para comprar mas mercancía. 

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir nueva mercancía.
texts.en:
Lourdes started her own business because she is an enterprising woman who does not want to rely solely on her husband as a source of income. She is the mother of three children, ages 2, 8 and 11. Her husband is a taxi driver. She sells clothing and saves money little by little to buy another bundle of clothing. She was able to start her business through this process of reinvesting her earnings in the purchase of additional merchandise.

She needs a loan for MXN $4,000, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase new merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosenda V. tiene 67 años de edad esta casada con don Eugenio Ayala de 76 años de edad, ambos se ocupan de administrar el negocio, don Eugenio es el responsable de las compras, y reposición de las mercaderías en el local, la microempresa funciona en su domicilio desde que se creó, hace más de 10 años.
Tienen cinco hijos todos casados, la hija menor es la única que aun vive con ellos, y tiene también su propio negocio una farmacia. La señora Rosenda siempre se dedico a este rubro y desde 1.998 en su propio local, a pesar de su edad y la oposición de sus hijos, ella sigue emprendiendo con éxito esta actividad que conoce a profundidad.
El crédito será destinado a la compra de medicamentos de venta libre, sidras, vinos, cervezas fuegos artificiales etc. para comercializar en estas fiestas.
texts.en:
Rosenda V. is 67 years old and married to Eugenio Ayala, who is 76 years old. They both work in their business; Eugenio is responsible for the purchases and stocking the store, which is has been located in their house since it was started more than 10 years ago. They have 5 children, all of which are married. The youngest daughter is the only one that still lives with them and also has her own business, a pharmacy. Rosenda has always worked in this field, and since 1998, in her house. Despite her age and the opposition of her children, she continues to have success in this field, which she knows in depth. The loan will be used to purchase over-the-counter medicine, cider, wine, beer, fireworks, etc. to sell during the festival season.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of over-the-counter medicine, cider, beer, fireworks, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married with one adult daughter. She rents a space in a fabric store and sells bed sheets and underwear. She has been in this business for 10 years. Elena treats her clients with a kind attitude and offers good products at good prices. Low competition for these types of goods helps Elena to make good sales. Her daughter helps her mother in the business - she buys the inventory and brings them to the store if needed urgently.

Elena would like to receive 9,000 UAH to increase the inventory. She hopes to sell more goods and spend extra income on improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the inventory

loans.name: Julia Juana

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Julia es madre soltera, tiene  58 años, cuatro hijos mayores que están casados.
Julia se dedica a la venta de frutas por cajones, desde su juventud. 
Todos los fines de semana Julia va a  tres horas de Lima, hasta Cañete al sur del País,  para compra en la chacra fruta  por cajones y repartir en la  semana  a su vecinas, también vende comida sureña los domingos en su casa, con estas dos actividades ella ha mantenido a sus hijos por años.   
Desde que esta en Finca esta construyendo su casa poco a poco,  puede invertir mas, en su negocio, siente que es una  ayuda para  ella y para todas  las socias,  les ayuda a surgir en  sus negocios y en sus  vidas. 
Necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, para comprar cajones de fruta.    
El sueño de Julia es techar su casa y abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank. She is a 58 year-old single mother with four adult children, all of whom are married. Julia makes a living selling fruit by the crate, which she has done since a young age. Every weekend Julia makes a three-hour trip from Lima south to Cañete in order to buy crates of fruit at a small farm. Julia delivers the fruit to her neighbors during the week, and also sells Southern Peruvian food at her home on Sundays. She has been able to support her children for years through these two activities. Since getting involved with Kiva partner Finca, Julia has been working on building her home a little bit at a time. Julia invests more in her business when she can—she feels that this is helpful both for herself and for the other members of her bank, since it helps them improve their businesses and their lives. Julia needs a loan of 1200 Soles so that she can purchase crates of fruit. Her dream is to finish roofing her house and to open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of 1200 Peruvian Soles so that she can purchase crates of fruit.

loans.name: Ventura Del Carmen

texts.es: Ventura del Carmen López tiene 63 años, su estado civil es casada. Todos sus hijos son mayores de edad. La actividad económica de Doña Ventura es una pulpería en la que ofrece productos como granos básicos, cosmético, ropa y otros. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus propósitos son de invertir cada día en su negocio. El financiamiento es destinado para la compra de más productos para su negocio. Sus deseos son que esta pulpería pueda convertirse en una distribuidora y así generar más ingresos para su familia. La cantidad que necesita es de C$ 18.000 córdobas a un plazo de 9 meses.
texts.en:
Ventura del Carmen López is 63 years old and married. All of her children are grown. Ms. Ventura’s job is to run her general store where she offers products like basic grains, cosmetics, clothes, etc. She has worked in the store for more than 6 years. Her plans are to invest every day in her business. The loan is destined for the purchase of more products for her store. She hopes that her store can be converted to a distributor and therefore generate more income for her family. She needs C$ 18.000 córdobas to be repaid over 9 months.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 44 años, se reconcilió con su pareja y ahora viven con sus dos hijos Luz Mercedes de 17 y Juan de 15 años de edad, en su casa propia. Se dedica a su bodega, pero en determinados momentos cuando no está, sus hijos la atienden y ahora su pareja es la que pasa más tiempo en ella. Por otro lado, también se dedica al trabajo de estibador en uno de los mercados cercanos a donde vive, le gusta su trabajo porque que le da libertad y puede pasar más tiempo con su familia. Suele trabajar de 6am a 2pm como estibador y el resto del día en su bodega. No fue nada fácil para Juan y su familia poner su tienda, nos cuenta que todo nació por la iniciativa de su hija que comenzó a vender adoquines (barra de hielo elaborados en base a jugos de frutas), por la ventana de su domicilio, al ver que las ventas eran buenas decidieron comprar gaseosas, galletas y demás golosinas para los niños que salían del jardín (institución de educación inicial) que se encuentra al frente de su casa. Ahora su negocio va prosperando y ha crecido mucho, Juan y su familia esperan seguir progresando y en el futuro expandirlo mucho más en cuanto a tamaño, para así poner una pequeña librería que administre su hija que está pronta a salir del colegio. Él es un socio antiguo de Microfinanzas Prisma y está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal “Cristo Morado”, pues dice que más que un grupo, es como una gran familia donde todos se apoyan, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de productos para implementar la tienda e iniciar su ampliación.
texts.en:
Juan is 44 years old and is back together with his partner. Now they live in the home they own with their two children, Luz Mercedes (17 years old) and Juan (15 years old). Juan works at his small grocery store, but at designated times his children take over for him. Now his partner is the one who spends the most time there. In addition, Juan also works as a longshoreman in a market close to where they live. He likes his work because it gives him freedom and he is able to spend more time with his family.

He usually works from 6am to 2pm as a longshoreman and then works the rest of the day at his grocery store. It wasn't easy for Juan and his family to open the store. He told us that the entire idea was born from an initiative of his daughter, who began selling adoquines (bars of ice made from fruit juices) from their home. Once they saw that sales were good, they decided to buy soft drinks, crackers, and some candy for children that go past the garden (an early childhood educational facility) in front of their house . Now their business is prospering and has grown a lot. Juan and his family hope to continue growing their business substantially. In this way they will be able to establish a small bookshop that will be run by their daughter who is about to finish high school.

Juan is a long-time member of Microfinanzas Prisma and is very happy to be part of the communal bank "Cristo Morado." He says that it is more than just a group; it is a big family where everyone supports one another. Juan has always been very punctual with his payments. With this loan, he will buy greater quantities of supplies to establish and grow the store.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and increase merchandise

loans.name: Ganhulug

texts.en: Ganhulug B. lives with his wife and two teenage children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His two children study at a local high school. Ganhulug has a small furniture-making business. Since 1996, with help from his wife, he has been making wooden chairs, beds, and tables for local clients. While he builds the furniture, his wife paints and polishes. They started their furniture business with 50,000 MNT. Now the business capital exceeds 600,000 MNT. Ganhulug says that he and his wife are working hard together to achieve their dream – to have their own wooden furniture factory. He requests a loan to purchase cut wood and other necessary materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase cut wood and other necessary materials

loans.name: Sovanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Sovanny Y., 36, and her husband, Mr. Vannak Phom, 38, who live along National Road Number one about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1990 and have three children: one son and two daughters. All of the children are in school. 

Sovanny stays at home to take care of her children and her house. Her husband has been driving for one company in Phnom Penh for four years. The couple is in the process of building their new house but still have some of it left to finish. So Sovanny is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to finish her house.

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita A. is from the town of Lallo, Cagayan. She is 46 years old. Carmelita is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Carmelita raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. She has been operating her piggery for almost five years.

Carmelita joined ASKI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer micro-finance institutions in the Philippines committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new seeds and new materials.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria M. Vda. D. C. D. 60 años D. edad resiD. en Lourdes Colón, ella vive sola ya que su esposo murió hace un par D. años y su única hija resiD. en Los Estados Unidos. Gloria posee una venta D. ropa para adultos y niños desD. hace 30 años, y es gracias a este negocio que ella ha logrado seguir adelante. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mucha más ropa para su negocio, ya que este es su única forma D. obtener el dinero para sus gastos personales, ella necesita invertir en el y poder mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Gloria M. Vda. D. C. is 60, and she lives in Lourdes Colón. She lives alone since her husband died a couple of years ago. Her only daughter lives in the United States. Gloria has been selling adult and children’s clothing for 30 years. Thanks to this business she has been able to get ahead. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy more clothing for her business. This is her only way of getting the money to cover her personal expenses. She needs to invest in her business and be able to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more clothes for her business

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Walter Kon Group

texts.es: El grupo “Walter Khon” esta representado por la señora Virginia Eugenia y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad en sus pagos. En general las socias se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios como la venta de pollo, ropa, zapatos, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, caramelos, frutas y al transporte público de pasajeros. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias y mejoramiento de su calidad de vida. Dentro del grupo existen socios nuevos pero que conocen la modalidad de créditos solidarios y son gente responsable, honesta y con ganas de trabajar.
texts.en:
The group “Walter Khon” is led by Virginia Eugenia and is composed of 13 members who are in the third loan cycle and have been responsible and honest in making their payments. Generally the members run different types of businesses in the sale of chicken, clothing, shoes, groceries at neighborhood stores, candies, fruits, and public transportation. The loan will be used to acquire materials, supplies, and tools that will help the group generate higher incomes; their families depend on this income and it will afford them a better quality of life. The group has some new members but they are familiar with the loan system and solidarity groups and they are responsible, honest, and hard working people.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation capital.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella A. sells koko (porridge) at Atabadi near Elmina. Koko is one of the most popular foods to have at breakfast. She sells this porridge to those who leave their homes early without having breakfast. Stella has received no formal education. She is a single parent with two children. Stella has been selling koko since 1990. She is responsible for paying bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy maize since it is the main ingredient for making koko, as well as other ingredients for the preparation of koko for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate the children.

loans.use: To buy maize, the main ingredient for making koko (porridge), and other ingredients for the preparation of koko for resale.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan started her business to help her husband pay for their household expenses. She opened her grocery store in Nablus City, Palestine, where she sells staples such as rice, noodles, sugar, tea, bread, sodas, etc. She is now 31 years old and married with one child. 

The requested loan will be used to purchase more merchandise for her store. One of her main goals is that her child will have opportunities that Sawsan never had when she was young.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing young cattle

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina T., 39 years old is a rice farmer and a mother of seven children. Her eldest is 16 years old who are her inspiratation to do more to obtain sucees in her business. When she was younger she dreamed to graduate in college. Because they don't have money to finance her schooling, she never able to degree.

Now, she needs a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her business. The loan will go far in paying the laboptrers that toil hard for her farm. Hopefully, she will have a good return of all she invested in her business.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter du riz et des tomates pour son restaurant

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala F. owns and operates a handicraft business selling plastic handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Faleasiu Tualesolo. Kalala was not affected by the tsunami which hit Samoa on 9/29/09. She is married and has four school-age children. Kalala has been in her business for less than a year and earns approximately 400 tala a month.

In 2009, Kalala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Kalala is requesting a loan of 1000 tala which will be used to purchase materials to make additional handicrafts. This will be her first loan from SPBD. Kalala plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make handicrafts

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir I. has raised cattle and farmed for 10 years. He has a daughter and the responsibility of providing food for his home. He has been able to improve his family’s financial situation thanks to the excellent care that he has given his animals. Today Samir needs to buy calves to raise so he can raise and sell them at the optimum time. Samir is requesting a loan from AqroInvest Credit Union to buy these animals and raise them so that, in time, their sale can support his family.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Sara Noemy

texts.es: Sara Noemy P. G. reside en el municipio de Colon del departamento de La Libertad. Sara tiene 36 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas, Angelina de 8 años y Stefany de 6 años de edad. Hace dos años Sara inicio su negocio con la idea de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares y es así como inicio la venta de productos de consumo para el hogar, comercializándolos desde su domicilio, a pesar que sus ventas son estables, Sara no ha logrado surtir su negocio ya que necesita un capital en efectivo que es estos momentos no posee, es por ello que solicita de tu ayuda  a través del crédito, con el que Sara podrá surtir su negocio y así seguir creciendo en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sara Noemy P. G. resides in the town of Colon, located in the department of La Libertad. She is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters, Angelina (age 8) and Stefany (age 6). Two years ago, Sara started her business with the idea of helping her husband with the family expenses. She has a store in her home where she sells household consumer products. Although her sales are stable, Sara does not have the necessary capital to restock her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can continue increasing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory to restock her business

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita S. is from the village of Calao West. She is 58 years old. Carmelita is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a beauty salon. The main source of income for the business comes from pedicure and manicure. Carmelita earns approximately 1400 PHP a week for these activities.

In 2009, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Carmelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila F. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 45 years old. Lucila is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Lucila owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and frozen foods in the market. Lucila has been engaged in her business for many years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Lucila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucila is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lucila from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica G. is from the village of Libag Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 60 years old. Veronica is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Veronica owns & operates a retail store where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Veronica joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Veronica from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Dy

texts.en: Dy S. is 53 years old and lives with another family member in Kampong Chhnang Province. She has built a grocery shop along the road in the village where she earns a living selling various items including cooking ingredients and vegetables. She is a widow with three daughters who are employed. One is working in Malaysia and the other two are garment workers. Dy S. hopes to improve her current income by receiving a Kiva loan through HKL. It will be used to buy more stock and also to buy rice in bulk that can be stored and then sold later to generate income.

loans.use: To buy more stock and to buy rice in bulk.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn N. is a 56-year-old married woman who supports her family by running a general store, providing electronic reloading services, and retailing gasoline. She lives in Brgy Camingawan, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental, with her husband, Romeo, who is now retired and their five children who are 24 to 33 years old. Three of her children are already married and two are working. Marilyn has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Marilyn is now borrowing 18,000 PHP so that she can sustain her general store, electronic reloading and gasoline retailing business. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Marilyn aspires to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Len

texts.en: Len P., age 52, is married and resides with her children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She has a business producing Cambodian traditional baskets, earning an income of US $2.50 per day. Her husband helps his wife in the business, earning the same amount of income. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially those for the children’s education. She has been doing this job since 2002. P. is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase a plot of farmland. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes T. is married to a farmer and has one child. She has received junior high education.
Agnes travels from house to house in Elmina selling pieces of cloth and ladies underwear. She has been in this business for some time now. At the time of our visit, she was yet to receive another consignment. She supports her husband in paying for their accommodation (rent) and providing food for the family. Her loan will serve as additional capital for traveling to buy more cloth to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: As additional capital for traveling to buy more cloth to resell

loans.name: Niamat's Group

texts.en: Niamat is a citizen of the city of Borewala, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines. Her husband, A. A., is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local, three-wheeled motor vehicle). Niamat supports him with her artificial flower-making business. Her flowers are used to decorate houses and the stage at wedding functions. She obtains orders from different shops in the market and generates a profit in this way. Both Niamat and A. A. use their income to meet their family's financial expenses. Niamat is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw because there is a problem with its engine.

loans.use: To repair her husband's auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: LA SRA. MIRIAM ESTA CASADA TIENE HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR,LA SRA. MIRIAM TIENE UNA CARPINTERIA DOND. REALIZAN MUEBLES D. MADERA, ESTE NEGOCIO TIENE APROXIMADAMENTE 15 AÑO D. EXPERIENCIA QUIEN ELLA JUNTAMENTE CON SU ESPOSO SE LEVANTAN DESD. LA MADRUGADA PARA PODER TRABAJAR EN ESTO, PARALELO A ESTE TRABAJO ELLA DEBE PREPARAR LA COMIDA PARA CUANDO LOS HIJOS RETORNEN DEL COLEGIO. ELLOS COMENZARON REALIZANDO TRABAJOS PARA PERSONAS EXTERNAS  QUIENES ERAN LOS QUE LAS VENDIAN, CON EL TIEMPO LLEGARON A COMPRAR MAQUINARIA Y LOGRAR PRODUCIR MAS MUEBLES PARA ELLOS COMERCIALIZARLOS, SU ESPOSO REALIZA LOS MUEBLES ELLA LE AYUDA Y TAMBIEN SE ENCARGA D. VENDERLOS AL POR MAYOR. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MADERA PARA REALIZAR MUEBLES YA QUE TIENE UN PEDIDO GRAND., EL DESEO D. LA SRA. MIRIAM ES LA D. TENER UNA MUEBLERIA RECONOCIDA Y RELIZAR MODELOS NOVEDOSOS PARA COMPLACER A SUS CLIENTES, ESTA MUY AGARDECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Miriam is married and has school-aged children. She has a carpentry shop where she makes wooden furniture. She has about 15 years of experience with this business. She and her husband get up at dawn to do their work, and Miriam also has to prepare food for when the children come home from school. They started by making products for other people, who were the ones who sold the furniture. In time they were able to buy machinery and produce more furniture so they could go into business for themselves. Miriam's husband makes the furniture; she helps him and is also in charge of selling the items wholesale. With the loan money she will buy wood to build furniture since she has a large order. Miriam wants to have a well-known furniture store and make new models to please her customers. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence placed in her with the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wood

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés tiene 58 años, es un hombre muy honesto y trabajador, está casado con Julia de 56 años, juntos tienen 7 hijos de los cuales sólo viven con 3 de ellos en su casa propia, construido de material noble. Los cuidados que ejerce sobre sus cultivos siempre le retribuyeron buenas cosechas, por eso procura brindarle a sus cafetales y platanales todo el tiempo que requieren. Así ha logrado trabajar durante 30 años sin descanso, lo que más le gusta es cosechar sus productos naturales porque es para él gratificante ver la calidad de sus productos. Sin embargo lo que más le apena es tener que laborar solo y no contar con la ayuda de sus familiares, por ello contrata operarios. Paralelamente a este trabajo, se dedica también a la oficio de construcción de inmuebles, mientras que su esposa trabaja vendiendo comida en su localidad, pero ahora se encuentra en la capital visitando a sus hijos mayores. Con el tiempo espera ayudar a su esposa, instalando un restaurante en donde desea trabajar y dejar poco a poco el arduo trabajo agrícola. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y está  feliz de trabajar en su grupo comunal, porque sus integrantes son personas solidarias y responsables, además confía en que sus cosechas serán exitosas como hasta ahora y no tendrá problemas para pagar la deuda. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono para aplicar a sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Andrés is 58-years-old, and is a very honest and hardworking man. He is married to his wife Julia, who is 56 years old. Together, they have 7 children, of whom only three live with them at home in their own house, built of quality materials. The care that they take with their crops always repays them with good harvests. That’s why they give their crops all the time they need. In this way, they’ve managed to work for thirty years without a break. What he enjoys most is harvesting his crops, because for him it is very gratifying to see the quality of his products. However, what bother him the most is to have to work alone without counting on the help of his family, and that’s why he has to hire laborers. Along with his job farming, he builds houses while his wife works selling food in their community. Now, however, she is in the capital visiting their adult children. With time he hopes to help his wife by building a restaurant where she would like to work, and little by little leave the difficult task of farming. This will be his third loan with MFP, and he’s happy to work with his group, because its members are responsible and team-oriented. He trusts that his harvests will be successful like they have been all along, and he won’t have any trouble paying back the loan. With the 1000 nuevo soles he is requesting, he will buy bags of fertilizer to use on his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda O. is from the town of Talibon. She is 56 years old. To make a living, Esmeralda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Esmeralda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years already.

In 2009, Esmeralda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmeralda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Esmeralda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Esmeralda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 30 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 10. All of her children are currently attending school.

She is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya where she has been farming for seven years. Her products are milk, eggs, tea, and chickens which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from the rental houses she owns in the same area. Her biggest challenge has been an inconsistent market for her milk, the high cost of medicine and the lack of enough food for her chickens and cows.

Joyce recently completed a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 KES and has requested this loan of 50,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will ease the burden of paying school fees for her children.

In the future, she would like to increase the number of her dairy cows and rental houses.

She would like Juhudi to reduce the interest rate on loans and re-introduce grace periods on second loans.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly L. is a married woman who lives in Purok 3, Brgy. Linaon, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns a living by operating three business ventures: running a general store, farming and making rice cakes. Her husband Patricio, who is 42 years old, works as a farmer to earn a living. Beverly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Beverly has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14,000, thus, lifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy additional stock for her general store so that she could continue to save up for the future. Beverly L. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not in school. Sharon has a business making carry powder, which she has done for four years

To help expand her business, Sharon is requesting a loan of 150000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more papers for carry powder. Sharon hopes that the loan will help her by allowing her to increase the profit from her business. In the future, Sharon hopes to do another business.

About BRAC Uganda: This loan is administered by BRAC Uganda, a registered non-governmental organization (NGO) in Uganda that is also a part of the BRAC international network. BRAC Uganda attempts to address poverty through a holistic model, offering programs in education, health, water and sanitation, agriculture, and microfinance. BRAC Uganda’s microfinance program aims to provide the poor with easy, reliable, and efficient access to institutional financial services, and reaches over 150,000 families in Uganda. For more on BRAC Uganda, please see our partner page at http://www.kiva.org/partners/65, and join our lending team, Friends of BRAC Uganda, at http://www.kiva.org/team/friends_of_brac_uganda.

loans.use: To buy more papers for carry powder

loans.name: And Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité AND LIGG. est né le jour de l’assemblée constitutive du Banc Village de SANTHIABA COKI1 en décembre 2009. Il regroupe 11 femmes qui partagent le même quartier. Elles sont unies par des liens agissants de solidarité et de voisinage.

Madame Mariama N. à droit sur la photo est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée sans enfant mais a adopté deux enfants. 

Son activité consiste la vente de tissus basin, tissus Khartoum et tissus basin. Depuis des années elle exerce cette activité. Par ailleurs, elle est entrain de s’initier peu à peu à la coupe et à la couture.

Son crédit lui permettra d’acheter en quantité importante des tissus afin de satisfaire sa clientèle d’une part et réaliser plus de bénéfices d’autre part.

Avec ce prêt reçu, elle vise à accroitre son chiffre d’affaire, aider son mari à prendre en charge la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants
texts.en:
The AND LIGG. solidarity group was born on the day of the Founding General Meeting of the SANTHIABA COKI1 “Banc Village” in December 2009. It brings together 11 women who live in the same neighborhood. They are linked to each other by solidarity and neighborhood ties. Mrs. Mariama N. on the right hand side of the photo is 38 years old. She is married and has no children but has adopted two. Her business consists in selling Basin and Khartoum fabrics. She has been running this business for years. In addition, she is learning gradually the skills of cutting and sewing. Her loan will enable her to purchase a large amount of fabric in order to meet her customers' needs and make more profits. With this loan, she aims to increase her income, help her husband cover food and healthcare needs as well as the children's tuition fees.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Karla Isabel

texts.es: La señora Karla Isabel tiene 29 años, ella es casada  y tiene un hijo de seis años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como chofer de un microbús La señora Karla tiene un negocio pequeño de librería y además allí vende cosméticos y artículos en general. Ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace dos años, empezó vendiendo útiles escolares para los niños cuando iniciaban las clases, esto fue para aprovechar que su casa queda ubicada a media cuadra de la escuela, por lo que tiene buen acceso para que los niños compren en la librería, cabe señalar que su mama le heredo este negocio, ya que en principio era ella la que iba a Managua a realizar las compras. Por supuesto, ella espera que al incrementar la oferta de sus productos, también incrementen sus ventas y por sus ganancias, esto debido a que ofrece buenos productos y a precios accesibles. Por lo que este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima. Su sueño, por el momento es construir un local solo para el negocio independiente de su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karla Isabel is 29 years old, she is married and has one son six years of age. Her husband works as a driver of a minibus. Mrs. Karla has a small bookstore business and also sells cosmetics and other general merchandise. She started this business two years ago by selling school supplies to children when the school term started, taking advantage of the fact that her house is a half a block from the school. She is well situated for the children to buy at her bookstore. Her mother passed this business on to her, in the beginning her mother was the one going to Managua to do the purchasing. By increasing her merchandise, she expects her sales to increase and therefore her income. This is due to her offering good products at accessible prices. This loan is for the purchase of merchandise. Her dream at the moment, is to have a space dedicated only to her business and independent of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Qorimankacha”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicitas; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es soltera ; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ferretería y también se dedica a la venta de maquinaria de carpintería, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia quiere tener una ferretería mas grande. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la ferretería.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Felicitas, 44, is single. She’s a member of the “Qorimankacha” communal bank located in Wanchaq district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She combines her daily chores with a hardware store; she also sells carpentry tools. She is open for business from 8am until 7pm. She’d like to have a bigger hardware store. She is asking for funds to buy merchandise for the hardware store. She uses this forum to thank all those who are part of her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the hardware store.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, de 36 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Para ella el trabajo es importante y en lo posible fomenta a su madre y hermanas. Es así que todos los días, desde muy temprano trabaja confeccionando mandiles o delantales de uso para  la cocina o diversos trabajos del hogar. Esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre cuando era un niño, desde entonces su casa se ha convertido en su taller y su centro de trabajo. A la semana produce de 200 a 300 mandiles y los distribuye al mercado más grande de su distrito, donde tiene muchos clientes que reconocen su trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de la confección de mandiles; es que no es muy trabajoso, ni requiere realizar muchos trazos, pero si es muy rentable. Es por ello que en adelante piensa asegurar las puertas y ventanas de su casa; con rejas, para asegurar sus  maquinas de coser. Este es su onceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, considerando éste crédito muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de otra maquina de coser, para remallar telas más delgadas, de ese modo espera que su hermana se especialice en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 36, is a very hard-working man. He lives in his parents' home and he most desires to improve his quality of life. Thus, work is important and where possible he supports his mother and sisters. So, every day, he starts working very early in the morning making leather aprons or pinafores for kitchen use or various household uses. He learned this work from his father when he was a child, and since then his home has become his studio and his workplace. In one week he produces 200 to 300 aprons and sells them in the largest marked in the district, where he has many customers who recognize his work. He most enjoys making the aprons; since it is not very arduous work, nor does it require much designing, but it is very profitable. Thus, in the future he wants to secure the doors and windows of his house; with bars, to secure his sewing machines. This is his eleventh loan with MFP, and he promises to pay all of the quotas punctually, since this loan will be very useful in the progress of his business. With this loan, he will invest in the purchase of another sewing machine, in order to work with thinner materials. He hopes that his sister will be able to specialize in this activity.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine, to make thinner stitches

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 48 years old, married and has three adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals in every barangay (village or small district). She uses her motorcycle with sidecar to assist in selling foods. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be the fifth loan that Teresita has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa C. is a 35-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and a fish vending business. She lives in Purok 5, Culipapa, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002, and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF, and through her own efforts.

By working hard in her two businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5000. Elisa is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Elisa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day, to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking on the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on www.kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Shamaddin

texts.en: Shamaddin A. is 52 and has sold men clothing for the last four years. He is married and has two sons. He works in the Agsu region and buys clothes in Baku city, two hours away. He was able to increase his income owing to a KIVA loan which he has already successfully repaid. Now he has applied for 1000 AZN to purchase new seasonal clothes to increase his profit.

loans.use: purchase new seasonal clothes to increase profit

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Victoria B. is from the village of Brgy. Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old. Victoria is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Victoria is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Victoria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Victoria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie C. is from the village of Campo 4, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 54 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. Merlie owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merlie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 11,600 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Merlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Merlie is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Merlie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Iftikhar

texts.ru:
Iftikhar A. 32 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey sin kotoromu 6 let on xodit v shkolu i doch kotoroy 3 qoda. Iftikhar i yeqo semya jivut Absheron regione  uje 7 let.

Iftikhar uje 6 let kak yavlyayetsya elektrik injenerom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca kotoriy toje bil elektrikom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti dlya svoyey raboti.
texts.en: Iftikhar A. is 32 years. He is married and has two children: a 6-year old son, who is in school, and a 3-year old daughter. Iftikhar and his family have been living in the Absheron Region for 7 years. Iftikhar has been working as an electrical engineer for six years. He learned this trade from his father, who also used to be an electrician. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to purchase tools for his work.

loans.use: Purchasing necessary new tools

loans.name: Johana Alexandra

texts.es:
Johana Alexandra A. Y. tiene 22 años, vive en unión libre y tiene una hija de un año que se llama Norelys Anahi Acosta A.. Ella vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Johana Alexandra es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.   

Johana Alexandra comenzó su comercio de venta de ropa desde hace 9 meses. Ella compra sus productos en la cuidad de Guayaquil. Ella solicita el crédito para incrementar la mercadería del negocio. Gracias a este crédito ella podrá abastecer con la mercadería.

Para el futuro ella espera tener su propia casa y su propio local para poner su negocio. El mayor desafío que ella enfrenta es cuando un cliente no cancele.

En su tiempo libre ella hace deporte y celebra las fiestas religiosas del pueblo. Estas fiestas se celebran los días 8 y 22 de diciembre y el día 22 de julio.
texts.en:
Johana Alexandra A. Y. is 22 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and her one year-old daughter who is called Norelys Anahi Acosta A..  She lives in Chillanes, in Bolívar province.

Johana Alexandra is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) rural loan group.  This new group is located in the community of Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.

Johana Alexandra set up a business selling clothes 9 months ago.  She buys her products in the city of Guayaquil.  She is requesting this loan so that she can increase her merchandise.  This loan will enable her to stock up with merchandise.

In the future, Johana Alexandra hopes to own her own home and her own premises from which she can run her business.  The biggest challenge she faces is when a customer doesn't make their repayments.  In her spare time, she likes to take part in sports and local religious fiestas.  The fiestas are celebrated on the 8th and 22nd of December and on the 22nd of July.

loans.use: To keep her business running

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David K., 43, is married with five school-aged children who all attend school. He is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where he has been farming for eighteen years. His mixed farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables that are all sold in the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater to the needs of his family.

He has requested a loan of 51,600 KES through Kiva’s partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production. The extra income from this loan will help improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wood for her business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos pertenece al Banco comunal “Nueva vida”, perteneciente a la provincia de Molina. El se dedica a la venta de alimentos, específicamente; verduras, abarrotes y cecinas. 

Rubro que desempeña desde hace 2 años en un local que acomodó en el patio de su casa. Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas y ferias libres.

Tiene como clientes frecuentes a sus vecinos y conocidos. 

Todas sus ganancias son destinadas para abastecer su negocio y mantener económicamente su hogar, ya que el negocio de Juan Carlos es el único ingreso que recibe su familia. 

Con este préstamo, Juan Carlos ha comprado mercadería al por mayor lo que para su negocio es más rentable. 

Su sueño es ampliar su local para abastecerlo de mercadería y así obtener más ganancias. Además quiere comprar un vehiculo para trasladar la mercadería que compra. 

Las motivaciones de Juan Carlos de continuar con el negocio son debido a la productividad e ingresos que genera.

Para Juan Carlos los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza han sido fundamentales en su negocio, ya que le han permitido invertir y obtener mayores ganancias. 

Molina es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, ubicada en la región del Maule. Se caracteriza principalmente por ser uno de los grandes polos de la industria vitivinícola chilena. Además de las vides, está la industria frutícola, destacando la producción de manzanas, peras y kiwis.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos belongs to the “Nueva Vida” community bank. It is in the province of Molina. He sells food, specifically vegetables, groceries and smoked meat.  He has worked in this area for more than 2 years in a locale he set up in his house' patio. He buys his merchandise in wholesale supermarkets and fairs. He has neighbors and acquaintances as frequent customers. 

All of his earnings are used to supply his business and support his home financially, since Juan Carlos' business is the only income his family receives. 

With this loan, Juan Carlos has bought merchandise wholesale, which is more profitable for his business. His dream is to expand his locale to have more merchandise and thus more earnings. He also wants to buy a vehicle to transport the merchandise he buys. Juan Carlos' motivation to continue with the business is due to the productibity and income that it generates.  

For Juan Carlos, the loans from Fondo Esperanza have been fundamental for his business, since they have allowed him to invest and obtain more profit. 

Molina is a community in the central area of Chile, located in the Maule region. It is characterized mainly by being one of the mainstays of the wone industry. In addition to the vinyards, there is the fruit industry, especially apples, pears and kiwis.

loans.use: Wholesale merchandise

loans.name: Jonife

texts.en:
Jonife is a 26-year-old single woman who supports her family by selling fruits and vegetables and operating a general store.  She lives in the municipality of Narra, Palawan. Jonife joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jonife has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,800, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,000 to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Jonife is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Enkh-Amgalan

texts.en:
Enkh-Amgalan, age 33, is from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and two daughters in a small house in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar. His daughters, aged 9 and 13, attend public secondary school.
  
Enkh-Amgalan started his first business in 2003 at an auto market, called Da Khuree, repairing starter motors outside. He buys used starter motors to fix and renovate.  After such alterations, he sells starter motors at a higher price.  After he started the business, he rented a work space for 5 years and finally managed to buy a container on his own in 2008. Today his business has expanded and he sells different kinds of tools, equipment and starter motors at his shop. Last year, Enkh-Amgalan built a new small house with the business profits, as well as from his working capital.

Enkh-Amgalan is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to purchase more starter motors. Since he used his working capital for the house, the business profitability been lower. He wishes to expand his business and make his small house bigger so that his family can enjoy better living.

loans.use: to purchase starter motors

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en:
Donatha is 43 years old, married and has two children, 22 and 14 years old. Her husband is a farmer.

Donatha owns a bar in which she sells different types of beer. She has been in business for three years, and it has helped her meet the needs of her family easily without any other support.

Donatha is requesting a loan to buy more beer to increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase more beer to sell

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Abu Bakarr K.. He is married, and has two children aged 10 and 25 years. 

In 2008, Abu established his chair-upholstering business. He began his business because he needed to generate income to support his family. 

Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 700,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of  SLL 3,000,000. Abu has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires this new loan in order to add more stock to his business for more profit. 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. 

In the future, Abu Bakarr K. plans to educate his children to university level and open another shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy upholstery materials

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is 55 and married with two children. Her oldest child is 22. She and her husband work as farmers and Fortunata has been farming for ten years. She farms in San Francisco, Agusan del sur and earns 12,000 PHP a month.

Fortunata is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Mahmanazar

texts.en:
Selling office supplies became the only source of income for Mahmanazar, a humble 49-year-old man who has been doing this for 19 years. Mahmanazar is married and is a father of 3 children. His children is the reason that he works hard in order to provide them with the best and a bright future. 

This young man has many projects for his future.  Mahmanazar's main project is to expand his store where he will be able to sell not only office supplies but also a great numbers of books. His current wish is to add more office supplies and therefore have more to offer to his clients. 

Mahmanazar would pay back this loan, and with the extra income earned he would be able to pay for his children’s education. This young man waits for your help. Let's make his dream come true.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy stock for his office supplies business

loans.name: Turakhon

texts.ru: Турахон проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 49 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а дети учатся в средней школе. Сам Турахон имеет высшее образование. По профессии он преподаватель. В этой области проработал более 10 лет. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей на рынке. Он арендует торговую точку, где продает мужскую и детскую одежду. Этим видом деятельности занимается 2 года. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Turakhon lives in Dangara. He is 49 years old, married, and has five children. His wife is a housewife, and his children study in high school. Turakhon has a higher education. By profession, he is a teacher. He taught for more than ten years. Today, he works trading in the market. He rents a shop where he sells men's and children's clothes. He has been doing this work for two years.  He is taking out a loan to buy seasonal goods. He wants to increase the variety of goods he sells.

loans.use: to buy seasonal goods

loans.name: El Bonete Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "El Bonete" porque asi se llama el lugar donD. se formo el grupo, esta ubicado en el estado D. MoreL., en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes y es la quinta vez que solicitan un prestamo. Maria es integrante del grupo, tiene 32 años, estudio hasta el tercer año D. secundaria, es comerciante, tiene un total D. 3 hijos (2 mujeres y un varon). Ella se dedica a la venta D. colchas y cosméticos, negocio que inicio hace 3 años ya que con lo que ganaba su esposo no alcanzaba para solventar L. gastos D. la familia. Al momento D. solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta porque tendrá  mas productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y D. este modo podrá conseguirL. a mejor precio, quiere este prestamo para comprar cosmeticos, cremas, perfumes y colchas. Con las ganancias espera poder comprar uniformes para el próximo ciclo escolar D. sus hijos y otra parte para ahorrar y seguir comprando más mercancia para no verse presionada con L. pedidos que le hacen diariamente. Ella desea continuar brindandoles educación a sus hijos para que cumplan sus sueños, también desea apoyar a su esposo en L. gastos familiares y tener una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Bonete” because that’s the name of the place where the group was formed.  It is located in the State of MoreL. in México.  The group has 9 members and this is the fifth time they’ve asked for a loan.

María, 32, is one of the group members.  She completed 9th graD., is a merchant, and has three children (two girls and one boy).  She sells bedspreads and cosmetics, a business she started three years ago because what her husband earned was insufficient to cover all the family’s expenses.

At the moment of requesting the loan she is happy because she’ll have more products to offer her customers and she’ll be able to get them at better prices.  She wants to use the loan to buy cosmetics, creams, perfume and bedspreads.  

She intends to use part of the profits to buy her children’s school uniforms for the upcoming term and she will save part of it so that she can continue to buy merchandise and not feel pressured when she receives her daily orders.  She wants to continue to proviD. education for her children so that they will make their dreams a reality and she also wants to help her husband with household expenses and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, creams, perfume and bedspreads.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: Leonarda de 26 años de edad convive con Apolonio de 30 años, fruto de esta relación tienen dos hijos con quienes viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Para Leonarda  la clave del éxito está en la responsabilidad, puntualidad y en el respeto hacía sus clientes. A pesar de su corta edad, decidió emprender una pequeña tienda de ventas de prendas de vestir, con la necesidad de cubrir sus gastos familiares. Ella sabe que es el primer paso para cosechar muchos triunfos durante su travesía, para ello ya tiene una buena cartera de clientes, y esto debido al buen servicio que ofrece a sus compradores. Generalmente trabaja por cuenta propia y de vez en cuando recibe la ayuda de su esposo. Su punto de venta lo realiza en su misma localidad y a pesar de obtener buenas ganancias económicas, ella planea en un futuro próximo ampliar su  tienda, introduciendo nuevos productos para cautivar a sus clientes. Este será su segundo crédito con  MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivas obligaciones. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería para surtir su tienda de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Leonarda, aged 26 cohabits with Apolonio who is 30 years old.   From this relationship they have two children with whom they live in their own home, located in the district of Pichari.  For Leonarda, the key to success is responsibility, punctuality and respect for her customers. 

Despite her young age, she decided to start a small shop selling clothing, with the need to cover her family expenses. She knows that this is the first step to achieve many successes during her journey, for she already has a good customer base, and this is because of the good service she offers to her buyers. Generally she works on her own account, and occasionally she receives help from her husband.  Her sales take place in the same location and despite getting good economic returns, she plans in the near future to expand her store, introducing new products to captivate her customers. 

This will be her second loan with MFP, the obligations of which she agrees to comply with.  With the 2,000 New Soles that she is requesting, she plans to invest it in the purchase of merchandise to stock up her clothing store.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: François Xavier Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 21 février 2001. Le groupe est constitué de six femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leurs activités principales est le petit commerce et l'aviculture. 

Madame Jacqueline qui est à la droite de la photo en bleu avec l’écharpe blanc ou cou levant la main est  responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 58 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge quatre autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, pour l'avoir pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, scolarité etc.…) .
texts.en:
This solidarity group was established on February 21, 2001. The group is made up of six women who live in the same neighborhood. Their primary occupations are small business and poultry farming.

Mrs. Jacqueline, who is at right in the photo, wearing blue with a white scarf at her neck, is the group's leader. She is 58 years old. She is married and the mother of five. She also takes care of four other children entrusted to her by their parents.

She occupies herself with the sale of vegetables. She has solid experience in this line of business as a result of having practiced it for several years.

This loan will allow Mrs. Jacqueline to strengthen her capital and to better grow her business.

The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, education, etc.).

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Annaliza has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & breads. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Annaliza is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Annaliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Liliana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Liliana es una joven de 31 años. Es soltera y tiene un hijo de un año y medio y vive junto a sus padres y sus hermanos en el cantón Santo Domingo. El clima ahí es cálido-húmedo y por esta razón esta región del país tiene una alta producción de frutas. Casi todos en la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas se dedican a producir fruta o al comercio de la misma.

Desde hace dos años ella empezó a trabajar comercializando naranjilla, una fruta exótica del sector. Su trabajo es duro ya que en la madrugada ella debe comprarla para revenderla y esto implica cargar pesadas cajas, por eso ella paga la ayuda de un joven muchacho para que haga este trabajo. A ella le preocupa la salud de su pequeño hijo ya que ha sufrido de algunas molestias en su corta vida por lo que ella quiere mejorar sus ingresos para solventar esta necesidad. Ella quiere invertir en cajas de la fruta que vende, de manera que al comprar más cajas el precio sea menor y así tener mejores ingresos.
