A Liliana le interesa mucho la salud de su hijo y sobre todo su educación. Ella sueña con poder tener una casa propia y que a su hijo nunca le falte nada.
texts.en:
Liliana is a young woman who is 31 years of age. She is single and has a son who is 1½ years old. Liliana lives with her parents and siblings in the canton of Santo Domingo. The climate in this area is warm and humid, which is why there is a high level of fruit production. Nearly everyone in the province of Santo Domingo de Los Tsáchilas produces or sells fruit.

Two years ago Liliana began selling “naranjillas”, an exotic fruit that comes from this region. Her work is difficult because she has to start at dawn by buying what she will sell, which requires carrying heavy boxes. For this reason, she pays a young man to help her with this work. Liliana is worried about the health of her young son who has suffered from a few ailments in his short life, so she wants to improve her income in order to provide for his needs. She wants to invest in boxes of fruit to sell. By purchasing more boxes, the unit price is less and she will be able to generate more income.

Liliana is very interested in her son’s health and providing for his education. She dreams of having her own home and seeing that her son lacks nothing.

loans.use: to buy boxes of "naranjillas".

loans.name: Oeung

texts.en:
Oeung, age 55, is a farmer who earns $1.50 per day. She is a single mother with four children, two of whom are studying in school. The other two are employed and earn $3 per day each. 

Every month, Oeung has to spend $60, including $10 on her house rental, $15 on school fees, and $10 on household expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to buy columns and wood for repairing her house. This loan will help her family to have a good house in which to live. 

In the future, Oeung wants to send her daughter to study tailoring, and she will help her to get a small tailoring shop at home.

loans.use: to buy columns and wood for repairing her house

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari store in the place to obtain daily income for the household. She is 48 years old, married and is raising her two grown dependents. Her husband is also working for the family, which has allowed her to own PHP 7,000 a month. The store offers grocery items and other supplies that surely meet market demands. 

Sarah became interested in what her neighbors told her about GDMPC, a reason why she too joined the organization. Her first loan application of PHP 6,000 has been approved, allowing her to purchase additional goods to sell. She aspires to expand and improve the business operations for better living.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo y su esposa son una pareja trabajadora de maquiladora que esta dispuesta en ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y un mejor patrimonio.
Su vivienda la construyeron horros  propios de toda una vida, pero aun les falta poner la losa en un cuarto por que los fondos que tenían ya se les terminaron, por tal motivo solicitan un préstamo para comprar cemento, varilla, arena y pagar la mano de obra para ver su proyecto realizado. Para  Guillermo su prioridad es su familia por lo que desea ofrecer confort y mayor espacio.
texts.en:
Señor Guillermo and his wife are a hard-working couple who work in a maquiladora. They want to offer their children a better quality of life and a better heritage.
They built their home with their own life savings, but they still need to install the stone in one of the rooms; they are out of funds. For this reason they are requesting a loan to purchase cement, rods, and sand, and to pay for the labour in order to realize their project. Guillermo's priority is his family and he wants to offer them comfort and more space.

loans.use: to install stone

loans.name: Mor

texts.fr: Monsieur Mor  est un  jeune  soudeur métallique de 25 ans. Il vit au Sénégal. Il est célibataire et  capitalise une expérience  de 12 ans dans son activité. Il a choisi son activité par amour et éprouve beaucoup de plaisir  en ce qui concerne la beauté de la création et la virilité de l’activité. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs  prévu pour l’achat d’une meule  qui sera utilisée pour les besoins de son activité. Ce financement lui permettra  de mieux rentabiliser son activité et d’accroitre ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Mor, age 25, is a young welder who lives in Senegal. He's unmarried and has 12 years of experience in his business. He chose this field of activity out of love for it, and gets a lot of joy from the beauty of the creations and the virility of the trade.

He's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000 in order to buy a grinding machine for use in his business. This loan will enable him to make his business more profitable and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy a grinding machine

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 64 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos de sus cinco hijos.

Él tiene 54 años de dedicarse a la agricultura desde muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura. Él viaja a una ciudad de la zona oriental del país, en autobús durante treinta cinco minutos, para comprar sus insumos.

Don Juan esta solicitando un préstamo, para comprar una parcela de tierra que esta alquilando y es donde él trabaja, ya que actualmente la están vendiendo y él la quiere adquirir por que si la venden a otra persona, él se quedara sin un lugar donde trabajar.

De esta manera don Juan, ya no tendrá que alquilar y preocuparse de que debe pagar y podrá continuar sembrando granos básicos como maíz y mantener a su ganado ahí mismo.

El desea continuar trabajando, tener más animales para obtener mejores ingresos y proveer a su familia de una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 64 years old living with his wife and two of his five children.  He’s been farming for 54 years.  His parents taught him how to work in agriculture when he was very little.  He takes a 35-minute bus trip to a city in the east of the country to buy his supplies.

Juan is asking for a loan to buy a piece of land that he currently farms and leases since it’s for sale right now and he wants to buy it because if they sell it to someone else he’ll be left with no place to work.  In this way, Juan won’t have to lease any longer nor worry about having to pay and will be able to continue farming basic grains like corn and to keep his cattle there.  He wants to keep working and to have more animals to earn better income to provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 60 años, es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja, con quien tuvo un hijo que ya es mayor de edad e independiente con familia propia. Ella tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de su pareja, al cosatado donde vive su hijo. EL trabajo de Olga consiste en la venta de pescado en un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad, ella se levanta temprano para ir al puerto del reloj público y así conseguir al por mayor a los pescadores que llegan con los alimentos. Lleva realizando este trabajo por casi 40 años y menciona que con este trabajo dio educación y alimento a su hijo, ahora ella trabaja sola y lo sigue haciendo por que es único medio de generar ingresos para su hogar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo por las tardes para poder estar en su casa y descansar ya que a su edad no es igual que cuando era joven, además siempre fue independiente y se acostumbró a depender de ella misma. Espera poder mantenerse y seguir trabajando por mucho tiempo más. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, le gusta mucho el grupo al que pertenece ya que son muy responsables, además esta muy agradecida de trabajar con la institución ya que le dan créditos fácil y con bajos intereses. Con el monto solicitado, comprará pescado en mayor cantidad, además desea aprovechar en vender en la carretera para lograr vender todo la mercadería.
texts.en:
Olga, a sixty-year-old woman, is responsible and hardworking. She lives with her partner, with whom she had a son who is already grown and independent with his own family. She has her own house where she lives by her partner's side, and next door to her son's home. Olga sells fish in a very busy market in the city. She gets up early to go to the Port of the Public Clock to buy wholesale from the fishermen. She's been doing this work for almost forty years and says that through this job she was able to feed and educate her son. Now she works alone and she keeps doing it because it's the only way to generate income for her home.

What she likes about her job is that she has time in the afternoons to be at home and rest because at her age it's not the same as when she was young. Furthermore she's always been independent and got used to depending on herself. She hopes to be able to support herself and keep working for a long time.

This will be her second loan with MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma]. She likes the group that she belongs to very much because they are very responsible. She's also very grateful to work with the institution since they grant her loans easily and with low interest. With the amount requested she'll buy fish in greater quantity. She also wants to take advantage of selling by the highway in order to sell all the merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en: Marcelino is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. Marcelino has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marcelino hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Luís Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor Luís tiene 42 años de edad, esta acompañado con dos hijos.

Él aprendo los trabajos de la agricultura, desde los 15 años de edad. Fue su papá quien le enseño, ya que no podía darle el estudio para que fuera un profesional.

Don Luís debe caminar  a pie durante treinta minutos desde  su casa hasta la carretera, donde aborda un vehiculo (pick up) durante cuarenta minutos hasta llegar al lugar donde compra los insumos agrícolas.

Don Luís esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 6 sacos de abono, 40 libras de semilla de maíz, entre otros insumos para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz bajo riego  por gravedad (sistema a través del cual se dispersa el agua para regar los cultivo, sin usar dispositivos solo por la gravedad, se busca una pendiente para derramar el agua y que esta busque su cause, atravesando todo el cultivo).

Al comprar los insumos de una sola vez, don Luís ahorrara tiempo y dinero. Además estará seguro de dar a sus cultivos un manejo adecuado y a tiempo; esto permitirá que su producción aumente y también sus ingresos, ya que él vende el elote.

Don luís espera ahorrar de las ganancias resultado de la venta del maíz, para comprar dos bueyes, con los cuales podrá arar la tierra de otros agricultores y obtener otro ingreso, que le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Luís is 42 years old and has 2 children.

He learned how to farm when he was 15 years old. His father taught him how to farm as he couldn't provide him with the education to become a professional.

Don Luís has to walk for 30 minutes from his house to the road where he boards a pick-up and travels for 40 minutes to where he buys his agricultural supplies.

Don Luís is asking Fundacion Campo for a loan to buy 6 sacks of manure, 40lbs of corn seed and other supplies to sow 7,000 square metres of land with corn under a gravity irrigation system ( an irrigation system which disperses water to irrigate the crops without using other devices only gravity, as the water seeks to flow downhill naturally and so waters the entire crop).

By buying the items at the same time, Don Luis will save both time and money. In addition, he will be certain of providing his crops with adequate and timely care. This will give him a bigger yield and income as he sells the corn.

Don Luís hopes to save from the resulting profits of selling the corn to buy 2 oxen with which to plough the land of other farmers and obtain another income which will enhance his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of manure, 40lbs of corn seed and other supplies.

loans.name: Cheene

texts.en:
Cheene is 22 years old, married, and has two young children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.

Cheene and her husband run a fishing business. They are able to sustain their family through this business. She requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and buckets. 

She hopes for their business to grow. Cheene also hopes to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and buckets.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Doris es una madre emprendedora y trabajadora se dedica  a la venta de comida, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante donde vende menú y otros platos típicos de la región. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Doris requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz, fideos, aceite y otras cosas más.     

Doris agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Resourceful Women), a Communal Bank whose members meet every thirty days in the town of Cusco.

Doris is a resourceful and hardworking mother who engages in selling meals. She owns a small restaurant where she sells menus and other typical dishes of her region. She has been engages in this activity for a few years already, and things are going very well for her thanks to the dedication she works with.

In this occasion Doris is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as bags of sugar, bags of rice, noodles and oil among other articles.

Doris is thankful for and gives great value to the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her monthly dues.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, bags of sugar, noodles and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and tailoring materials

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet, 32 years old, is married to Joseph and they are blessed with three children. Violet has operated a retail shop for three years. The business gives her a monthly income of KES 7,900.

This is Violet's first loan with KADET. She will use the funds to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and soap for sale. Violet hopes to start a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, rice and soap

loans.name: Besta

texts.en:
Besta is a 28-year-old married woman with three children two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food at a stall in Yei, South Sudan for two years.
Besta is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase cassava and maize. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase cassava and maize for sale.

loans.name: Edwige

texts.fr: Edwige est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Edwige a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Edwige est mariée à un certain Geames. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Edwige vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Pour assurer les divers besoins, Edwige vend depuis cinq ans, des charbons de bois, des jus de bissape et des boissons à son domicile. Edwige s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et à Lomé. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Edwige contribue aux différentes charges de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Edwige sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Edwige is 36 and lives in Benin. She quit school at the primary level. She is married to a man named Geames. They both care for their 3 children, who all attend school. Edwige lives with her husband and her children. They both take care of the family financially. In order to contribute to family-related expenses, Edwige has been selling charcoal, drinks, and hibiscus juice at home for 5 years. She buys these items at a market in Benin and in Lomé. Thanks to the profits generated by this activity, Edwige is able to help support her family. In order to meet the ever-growing needs of her customers, she is applying for a loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a petty trader, she trades in ladies and children's dress, underwear, jeans and shoes. She has done so for 3 years now. Esi is married to a shoe maker and has 5 children. They live at Ewusi, near Cape Coast. She helps her husband pay for their children's expenses. Esi will use her loan to purchase more ladies and children dresses, and underwear to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Esi wishes to acquire a shop to sell her goods.

loans.use: To purchase ladies and childrens dresses and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Mariama Thiedo's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé le 16 Juillet 2012 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son sixième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes la même localité. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama Thiedo(debout à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 02 filles et 03 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits divers : habits et chaussures qu’elle achète à Dakar. 

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 30 boubou à 7500f  l’un, 30 paires de chaussures à 9000f l’une et paie un transport de 15000f pour les revendre en détails 

 Les bénéfices lui serviront  de payer la scolarité de ses enfants et participer à la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was created and inaugurated on July 16, 2012. The group is entering its sixth loan cycle and consists of women who all live in the same area. They get along well and share a good team spirit. Their main business activity is small trade. 

Mrs. Diénaba (standing at the far right and raising her hand) is the group’s featured borrower. She is married with five children, two girls and three boys. She sells various goods that she buys in Dakar, and this includes clothing and footwear. 

She will use this loan to buy 30 boubous at 7,500f each and 30 pairs of shoes at 9,000f each to retail. She will also pay 15,000f for transportation.    

Her profits will allow her to cover her children’s tuition fees and to help with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy 30 boubous at 7,500f each and 30 pairs of shoes at 9,000f each, and to pay 15,000f for transportation of these goods that she plans to retail.

loans.name: Maria Elena Moyano Group

texts.es: 5 mujeres  responsables de distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellas son las integrantes del grupo comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO” una de ellas es la Sra. Sandra de 37 años de edad casada  y con 3 hijos menores de edad. La Sra. Sandra se dedica ya hace 2 años al negocio de venta de calzado (zapatos y zapatillas para damas y caballeros) en un local que está ubicado en su propia casa donde labora todos los días. A la Sra. Sandra  en el futuro le gustaría ampliar su negocio en vender calzado para niños y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más calzado (zapatos y zapatillas para damas y caballeros) y así poder seguir generando más ingresos. La Sra. Sandra es la segunda de la mano izquierda se le distingue por su blusa de color negro y es la única que usa lentes en el grupo. Ella y el grupo se despiden con gran agradecimiento de Kiva y diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.

loans.use: PARA COMPRAR MAS CALZADO (ZAPATOS Y ZAPATILLAS PARA DAMAS Y CABALLEROS)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy shares on the stock exchange market.

loans.name: Farkhunda

texts.en: Farkhunda, daughter of Jan M., was born in 1978 in Kabul, Afghanistan. Her family includes 9 members and she is single and has a vegetable sales business. She lives in District 7 of Kabul and has been busy with her work for 10 years. She buys vegetables from the market, cleans them at home, and then sells them at the bazaar to earn some money and assist her family financially. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has made good use of her loans to develop her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Comfort Bih

texts.en:
Comfort was born in 1968.  She is married with five children. The most challenging thing she has faced in her life is taking care of her sick child who was initiated into a spiritual colt. What has wounded her so much in her life is maltreatment from her in-laws. With all this depression, she almost gave up when her pig, which was her only source of income at that time, gave birth and ate up all her piglets. This affected her because she had spent money on crossing the pig and on pig feed which she was expecting to recover after selling the piglets. She has taken GHAPE loan three times before and paid back. She intends to do poultry farming now (buying day-old chicks and raring them) and petit business.  She feels that this business will be a success because they have been trained by GHAPE on how to succeed on these aspects. She will be able to supply fowls and eggs to those operating restaurant businesses in her community. She says that this loan will help her expand her business and the profit will enable her to construct a house in her compound. This will really make her happy. 


First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Poultry farming and Roasting of Maize

loans.name: Ulmasoy

texts.en:
Ulmasoy is a pensioner and mother of three children. She lives with her younger son’s family. But Ulmasoy is a person who could not sit at home. She is very cheerful and energetic. She wants to earn money and help her son to support his family.

Her business is the trade of household goods, which is located on the second floor of the Panjshanbe market. She is renting the little place outside of the shop, from which she takes goods and sells them in her trading place. She receives some profit from this activity.

She likes her business and wants to increase the number of her goods. For this purpose she is requesting 600USD. She wants to add new kinds of soap and shampoo to her assortment.

loans.use: Increasing the number of products

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa K. is fifty five years old and married with six children.  He owns a small store selling onions in the market of Magburaka town in Sierra Leone.  With his previous loan Mustafa would some times buy fresh vegetables from the village and supply them to the market women.  This is because he wants to diversify his business for more profit. For this reason he is requesting a loan of $350. He said, it is more profitable to access loans from SMT than to take goods on credit from the big merchants.

loans.use: Diversify his business by purchasing fresh vegetables and supplying them to the market vendors.

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar A. is a 32-year-old married man who has two children. He is a farmer. He is from Lachin region and right now lives with his family in Sumgayit, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan.

Eldar started his business in 1995, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. The work is interesting, but it is time-consuming and it takes a lot of effort. At the same time, the salary is not enough to cover all of the family expenses.

In 2005 Eldar borrowed US$ 500 to add to his own savings of $250 and purchased another milk cow. Since January 2006, prices have doubled and he applied for a loan of US$ 800 from Normicro to purchase two calves for meat production. The 3rd time he borrowed US$1500 and further expanded his business. These loans were all paid back in a timely manner.

Now, Eldar would like to borrow US$ 1,800 in order to acquire one cow, 3 young bulls, and feed for them. He is applying to Kiva for US$1200 and remaining US$600 will be paid by Normicro. He will repay the loan within 16 months. He hopes eventually to expand his business still further.

loans.use: to acquire one cow, 3 young bulls and feed for his cattle

loans.name: Try

texts.en: Mrs. Try K., age 57, works with her husband selling grocery and souvenir products, earning collectively up to $3 day of profits. They have five children, one who helps her in business and four who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase another grocery stand to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase another grocery stand to expand her business.

loans.name: Kitooro 2 (C) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Jesca (group leader) is 32 years old and divorced with 3 children. She sells furniture for a living. Harriet works in a hotel, Aisha has a market stall, Sarah is a hairdresser and Madina is a tailor. Jesca wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Mrs. Karen R. lives in her parents’ home in the Llojeta section of the city of La Paz, along with her husband and their two children. She promotes cosmetic products and her husband works in a sporting goods store.

The rooms they occupy date back more than twenty years and the roof, due to age-related deterioration, is in disrepair and leaks when it rains.

The credit solicited would be earmarked to replace a roof and remodel the interior of one bedroom. This is the first occasion they seek a loan and the socioeconomic analysis completed indicates they qualify favorably for access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Karen R. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Edson España y sus dos hijos. La señora Karen es promotora de productos cosméticos y su esposo es empleado en una tienda de venta de artículos deportivos. Las habitaciones que ocupan datan de más de veinte años y los techos, debido al deterioro por su antigüedad presentan fisuras que se traducen en filtraciones de agua cuando llueve. El crédito solicitado será destinado al cambio de techos en una habitación y la reparación del revoque interior de la habitación. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Fix the roof and remodel the interior of one bedroom.

loans.name: Prok

texts.en:
Mrs. Prok Y. is a widow with four children: two sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives in a separate house. The other two children work in a garment factory, and her other son farms with her. The family lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Prok is a farmer. She has been growing rice and raising pigs for twenty years. Besides farming, she also sells lotus flowers. She buys lotus flowers from a farmer in her village, and uses some from her farm, for resale at the market in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Prok is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $1,000 to build a pig pen and to repair her house.

loans.use: To build a pig pen and repair her house

loans.name: Candida Del Socorro

texts.es:
In the municipality of South San Rafael in the city of Managua, Mrs. Candida Q. has been selling food items and personal products in her grocery store for the last 3 years.

She’s married and has the responsibility of raising her 2 children, supporting them in their studies and offering them the highest quality of life that she can possibly manage. Ceprodel has been an important supporter of her business in the past, and has given her previous loans to buy products. She is soliciting another loan to acquire products for her store, in order to continue providing for her children.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Candida Q. desde hace tres años se dedica al negocio de pulpería vendiendo todo tipo de productos tales como comestibles y personales.

Actualmente es casada y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus dos hijos brindándole los estudios y un mejor nivel de vida en el que se puedan desarrollar. Ceprodel ha sido un punto importante en su negocio debido a que ha apoyado a la señora Nubia por medio de créditos que le han permitido adquirir sus productos para comercializarlos. Una vez mas ella necesita financiamiento para la adquisición de los productos para así continuar con el mantenimiento de sus hijos que tanto necesitan de ella.

loans.use: To buy products for her store.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Mrs. Lai Y., 52, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Nou, 54, were married in 1976 and have seven children, three sons and four daughters. Two of their children are in school and the others have full time employment and weave silk at home.  Sophal grows tomatoes, papayas, and eggplant in the farm near the house. He sells the products to a wholesaler in the village. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Lai has been a weaver since she was fourteen years old. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells their finished products to the middleman in the village who will sell it in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for her children ride to work in Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children ride to work in Phnom Penh.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Ms. Blanca U. has dedicated herself for several years to raising cattle in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur where she is originally from. She is the mother of three small children who need the mutual support of their mother. This is the reason why she puts so much effort into her business of raising cattle as this is the only income that supports her home.

As all growing businesses require an investment, the need that she is faced with today is the need to invest in the purchase of livestock to subsequently sell. For this sole reason she has come to Ceprodel to obtain the necessary loan to purchase the livestock and then be able to sell it in her town.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Blanca U. se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de la ganadería en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur de donde es originaria. Es madre de tres pequeños hijos que necesitan del apoyo mutuo de su madre y por esta razón es que ella muy esforzadamente se dedica al negocio de la ganadería siendo este su único ingreso para mantener su hogar.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo requiere de inversión, la necesidad que ella hoy en día atraviesa es que necesita invertir en la compra de ganado para luego comercializarlo. Por esta única razón es que ella acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra del ganado y así comercializarlo en su sector de habitación donde ella se desempeña.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock.

loans.name: Las Semillitas De Rsr Group

texts.es:
This Group is maD. of 15 persons 25 % males and 75 % women. The name of the group comes from another institution from which they come. The Semillitas RSR started their second cycle. The first cycle they worked with integrity and honesty making all their payments on time excepting for one person who this cycle did not join for the same reason. The hope of every one is to be able to keep on being capitalized further and not to depend anymore on loans and to be able to work with their own capital, and this way to create their own micro company for the benefit of their families.

Name of the partner, Sex ,Activity, Years working

L. C. RUTH, Female, Footware sales, 5 years

S. L. RONALD JOSE, Male, Clothes sales 2 years

V. A. YOSIDA LOURDES, Female, Food sales, 2 years

V. MAPLE WALDIR JOSE, Male, Cabdriver owner, 3 years

A. A. MERCEDES Female Grocery store, 2 years

S. H. ANA ELVIA Female, Chicken sales, 20 years

M. OF A. ROSSI CRISTINA, Female, Cosmetics sales, 3 years

POND Y. STELA Female, Clothes sales, 41 years

G. C. JHASMANI JUNIORS, Male, Sausage Sales, 5 years

S. S. ANA MARIA, Female, Food deliveries, 3 years

V. A. DAYSI RUTH, Female, Food sales, 2 years

C. D. MONTECINOS SONIA, Female, Grocery store, 3 years

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

Grupo conformado por 15 personas 25 % varones y 75% mujeres. El nombre del grupo sale D. un grupo creado en otra institución D. la cual ellos vienen. Las semillitas RSR ingresó a su segundo ciclo en el primer ciclo trabajaron con honestidad y honradez sin fallar ninguna D. sus cuotas exceptuando una persona que en este ciclo no ingreso por la misma razón. La esperanza D. cada persona es poder seguir capitalizándose para mas adelante ya no depender D. prestamos y poder trabajar con capital propio, D. esa manera crear su microempresa para el provecho D. su familia. Nombre del socio, Sexo, Actividad Años en el Rubro L. C. RUTH Femenino VENTA D. CALZADOS 5

S. L. RONALD JOSE Male VENTA D. ROPA 2

V. A. YOSIDA LOURDES Femenino VENTA D. VIVERES 2

V. A. WALDIR JOSE Femenino TAXISTA PROPIETARIO 3

A. A. MERCEDES Femenino TIENDA D. BARRIO 2

S. H. ANA ELVIA Femenino VENTA D. POLLOS 20

M. D. A. ROSSI CRISTINA Femenino VENTA D. COSMETICOS 3

C. Y. ESTELA Femenino VENTA D. ROPA 41

G. C. JHASMANI JUNIORS Femenino VENTA D. ENBUTIDOS 5

S. S. ANA MARIA Femenino REPARTO D. VIVERES 3

V. A. DAYSI RUTH Femenino VENTA D. VIVERES 2

C. D. MONTECINOS SONIA Femenino TIENDA D. BARRIO 3

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr:
Mrs. Rose E. was born around 1966 in Adja Dévé, in Couffo Department. She is a widow and the mother of two children – Blaisine Male, born on July 12, 1987 in Hagounmè, also in Couffo Department, and a student of business and marketing, and Pierrette Male, born on July 8, 1990. Mrs. E. trained as a secretary. Since 1994 she has been living in Sainte Rita, a neighborhood of Cotonou. Mrs. E. is on her third loan. She sells food products such as beans, corn, rice and manioc flour, and fruits such as oranges and bananas. She gets her supplies from the markets in Dogbo and Avoze in Couffo Department. Customer demand has increased, and since she does not have sufficient financial means to meet such demand, she is requesting this loan so she can better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame E. Rose est née vers les années 1966 à Adja Dévé dans le département du COUFFO. Elle est veuve et mère de 02 enfants MALE Blaisine née le 12 Juillet 1987 à Hagounmè toujours dans le département du Couffo est étudiante en Marketing et Action Commerciale et MALE Pierrette née le 08 Juillet 1990. Dame E. Rose est secrétaire de formation. Depuis 1994, elle réside à Sainte Rita, l'un des quartiers de Cotonou. Dame EPKE Rose est à son troisième crédit. Elle vend des produits vivriers tels que le haricot, le maïs, le riz, de la farine de manioc et des fruits tels que les oranges, les bananes, etc. Elle s'approvisionne dans le marché de DOGBO et de celui d'AVOZE dans le COUFFO. La demande des clients est devenue plus forte et n'ayant pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pour couvrir ces demandes, elle sollicite ce prêt pour satisfaire davantage sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 2 bags of wheat flour, 3 bags of rice, 4 bunches of bananas and 5 bags of beans.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio trabajaba como empleado en un empresa, pero al ver que no le alcanzaba con lo que ganaba ahí para solventara los gastos de la casa y de sus 3 hijos, decidió poner su propio negocio, fue así como empezó vendiendo un poco de abarrotes por su casa, pero al darse cuenta que era la única tiendita del fraccionamiento, y que todos los vecinos ahí iban a comprar, decidió establecerse como una tienda de abarrotes y así fue haciendo cada vez mas grande su negocio.

El necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para tener más inventario en su tienda para ofrecerles más productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Claudio used to work as an employee of a company, but when he realized that he wasn't earning enough to pay for his household expenditures and support his three children, he decided to open his own business. So, Claudio started selling a few groceries from his home. When he realized that his was the only little grocery store in the neighborhood and that all of his neighbors were doing their shopping there, he decided to officially establish his grocery store and started to expand it bit by bit.

Claudio needs a $250 loan to increase his store's inventory so that he can offer more products to his customers. He will repay this loan in three months.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Magezi Buggaga Lending Group

texts.en:
S. Lawrence is a married man with two children; he also cares for one orphaned child. All of the children attend the same primary school.

Lawrence has been a motorcycle mechanic in Kisoga for 7 years, and he has been a member of his lending group, Magezi buggaga, since its inception two years ago. He started getting loans in order to improve his business, and the loans taught him to save. He was able to buy a motorcycle of his own, which he uses a boda-boda (a bicycle or motorcycle taxi) to bring in extra income every day. He also started up a stall where his wife sells fresh produce and greens; this also helps to supply part of their household needs.

Lawrence is seeking for a loan to buy more materials for his workshop, including a tire pumping machine, screwdrivers, and many other tools.

loans.use: To buy a tire pumping machine, screwdrivers, and other tools for his motorcycle shop

loans.name: Seur

texts.en:
Mrs. Seur S. is a villager in Torm Ney village in Takeo Province. She is a 44 year old widow and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other two children are attending the local school. 

She owns a small piece of land used to cultivate rice to earn a living. Even though Mrs. Seur S.'s family members have different careers, they still do not make enough money to support their living conditions. Therefore, Mrs. Seur S. decided to request a loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes.. She hopes to increase her income when she sells her cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine T. is 28 years old and orginally from Guézin, a touristy lake village in southern Benin. She is married to Florentin Agonsanou, a building electrician, and has 3 children named Gladys, Floriane, and Mélaine. At 4 years old, she was placed and helped her to sell akassa (a Beninese snack made of corn flour and placed in a leaf) and fresh fish. Aferwards she went to beauty school for 3 years. Due to lack of funding she could not finish her schooling, and so she opened her own business after Glady's birth. She made little snacks of wheat flour and eggs; afterwards she accompanied her stepmother to Nigeria to buy wheat flour which she distributed at bakeries. For the last 3 years she has sold shoes to men and women that she buys from Chinese stores and resells in the Dantokpa Market. This is her third loan to buy more pairs of shoes.

Dame T. Christine est âgée de 28 ans et est originaire de Guézin un village lacustre du Bénin. Elle est mariée à AGONSANOU Florentin qui est électricien bâtiment de formation et est mère de 03 enfants ( Gladys, Floriane et Mélaine). Elle a été placée à l'âge de 4ans chez sa tante qu'elle aidait à vendre de l'akassa et des poissons fris. Ensuite, des sacs de juts, après elle alla en apprentissage de coiffure et ceci pendant 3 ans. Faute de soutien financier elle n'a pas pu obtenir le diplôme de fin d'apprentissage, elle s'est alors mise à son propre compte juste après la naissance de Gladys. Elle vendait des pasquettes faite à base de farine de blé et des oeufs; ensuite elle accompagnait sa marâtre au Nigéria pour l'achat de la farine de blé qu'elle distribue dans les boulangeries. Depuis 3 ans, elle s'est mise à vendre des chaussures dames et hommes qu'elle achète dans les magasins chinois et qu'elle revend dans le grand marché DANTOKPA. Elle sollicite ce 3eme prêt en vue de renforcer l'activité.

loans.use: Purchase of 6 boxes of different styles of shoes

loans.name: Jeaneth Del Carmen

texts.es: Jeaneth es soltera, de 44 años de edad, tiene una hija de 24 años de edad estudiante del 5to año de ingenieria en computacion, esta solicitando su 8vo credito para mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y el piso del dormitorio de su hija ya que pronto sera una profesional y quiere brindarle las condiciones basicas.  Con los creditos anteriores logro repellar y hacer la acera de su casa, poco a poco ha ido inviertiendo sus creditos en mejorar su vivienda pues con su salario se le hace imposible, pero con la atencion que ha recibido por parte de AFODENIC ha ido logrando cumplir sus sueños y espera poder llegar en un futuro a ser la propietaria de una vivienda digna para ella y su hija, que las madres hacen su mayor esfuerzo y sacrificio por el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jeaneth is single, is 44, and has one daughter who is 24 and in her fifth year of studying computer engineering. She is requesting her eighth credit to improve her home by putting on a new roof and putting a new floor in her daughter's bedroom. Her daughter will soon be a professional, and she wants to provide her with basic conditions. With her previous credits, she replastered and put a sidewalk outside of her home. Little by little she has invested her credits in improving her home since with her salary it would be impossible. But with the attention she has received from AFODENIC, she has succeeded in fulfilling her dreams and hopes to be able to arrive at a future where she will be the owner of a decent home for her and her daughter since mothers make their best effort and sacrifice for the well-being of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put a new roof on her home and replace a bedroom floor

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is 36 years old. She is a divorced woman with 1 brilliant child. Yaa is so proud of her son because he is academically good. Her son's performance manifests during his exams and his teachers confirm it. Her son is in the senior high school. Yaa lives with her family at Apatrapa in the Ashanti region of Ghana. For the past fifteen years all that Yaa has been doing to take care of her household is baking bread.

Yaa bakes bread and supplies it to the town around her and also sells some to individuals. Demand for the bread has increased as a result of constant supply and just-in-time (JIT) delivery. Her customers book their order in advance and before they come it is be ready. She says the price of commodities is increasing which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market. And the daily demand for bread is high. She says she bakes at most 1000 loaves of bread in a day.

Yaa needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk, and firewood, etc. to restock her inventory. Her dream is to secure a better future for her lovely son through her selfless hard work. That is quality education. Yaa belongs to a village bank called ‘Adwenpa’ which means "Good mind". She hopes to receive GHS 450 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more for taking care of their household.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Unimums Group

texts.en:
Mariam has been a food seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 4 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 125. Every day she works at her business from 7am to 4pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mariam is 32 years old, married, and has two children: ages 15 and 12. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Aisha, Sharifa and Aziza. Each woman has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia A., 26, is married with one child.  She has 2 years of experience in the Sewing/Cattle business. She sells to the public two days per week. She has two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Julia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy fabric and a new sewing machine.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Voeung

texts.en:
Voeung S., 45, has been a worker at a Cambodian Port for more than three years and currently gets a salary of $150 per month.  Her husband works with her at the same place.  (Voeung's husband, Sarann, is pictured.)  

She has two teenage children who go to school.   

Mrs. S. usually hires a neighbor's taxi to go to work everyday.  She hopes to reduce the cost of transportation.  Voeung is asking for a loan to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: Buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Heri Munna Llah Group

texts.en:
Fatma has owned a small ladies’ wear shop in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for six years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more ladies’ clothes for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Fatma is 32 years old, married, and has three children: ages 13, 7 and 3. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members: Siti, Sunnafi, Maryam and Amina. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: Ta buy more ladies' clothes for her business

loans.name: Dim

texts.en:
Mrs. Dim H. is 27 years old and a resident of the province of Kompong Tom, where she earns an income by making furniture for sale including those made from rattan. She usually sells her wares in bulk to her regular buyers who come to buy at her house, and they order a few days or a week in advance. Her husband is skilled as a carpenter and helps her in making furniture as well.

The couple has two young children who are still living in the family home. Because the family's house is too old and is collapsing frequently, Mrs. H. has decided to seek a loan of $1200 to add to her personal savings in order to build a new house. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
" I am a tenant of a 3-hectare farm and I need an additional capital to support my farming business. I wish to grow my harvest so that I would be able to save enough money to buy my own farm", says Shirley B., 41-year old mother of two children. 

She would like to ask a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides. " With my loan I will have the chance to improve my harvest and income as well", she said.

Through CEVI. Mrs. B. has developed strong entrepreneurial skills that she used to earn a living for her family. CEVI reached out a number of poor communities in the Philippines to help people get started a new business. CEVI provide with not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
S. Trần Thị (535020987) is a 46-year-old female living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has two school-aged children.

S. owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,800,000 VND a month.

In 1999, S. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

S. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 10th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Oliva

texts.es:
La señora Oliva, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación 2000”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente.  Es madre de 01 hijo y  tiene estudios de educación superior (educación.  Vive en el Barrio Alasaya.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la implementación de su negocio de venta de jugos.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su nuevo negocio,  atención en cabinas de Internet, parte del dinero lo utilizará para implementar este negocio.  Paralelamente continúa con la venta de jugos.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando y hacer crecer su negocio.

A ella le gusta la forma de trabajo de Manuela Ramos y las reuniones de los Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Ms. Oliva C. is a member of the “Nueva Generación 2000” Microfinance Institute, located in the Ilave district of the El Collao province, department of Puno. She is a 28-year-old with a live-in partner and a son. She completed secondary school and lives in the Alasaya neighborhood.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 5 years. She used her first 300.00 PEN loan in starting her own juice business. At this time, she needs a 3,000.00 PEN loan so that she can invest it in a new business—an Internet café. She will use some of the money in this venture, and she will continue with her juice business.

Her biggest wish is to continue working so that she can help her business grow. She likes the way Manuela Ramos works, and the microfinance institutes’ meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Launch internet café and purchase fruit

loans.name: Dương Thị

texts.en:
X. Dương Thị (537981034) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has three school-aged children. 

X. owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month.

In 2005, X. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

X. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 11th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rebelde Group

texts.es: En el centro focal  Santiago II, cada dos semanas, se reúne la asociación “Rebelde”, está conformado por dieciocho integrantes, demostrando responsabilidad en sus tres años de trabajo junto a Pro-Mujer. Diversos son los negocios de este grupo, tales como: venta de golosinas, elaboración de comida, tejido a mano de mantas y mantillas, pastelería, venta de cosméticos, confección de edredones, entre otros. Ellas desean ampliar su producción, para esto necesitan comprar mercadería y/o materia prima, tienen la seguridad que obtendrán mejores ganancias y por lo tanto mayores ingresos para sus familias.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, in the center of Santiago II, the “Rebel” Association meets. It is made up of 18 members and has demonstrated its responsibility in its three years of working together with Pro-Mujer (Pro-Woman). There are various businesses in this group including candy sales, food preparation, hand-woven blankets and shawls, cake baking, cosmetic sales, and quilt making, amongst others. They would like to expand production. In order to do this they need to buy merchandise and/or raw materials. They are certain they will increase their profits and thus have higher incomes for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: merchandise and/or raw materials

loans.name: Mirhalim

texts.en:
M. Mirhalim is 51 years old. He has experience of 2 years preparing and selling cookies and different kinds of sweets. He began working with a friend delivering bread. With the money he saved in the activity, he decided to buy an oven and now works as an independent with his wife. The business is successful, generating stable, considerable income, allowing Mirhalim to support his family. Mirhalim wants the Kiva loan to be able to buy products and necessary equipment for the preparation of the extra cookies, because at this time he is only supplying the part of the demand. With this loan he wants to expand his business, thus to be able to supply all of his customers and also to make better condition of the business. Mirhalim would like to thank everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan in time. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of Mirhalim’s business, and they will sincerely thank you. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new equipment and making better condition of the business

loans.name: Al Sadik Group

texts.en:
The group name is A. S.; it is made of five ladies, who are living in the region of the Bekaa, Lebanon. 

-Nasra is a 49 year old woman with eight children. Nasra has been working as agriculture for thirt years. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work. This is the first time that Nasra has requested a loan. 
Nasra is speciA. in her work because of her experience. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Nasra decided on doing her business because it is a demanding work in her region. In the future, she plans on expanding her work. 

-Sobha is a 42 year old woman. Sobha has been working as agriculture for twenty years. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work. This is the first time that Sobha has requested a loan. 
Sobha is speciA. in her work because of she likes what she does. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. In the future, she plans on improving her work. 

-ManA. is an 18 year old woman. ManA. has been working as agriculture for five years. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work. This is the first time that ManA. has requested a loan. 
ManA. is speciA. in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anybody from her region. In the future, she plans on improving her work. 

-Amira is a 24 year old married woman with three children. Amira has been working as agriculture for ten years. She owns a livestock. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Amira has requested a loan. 
Amira is speciA. in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anybody from her region. In the future, she plans on improving her work by expanding her livestock. 

-Najah is a 41 year old married woman with seven children. Najah has been working as agriculture for twenty two years. She has owned a livestock for ten years. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Najah has requested a loan. 
Najah is speciA. in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anybody from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on doing her business because that was the demand in her region. In the future, she plans on improving her work.


About Group Loans 
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individuA. loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To increase their livestocks.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um I. is 39 years old and sells wood wI. her husband in the Prey Veng province. Her business has been around for about four years and she makes a combine about US$2 of profit every day. Selling wood has been a difficult business, as the price of wood is higher than before. She is asking for a loan of US$800 to make two investments. She would like to both invest US$200 in her wood business, and also put US$600 to purchase a trailer and a motorbike to transport the wood. She sees these investments as opportunities that will be able to increase her daily income. (Um is pictured wI. her husband)

loans.use: To purchase a trailer and a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Will be use for her pig raising business, also for her fishing business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 50 year single mother of 2 children ages 30 and 32.  She resides and owns a five room house where she lives with four people. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.  

Mary owns a stall selling crafts in Mengo. She does her shopping from Kampala city and also from women groups in Mengo villages.  Her stall where she sells is on the outskirts of Kampala. On a typical day Mary receives 10 customers.  

Mary has been in the craft business for twenty years and she has been a client of MCDT for four years.  She is now servicing her eighth loan, and she is still working with the same group mates. 

Mary's monthly expenses include school fees and medication. Her challenges include defaulters and rainy season because when it rains very few customers come to her stall because it is in muddy place. Mary wants to use this loan to buy more crafts.  She is aspiring to see her business grow stronger and start selling only on wholesale basis.

loans.use: To buy more crafts for resale

loans.name: Lkhasuren

texts.en:
Lkhasuren T. is a 48-year-old hardworking businesswoman who lives with her husband and 2 children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. Her husband, Byambasuren, works as a welder, her daughter is a college student and her son attends a local high school. T. operates a dairy trade business at the local market in her town. She has operated this business since 1994 and has gained much experience over the years. Due to her hard work and good customer service practices, her business has grown steadily each year, and her working capital now exceeds 1,800,000 tugrugs. In addition, T.'s success has enabled her and her husband to enroll their children in good schools and have a quality life. For the future, she says, "My dream is to one day have my own store." T. is requesting a 2,800,000 tugrug loan to purchase more dairy products to sell.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products to sell

loans.name: Wojje Azeewo, Kayunga Group

texts.en:
Margaret K. is the leader of her lending group in Kayunga. She is a responsible married lady with school-going children. She also takes care of other orphans, including paying their school fees. With her husband, she farms bananas, maize, beans, cassava and sweet potatoes to sell. They have been able to buy a pickup truck to transport their produce to the market, plus they rent out the truck to others to bring in extra income. Additionally, Margaret and her husband own a motorcycle business and all these businesses help to run her home.

Margaret is requesting a loan to buy more quality seeds for the farm and to repair her motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying quality seeds for agriculture

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu M. is currently in the business of selling fresh vegetables in the market and is requesting a loan to stock maize flour to sell. Dudu is 40 years old and married to a taxation officer. She has three children and they all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to stock maize flour to sell

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mrs. Ry N. lives in Voat Svay village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2 hectares of land on which to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Chea Heng, owns a small restaurant that sells soup to the villagers. In this business, he faces a small problem because he does not have a motorbike for traveling to buy ingredients. His wife decided to ask for a loan to buy the motorbike for her husband's business purpose. Mrs. Ry N. is the mother of a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's business purpose

loans.name: Glyn

texts.en:
Glyn L. is from the village of Magsaysay Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Glyn is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Glyn owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Glyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Glyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Glyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units office covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Ofelia's Group

texts.en:
Ofelia J. is from the village of Faustino, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 53 years old. Ofelia is the group leader of a twelve-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ofelia is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Ofelia owns and operates a business selling AVON and Natasha cosmetics and apparel products to the local community. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $87 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José C. G. de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos, el mayor tiene 10 años y asiste al colegio de la zona la menor tiene 4 meses de nacida ellos viven en le Caserio de Pinillas - Ocucaje.
El sr. Trabaja desde hace 10 años en el transporte actualmente trabaja en el carro de su carro propio ya que lo ha logrado comprar con sus ahorros  ya que antes el sr trabajo como vigilante y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona ahorradora y muy responsable.
El sr. Trabaja diariamente desde las 7.00am hasta las 9.00 pm realizando colectivo de Ica – Ocucaje ida y vuelta este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 5 años
El goza de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos los cuales manifiestan que es una persona bien trabajadora.
El desea el financiamiento para poder mejorar su vivienda que fue un poco afectada por el terremoto también para matricular a su hijo y algunos gastos escolares.
texts.en:
José C. G. is 32 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two children. His oldest child is 10 years old and attends secondary school in the district. The younger child is 4 months old. José and his family live in the village of Pinillas – Ocucaje.

José has worked in the transportation sector for ten years. He currently works in his own car, which he was able to buy with his savings. José previously worked as a security guard and has always been known as a thrifty and responsible person. He works every day from 7am to 9pm for a collective and has been driving along the route between Ica and Ocucaje for the past five years.

José enjoys good references from his neighbors who vouch that he is a hardworking person. He is requesting a loan to make improvements to his home that was slightly affected by the earthquake. In addition, he will pay for his son’s enrollment and school expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for home improvements & his son's school expenses

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha Y. is 46 years old and has seven children, the eldest of whom is 23 years old. She invested her savings into a sari-sari (general) store business, and she also manages an eatery business. She decided to have multiple businesses because she wanted to earn more money for her family.
Editha is a client of Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional merchandise for her sari-sari and eatery businesses.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise

loans.name: Marylena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Este Sra. Se llama Marylena del Carmen V. Bulnes, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, es maestra de escuela primaria, tiene  una hija que está en escuela de secundaria, ella da clase en una escuela rural que se llama Reyna Sofía, la cual dista de su casa a unos 10 kilómetros aproximadamente de donde ella vive 

Con nuestra institución es el primer crédito que se le otorga, este crédito es para mejoramiento de su vivienda, de la cual ella es propietaria.
texts.en:
Marylena del Carment V. B.is 48 years old, a single mother, and an elementary school teacher. She has a daughter who is in secondary school, in a rural school called Reyna Sofia, which is about 10 kilometers from where they live. With our institution, this is the first loan that she has requested. It is for making improvements to her home that she owns.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of materials to improve her house, zinc plates, doors, etc.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Ana Mercedes B. S., es trabajador de la escuela Marcos Dessys se desempeña como sub-director del centro, es casada con dos hijas, ambas viven con ella pero no dependen de ella.

La señora Ana María B. S. solicito el crédito para repara el techo de su casa ya que lo tiene bien sarroso y se le pasa toda el agua cuando llueve, además que las puertas que tiene son tablones y necesitas comprarlas.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Mercedes B. S. works for the Marcos Dessys School as the center’s assistant director. She is married and has two daughters. They both live with her, but they are not dependents.

Sra. Ana Mercedes is requesting a loan to repair the roof of her house. It is covered with sediment from all the water when it rains. In addition, the doorways of her house have wooden planks covering them, so she needs to buy doors to install.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase zinc, crossbeams, and doors

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, who is married to Arturo, is 40 years old and has two children, both in college now. She sells furniture to earn a living. She and her husband both work hard to be able to have their two children finish college. She says that it is not that easy because school fees increase every year. Hoping for her furniture business to prosper, Marilyn is requesting a loan of Php12,000 from CEVI to buy wood, nails and other raw materials she needs for making furniture.

loans.use: Raw materials

loans.name: Juana Concepcion

texts.es:
Juana de 52 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Orlando Mejia con quien tiene  3 hijas, Katia de 32 años que le ayuda con el cuido de la casa y a los abuelitos, Keydi de 17 años que se acaba de bachillerar y Karen de 12 años en 2do año de secundaria. Juana trabaja para el MINSA SILAIS Chontales desde hace 15 años como Responsable de insumos.  Gracias a un proyecto de vivienda doña Juana obtuvo la oportunidad de tener su casa, la cual esta pagando con cuotas mensuales.

Esta solicitando  su 7mo credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa, construyendo una tapia para brindar mayor seguridad a su familia, ya que su esposo trabaja fuera de la ciudad y ella por su trabajo viaja durante la semana.  

El mayor deseo que tiene es poder tener una casa bonita y con las condiciones necesarias para que su familia se sienta comoda.
texts.en:
Juana is 52 years old. She and her husband Orlando Mejia have three daughters: Katia, age 32, who helps run the house and take care of the grandparents, Keydi, age 17, who is finishing high school, and Karen, age 12, who is in her second year of high school. For 15 years, Juana has been working in the Chontales division of the Ministry of Health’s Comprehensive Local Health System (MINSA SILAIS) as a manager of supplies. Thanks to a housing project, Juana was able to get her own home; she is now paying for it in monthly installments. Juana is requesting her seventh loan which will be used to make improvements in her home. She is building a fence wall to provide greater security for her family. This is especially important since her husband works out of town, and Juana herself also travels for work during the week. Her greatest wish is to have a nice house and all the conditions necessary to make her family feel comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a fence wall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Tusubira Women's Group 1, Lugazi

texts.en:
Her salon business is a beehive of activity. To all appearances, there is an outward appreciation written on the faces of her customers.

For 38-year-old, enterprising, Zilibagwa P. the last ten years have been eventful in terms of the checkered experiences she has gone through to get where she is now. Through the course of many of these experiences before she started this business, P., a housewife then, found herself at a constant wits end as she struggled to fully provide for her family’s needs. With this business opening, however, circumstances have improved a great deal. Her family's financial status quo has also improved a great deal.

At present, P. makes profits totaling up to 150,000 shillings a week. This is a far cry from, and in contrast to, when she was a housewife when odds seemed to be stacked against her. With a stable business running, she also rationalized that eking out side-profits constructing and running a rental and retail shop business where she sells blankets and mattresses, would not be a bad proposition.

P. has managed to reconcile all her duties well and her businesses are all driving a roaring trade. With this loan, she wants to buy more salon equipment and also improve her rental business.

loans.use: To purchase more salon equipment and also improve her rental business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of materials to replace his roof and build a wall around his house

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị (20213030050) is a 25-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  L. is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Cầu Gạo 2 (Nhóm 11).


L. is single and does not have any children.  To making a living, L. owns & operates a general store business venture.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Tô V. C. (0) is a 46-year-old man who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support his business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Trần Thị T. (0) is a 56-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her clothing business.


3.  Đinh Thị Hà (0) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Nguyễn Thị (20213030050) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các tH.nh viên.
